Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay in lively attractive well situated Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellamAuckland
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of a Kimpton hotel and we would certainly consider this group again. Kimpton means free Internet ,free happy hour and one or two other treats on arrival if you are a member( easy online sign up) This hotel is in an excellent position for the conference centre and town shopping and on public transport to the ferry building and fisher mans wharf. The large Westfield mall is just behind the hotel, also a supermarket. Union square is 2 blocks, and one block down market street is the excellent Bluestem restaurant. We had a one bedroom suite for family of 3 . Nice decor, light rooms looking out on market street, plenty of room which we appreciated. Onsite good room service, excellent restaurant, very good reception and concierge staff. Free bikes are available. Surprisingly little street noise. Beds were good. Cons- not much. A free breakfast would have been more use to us than free drinks at 5-6pm as we were never back by then. The layout of the suite means hard not to see the person in the sitting area pullout bed and they have to come through the bedroom to access the bathroom . There more suited to a family than friends especially as partition is slider doors. Not sure how big the double rooms are, our friend also staying separately wasn,t as keen on his outlook into an inner courtyard. Room tip: room 730 was a lovely junior suite with plenty of space. Overall a very nice experience here and we would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: BradSmith16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of jan 2012, very nice place, lot of business people stay there, great location on forth street, its a 2min walk to the westfield mall which is amazing and apple store right across the street, the cable cars are across the road and the trams right outside so you can go anywhere from your doorstep, the rooms are nice and have luxury bedding and nice decor, we got a breakfast every morning which was just fruit crosiants, fruit and coffee and juice.The staff are great too, numerous times we got advice from them about different things and they were more than happy to help, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Cool, but Not As...”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palomar several times, but this is my first review. The Palomar is a boutique hotel -- cool as a cucumber, and they know it. The hotel is attractive in a nouveau chic kind of way -- cool lines, earth tones, dark, everyone wears black, etc. But that's okay, I kind of like the look. The front desk is much friendlier than before -- they smile and greet you like an old friend, which after a long day, I appreciate. I asked for (and received the next morning) a specific newpaper, which I liked. (They normally provide the NY Times, but I'm a USA Today kind of guy). One thing they did not do, however, was look up my Klimpton number for me, a small annoyance. My room was tiny. Disappointingly so, as I've stayed in much larger rooms previously. Further, it lacked ammenities that I've enjoyed before -- it seemed a little stripped down. Finally, as an interior room, I had a view of other interior rooms. As a plus, I received a coupon for a free appetizer at the bar/restaurant on my floor (5th). Although I got there at the end of their meal service, the chef cooked up a pair of prosciutto croquettes, which were tasty. The service at the bar was excellent! The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable, and while the room was a little tiny, I still like this hotel. Finally, the location is excellent -- close to BART, right in Union Square for shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, classy room”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: Pros -Excellent location, right on Market street, 2 meters from the tram and train stop. (Train also access SFO airport). -Fantastic nice, modern room -you own gold fish in the room (nice touch - first time i see it at a hotel) -Free internet and minibar credit if you are a Kimpton member. -Closer proximity to restaurants, shopping, pharmacies. Cons -Service during my stay was okay, but not as good as the other Hotel Palomars. -My room was nice with windows facing the main street. But I believe some rooms face an internal courtyard. -No pool Another great stay at Hotel Palomar. It's fast becoming my favourite hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the "above and beyond" mentality of the staff (notably Josh - he's the BEST) my fiance's 50th birthday celebration was superb. From the moment we arrived, no detail was left unattended including dinner reservations and the wonderful little extras provided to honor my fiance's birthday and our recent engagement! Thank you, Josh, a million times over. The room was lovely and spacious, and the location was perfect for exploring the area. We even enjoyed meeting Maverick, Director of Pet Relations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, chic and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaHope
Reviews.Content: I recently did a girls-getaway weekend at the Palomar and felt pampered and spoiled by the staff. As a Kimpton In-Touch member, I got a personal e-mail in advance and then a "Raid the Minibar" card (so cute!) on arrival. My friends and I were given very nice, large rooms. I already knew I liked the Palomar because my husband and I were upgraded to a suite for our anniversary a year ago, but this time we got a lot of help and tips from the front desk staff. Lauren helped us with directions, travel and restaurant advice; Daniel recommended The Grove for breakfast, which we adored. The extra personalized service really made the difference for our stay, and that was on top of the great location (easy walk to SOMA and The Ferry Building, and right next to the BART) and freakishly comfortable bed. I will definitely be back, and often.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: libra_lori
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family (husband/kids) for 2 nights and our stay was fantastic. Very clean and comfortable; my children loved the robes that came in their size too. The location is perfect, lots of shops and places to eat close by and it's only a short walk to the cable cars that head to the wharf/pier. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Fog City”
Reviews.Author: dgsaltman
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for our anniversary weekend. What a great choice! Location can't be beat. BART from SFO in 30 minutes landed us right across the street from the hotel. Right by convention center, Union Square and Markey Street restaurants (at all price points). As central as it is the hotel was wonderfully quiet inside. All staff were lovely and seemed genuinely happy. Nice to stay at a place where everyone seems to like their job and enjoys making sure you're enjoying your stay. Room was large, clean and comfortable. Plenty of outlets for multiple phone chargers, iPads, etc. 5th floor lounge and restaurant (with wine reception each evening) allowed us to be as social or as private as we wanted. Great experience. I'd return without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IbnBututta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference I attended at the Moscone Centre. Pros: - Great location, close to shops and restaurants, street cars, busses - 5-10 minute walk to Moscone Centre - Great service by staff - Clean rooms and reasonably spacious - Free cocktails in the afternoon - I stayed on the higher floor and didn't have any issues with noise. Cons: - Extremely (and I stress the word) small gym, pretty pathetic actually. There is a gym a block away but you have to pay $20+ I think for it each day. - No swimming pool I would certainly consider staying again, although the gym size annoyed me the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and services”
Reviews.Author: seekbeauty
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is a boutique hotel with definite upscale taste. Great location for those wishing to stay in the Downtown/Union Square area. Enjoy the lounge on the 5th floor. As always, if you are trying to escape street noise, stay on a high floor! Great views of the City!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service excels at this Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zipporahs
Reviews.Content: This small Kimpton Hotel is tucked away amoung the busy city. With customer service that's some of the best that I have experienced, the comfortably decorated rooms - while not large still have the feel of luxury. Need just about anything? Just call the front desk & they'll have it for you pronto.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - perfect San Fran business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights, great location for business or leisure, comfortable bed, great staff, 5th Floor Restaurant was great, nice wine list. Just a word of caution, I was in the corner king on floor 5 and the cable car, street noise was a bit much - also the Old Navy was doing some major construction early in the mornings - not sure how long that will continue but I reco the higher floor rooms on 9 - all in all a great hotel, stayed at the Intercontinental last trip and I like the Palomar better.

Reviews.Title: “A respite from the chaos”
Reviews.Author: tallgirlonatrip
Reviews.Content: I found the Palomar to be the perfect getaway hotel within the chaos of the city. Refreshing strawberry and lemon water in the lobby, and the general manager's gorgeous chocolate lab there to greet all the guests make it a nice place to come home to after a long day of work. I missed happy hour, so they gave me a free wine coupon and a "Raid the Mini Bar" coupon, which I promptly used. All of the Kimptons are great, but I really enjoyed my time here. There is also a running club that meets at 7am!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar has earned a fan!!”
Reviews.Author: Lambert4
Reviews.Content: Before the recession, we stayed at The Ritz or Four Seasons...I like great hotels. Now...well times have changed. We have LOVED the Palomar in San Francisco! PERFECT location, great room, and I cannot say enough about the service. The people at the front desk have been so helpful and incredibly kind and welcoming to us!! One extra of many...The hotel offers bikes, free, to see and explore the city! Extra treats were in our lovely room, and wonderful suggestions for dinner. Fresh flavored water (cucumber, strawberry and orange) that is so refreshing available all day and evening. I cannot say enough about the hotel and certainly recommend it!! The general manager has put together quite a team. Congratulations Hotel Palomar! You have earned a fan!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other Kimpton hotels!”
Reviews.Author: NDGUPTA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The trip started off nicely, the doorman was welcoming and so was the person at the front-desk. However, the person took about 20-25 minutes to check me in as the 'computer was working very slowly' that day. After that, I had called for a cab and the person told me he will call me back in 5-10 minutes and never called back. When I tried ordering something from in-house dining on the day I was leaving, the line got transferred to front desk and again the person said he will ask in-house dining to call me back. However I waited for 30 minutes and then it was too late to order something as I had no idea when they would get the food and I had to leave for the airport (I also had to arrange the cab myself as the hotel staff was not helpful). However, I really liked the location of the Hotel, Market street is adjacent and so is the Powell-Hyde cable car, Asian Art Museum area and other major attractions in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Started off rough...”
Reviews.Author: BreamMoBunch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of March for three nights attending a conference. Pros: Great location, nice room, comfortable bed and free WiFi if you are a Klimpton member (or become one, as I did), free wine was nice. Cons: they are renovating Old Navy and the first night I was up from 2-5 am, one morning the coffee was gone at 7:45 am. The staff was great and moved me to a new room (same kind, not an upgrade like I requested) after the first night. They acknowledged the problem with the construction and took the night off my bill. I will definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco - Cold and Windy”
Reviews.Author: azjayhawks
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at the Palomar Hotel. The location is great for getting around the city and the staff is superb. The only fault we had with the hotel was the restaurant. We only had one meal there - breakfast - and amazingly enough the restaurant screwed up a simple omelet by adding pickeled onions rather than sauted onions. Otherwise, we would highly recommend the Palomar, but the next time we are in San Francisco we would probably stay at one of the other Kimpton property closer to Union Square. We asked the concierge to assist us in making arragements for the tour of Alcatraz, and when the concierge noticed that my birthday was coming up in April, we later received a birthday card, box of candy and a bottle of wine! Very thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Always an Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anita B
Reviews.Content: I really prefer not to stay anywhere but at the Palomar when I am in San Francisco! The staff, the location and overall service is fabulous and is something that you will never forget. Rachel Jang, Lauren and the staff always make you feel like you're at home when you stay there, the service is absolutely genuine! When I know that I am going to San Francisco, I really choose no other place than the Palomar! Also, the daily events and the nightly wine hour are superb!

Reviews.Title: “Taking service to the max....”
Reviews.Author: Gingertaff1403
Reviews.Content: The Palomar was the last stop in our 8 day trip around San Fran and its surroundings. My fiancee contacted them in advance to tell them that it was a special event (my 40th Birthday) and we were lucky enough to speak to Lauren - she is the concierge who really could not do enough. From the moment we left our hire car with the doorman to the moment we left in a hotel car, we were treated like royalty. Lauren had upgraded our room, and left champagne and strawberries in our room as a celebration - and then also gave vouchers for free cocktails in the fabulous 4th Floor bar and restaurant. The location of this hotel is a great base for downtown SF, with Chinatown, Union Square all within easy touching distance. The reception team including amongst others Bobby, were also more than helpful when looking at recommending local restaurants. In all they could not do enough for us - thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: AdaminDC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar San Francisco is a beautiful boutique hotel in a perfect location. The staff is cheerful and professional, and they go well out of their way to make one's stay memorable. Great attention to detail, such as chilled flavored water available in the lobby and complimentary coffee and tea every morning on the fifth floor, complimentary wine reception every evening. Pet friendly, and, just in case you didn't bring your own, "companion goldfish" are available to have in your room during your stay. I was upgraded to a wonderful suite (presumably because I am an "inner circle" member of their InTouch program), which was spacious and beautiful. All of the guest rooms have comfortable furniture, great beds, excellent amenities, nice bathrooms (some with terrific soaking tubs) and hip, modern decor. The location on Market Street is ideal. A wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to book but great when you get here”
Reviews.Author: wqxr
Reviews.Content: I used KAYAK.COM with price alert (sorry tripadvisor) and kept receiving email alerts for much less than any other site offered at hotelclub.com. Clicking on the link, it gave the much higher price offered by everyone else. I contacted Kayak and they said 'It's not our fault. We could not help it.' (For those who have read "Atlas Shrugs") I called the 800 # for hotelclub.com and the woman who answered finally was able to book the room at the advertized price. My Bank of America then charged me $15 for an 'international booking' (I was in NY, made the purchase for a CA hotel room in $. Another call to get that charge cancelled. "The hotel?" you ask. Very close to the Moscone Convention center. Staff very friendly. Theme - dark woods. Room good size clean and comfortable (more pillows than I needed) with mini bar but no coffee machine. WiFi worked well with strong signal in my room. Complimentary breakfast coffee/tea (no food) in bar area from 7 am and white/red wine 5-6pm. Small 24 hr gym. Did not eat in their restaurant but plenty of good choices within easy walk including, and, if moderately active, Chinatown. Cable car (tourist) or bus (go on the cheap) to Fisherman's Wharf. For the price I paid, the best value in the neighborhood. Free NY Times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: neenee09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work conference for a week. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very nice, helpful, and accommodating. I loved the wine reception every evening that featured wines from the area. Close to a great shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “One of My All Time Favorites”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTravel
Reviews.Content: When visiting San Francisco the Palomar is perfect! Great location, quiet rooms, great restruant, wonderful bar with an excellent bar goddess! This Pet friendly hotel greets you with its own resident dog at check in! When in San Francisco this is the perfect combination of location, staff, food, drink, lodging!! What more could you ask for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff & location”
Reviews.Author: mtolba
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel was at the start of a trip I had with my wife to California and Vegas where we spent 3 nights at that hotel. From a shopping perspective the location is superb but I would downgrade to 4 stars as goin west is towards a bit of a dodgy area (Tenderloin) but thats towards midnight. The remaining of the experience was superb the room was well furnished but a bit small. The staff were extremely polite, helpful and would provide continuos tips on things to do. The fifth floor cofee was outstanding and so was the breakfast. In general I would love to go back to this place to get a real flavour of San Francisco only avoid Tenderloin late at night but rather than that you have everything you could imagine around you,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Nightshade08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of March 3-5. Great location, close to everything. The room was nice, clean. Comfortable beds with wonderful linens. I am a member of Kimpton In-Touch (easy to sign-up) so we were offered a wine reception every day at 5:00pm and complimentary coffee/tea from 6-10am. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: alysec
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel it turned out there had been a mistake (possibly by the travel agent booking the hotel) and were were assigned a king room instead of twin room. This was no problem and we were given the room we required immediately. The location of this hotel is exellent for dining and shopping. It is also near streetcar stop which goes to (among other places) Fisherman's Wharf and where the ferry to Alcatraz leaves from. It is also within walking distance to the SF Museum of Modern Art and Jewish Museum. The people working at the hotel were friendly and polite; they couldn't have been better. The room was excellent. I am particularly picky about bathrooms being clean and new and these were perfect. There was plenty of cable channel on the television. The view from our room of Market street was great. The beds were very comfortable and our room was spacious. If I return to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeco2006
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at some kimpton hotels throughout trips to the USA and have had mixed experinces but this hotel definitely belongs to the nicer ones. The greatest bonus is its convenient location for visiting San Franciso. Its located atop an Old Navy Store which you can look into through its glass roofs from some rooms. Many attractions in downtown San Francisco are in walking distance, the metro and the tram have stops in front of the hotel. Our spacious room was clean and the bathroon was also spacious and modern. The bed was very big and comfortable to sleep in all of which led us to enjoy our stay. The staff at the reception was very freindly and helpful when we asked for the way upon arrival. The only negative aspect was the "free breakfast" which we were given vouchers for when we arrived. To make it short it was a great disappointment. It was served in a fabulously designed room (which is also used as a lounge/bar in the evening) which was crowded with the hungry breakfast crowd and then there was only one guy who was supposed to serve the breakfast. The only help he got was a young girl who seemdd overwhelmed with the situation. We had to wait very, very long for the simplest coffee which was for free. The Danish which followed was a joke as a breakfast serving. We had breakfast in town on the next morning. As Kimpton prides itself to be a designer hotel brand they should definitely rethink this breakfast concept. I think most travellers are willing to pay for a nice, good breakfast. But what they served for free doesnt go together with a Kimpton hotel guest's expectations rather with a hostel backpacker. Except for this breakfast desaster we can really recommend this hotel if you want to explore San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Montrealer26
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The staff was super nice and informative, the rooms are great at the free hot chocolate/flavored waters were such a nice treat. I never went for the wine and cheese but that a nice option. The coffee and teas in the morning were fantastic. Okay aside from fun free food, the location is pretty good. You're right downtown so have access to a bunch of sites and great shopping and then it's an easy bus ride (or two) to get you basically anywhere else you want to go No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyboxTO
Reviews.Content: We visit San Francisco every few years and as our friends no longer have rooms to spare, we stayed in a hotel this time. We had a wonderful experience here. The room, while small, was well-appointed with nice bath products and linens and a very comfortable bed. It was also surprisingly quiet given the location and we loved the little touches like the in-room goldfish and the "welcome" sign for the four-footed guests. We did not have any meals in the restaurant, but did enjoy the lobby refreshments, the complimentary wine and other beverages during the "happy hour" and found the service to be excellent. The staff were very friendly and attentive. We would absolutely stay there again and I have recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice and convenient hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: RobertKaren
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel when they advertised a special rate well below the usual 5 star rate they charge. The hotel is in a great location and very comfortable. Friendly, non intrusive staff. Loved the life floors.

Reviews.Title: “A little overrated, but a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar expecting an amazing experience. Don't get me wrong it wasn't awful; as soon as I arrived Josh at the front desk was very pleasant and accommodating. I was upgraded to a suite for being an In Touch Kimpton member (I recommend everyone joins - so many great perks). The room was large, clean and cozy. The bathroom on the other hand had a very musty smell in the shower. There was soap scum on the walls which is very simple to clean (Tilex). I was a little grossed out. Upon exiting the hotel, it seemed as if the bell boy (with a whistle) was never at the door. I kindly asked him to help me catch a cab and all he did was blow the whistle a couple of times and then continued to talk to a limo driver. (please note* the cab drivers have their windows up; I'm not sure how effective that whistle is). After waiting 40 minutes I just walked away. At the end of my stay, it was time to check out- the front desk agent was sitting on a chair while checking me out. I get it, it's 5am and no one is around; if you have a guest in front of you, just stand up-it's rude. Overall, it was an average experience- I was really expecting more. Ps. The Gym is so small, only 3 pieces of cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect location to see everything in San Francisco"”
Reviews.Author: freedom71
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of time trying to find the perfect location/hotel as I been to San Francisco on a brief visit and was now going back to see as much as I could. This hotel was perfect. Got the BART from the airport which took me straight to a station right outside the hotel. it was perfectly located close to Union Square which is a good starting point to see everything. Trolley car outside the hotel took me far and wide and I could also walk to Chinatown, The Embarcadero, and all the shopping you could wish for. Plenty of eating and museums. The doorman would give us plenty of information when we needed it and we also said Hi to "Maverick" every morning. Take part in the wine tasting each night ! Will definitely reccomend this to anyone heading to SF and I will be back. Great value for money and one of the best finds in all my travels

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: evilexis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a suite with 2 toddlers. they brought a fishbowl with goldfish for the kids. super helpful staff. right near some great restaurants, the SF MOMA, yerba buena center: lots of great stuff for the kids. as with any kimpton hotel, there is a wine event each night. just a cozy feel. the decorations were not as nice as other kimptons I've stayed at, but overall a great city weekend place for families with small kids, or a couple alone.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality like they mean it!”
Reviews.Author: jordanja
Reviews.Content: Consider this hotel if you want most excellent customer service, a great hotel restaurant, and modern decor not to mention a goldfish for your room upon request! We were late to arrive with an early flight out the next day so it was wonderful to have things arranged when we arrived. Ask for an interior room if you wish a quiet location. Free wine from 5-6 p.m. Located in the heart of San Francisco near Union Square within an area filled with upscale shopping options. Easy to access via BART for 8.10 one way from SFO-get out at Powell. One half block walk from station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Leena F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar in late November. The staff at this hotel are exceptional. They are very friendly, knowledgeable but most of all helpful. The hotel itself is lovely. The location is great, close to public transport (BART) but also near many shops. Our room was very modern and spacious, with two double beds. Did not hear ANY noise from other guests staying on our floor, in fact it felt like we had the whole floor to ourselves. The rooms were very clean and maid service was very efficient. Loved the the three types of flavoured water available in the lobby and the free morning coffee, tea and hot chocolate available to all guests. The hotel really goes the extra mile to make your stay comfortable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are very good”
Reviews.Author: HarveySylver23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 3 nights over the weekend. We paid for an upgrade to the deluxe suite. When we arrived, we were a little disappointed in the room. It was very clean, but felt a bit tired, and for the money we were paying, expected much more. That said, the size was good, and the bed was very comfy. What made our stay really enjoyable was the staff. We told them what we thought and they did everything they could to help out. Offered other rooms, gave us a discount on the bill and free movies for the kids. They could not have done more, so a big thank you to them (Rachel, Josh, and Michelle), will stay with Kimpton Hotels again if all the staff are this good.

Reviews.Title: “A much needed respite”
Reviews.Author: ASayre
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in town on business. The location was fantastic - I could get just about anywhere without the use of taxis. It was quiet and, given that I was working full days, I felt well taken care of and could get much needed rest. The room was spacious and my overall stay was much better than I expected. I will be back - next time for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: sbcutie01
Reviews.Content: Exceptional views and perfect location. Quiet, clean rooms with free wine tasting offered in the lobby. What a wonderful way to spend our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Great Staff, Hosted Wine”
Reviews.Author: SJaneSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Palomar is situated close to Moscone Center and BART - great location for shopping and dining. Bristol Farms market is just around the corner to purchase any food or sundry items you might need for your stay. I buy soy milk for coffee or cereal and the refrigerator in the suite works well to keep small items chilled. The Palomar staff makes this hotel special. Asid provides a warm welcome and help with your transportation needs. Asid along with Lauren and Dennis at the front desk are shining examples of the best of Kimpton staff. Excellent dining advice and help for just about anything you need for business or vacation. Hosted evening wine hour is appreciated. I get a suite each visit as I use the sofa seating area and refigerator to host business guests or family when needed and it can be separated from the bedroom by double doors. Deep soaking tub is a relaxing option. The inner facing rooms are very quiet in the midst of this busy city. Wireless internet was fast and easy to connect. This is a little gem of a hotel in San Francisco. Prescott is also a good Kimpton choice with a special concierge lounge but not as convenient a location as Palomar for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!”
Reviews.Author: Lozzari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar in Union Square, San Francisco for 4 nights between Christmas and New Years and we very impressed. From the moment we arrived the staff were extremely helpful and friendly making sure that we felt right at home. Staff went above and beyond offering suggestions of things to do and see. The free bikes were awesome and we made good use of them riding all over the city through Golden Gate Park and across the GG bridge. The hills add to the charm and after indulging in the food and drink San Fran has to offer, the calorie burn was welcome! The location of the Palomar is fantastic with shopping, restaurants, bars and cafes all around. Be sure to check out China Town and the Italian section- both within walking distance and easy to get to. Public transportation is easy to use when staying at the Palomar too with the bus stop right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, excellent staff service”
Reviews.Author: FondofTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Palomar for an event at the Moscone Center. It's very convenient to walk to Moscone and there are lots of shops, restaurants and cafes nearby. If you want to sightsee, it's very close to Union Square to pick up a cable car and get around the town. The service levels are very good -- doormen, front desk and garage attendants. The room was nicely appointed. We had an amazing dinner at the Fifth Floor restaurant in the hotel one night plus delicious food at LuLu and The Grove from hotel recommendations. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: FloranteSL
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel seems plain and run-of-the-mill. But the inside and the personnel are a gem. Mr.Chris Smith our hats off to you! You run an excellent hotel with an equally excellent staff. We have been to San Francisco so many times before and stayed at different place. We have finally found a place we would like to go back to. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Worked out well”
Reviews.Author: deestu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to see Bob Seger in Oakland but wanted to stay in San francisco. I chose the Palomar because rooms were on sale and the proximity to the Powell St BART station. Everybody was friendly and helpful. Valet parking was on sight and you had full access to your car. The room was very clean and quite large for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Figuier721
Reviews.Content: So glad I chose this hotel! For a starter you won't have to drag your suitcase uphill since the hotel is located within a minute from BART Powell station. They offered me a room upon my arrival which was about 10AM in the morining, at this point I was already a fan of this hotel. Although hotel does not offer in room coffee maker, they do serve complimentary coffee (Bicycle Coffee) every day (6-10AM) at 5th floor, which completely wins over in-room sometime lame coffee. Definitely a choice if you need "good" coffee in the morning. Anyway, I can't think of any cons to this hotel; location, quietness,cleanliness, friednly staff and safety. Oh, only 1thing; no frige in the room. Would be nice to have one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and well located for shopping...”
Reviews.Author: ASWh
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the staff at the Kimpton are very welcoming and go out of their way to help. The lady on the front desk arranged directly with our car hire company to drop off at a location across the street which was great. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Had a slight issue that our door was stiff and heavy and the key didn't always work but not enough to make a complaint. The bathroom door is a sliding door so again a little heavy but we got used to that. Lots of coffee available in the mornings. As Kimpton in touch members we got a $10 raid on the minibar which is a nice touch. Only downside is the bar area which doesn't take full advantage of the location as it has no view. The lobby area on the 5th floor was a little impersonal which was a shame as thats where they held the drinks reception each evening. Other than that, it's a great hotel and located in Market street in the same block as the Nordstrom shopping mall, and about 5 mins from Union square.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: aguyinthe818
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this kimpton property based on my perfect stay in September. Love the location, easy walk to so much. Daniel at the front desk remembered me from my previous stay and made sure all my requests were handled despite being sold out that weekend. Luxury King room was lovely with a gigantic spa tub and views of market street. This is my go-to hotel in San francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, OK food”
Reviews.Author: cjdeperro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar with my partner for a weekend in early December, 2011. As other reviewers mention, the service was wonderful..including the friendly front desk staff, the phone staff who worked out some details on my reservation before I arrived, the bellman, valet attendants, and the restaurant waiter. The room was the "basic" room but was very, very nice...well laid out, good space. The bathroom was good, had hot shower with good pressure, though we need to talk about the toiletries. WHAT HAPPENED TO AVEDA??? That's one of the reasons I love(d) Kimpton Hotels...the wonderful Aveda products. The new stuff...some Italian stuff I never heard of...was scented horribly and too strongly. In addition, it's virtually impossible to read the different tubes in the shower so you don't know if you're getting shampoo, conditioner, or lotion...and then the caps are separate asking to be dropped down the drain. Even if you don't get Aveda back, get something else!! We didn't have dinner at the Fifth Floor Restaurant but we did have breakfast. It was just OK....not much of a choice, and they goofed up both mine and my partner's order (and there was no one else in the restaurant with us). They did comp the drinks to make up for it thought. Valet parking was pricey but really, really convenient and really friendly. I would return again!

Reviews.Title: “A front desk staff person made this a great stay for us”
Reviews.Author: concetta f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a longer trip the the States and had no specific plans, so relied on the advices of one of the front desk staff, Rachel. She was great and took us under her wing, asking us what sorts of things we were interested in and then giving us a great timetable of activities to match those interests. We found her friendly, helpful and accommodating. She also helped us by providing us with a quieter room when we asked. Nothing was too much trouble. The bellhops and doormen were also very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was comfortable, and while the rooms are not large they are comfortable. The Hotel is in a great location, close to transport and shopping. Our one disappointment was the restaurant which serves a minimal menu for breakfast, has too few staff on and provides a very average breakfast. However, as other good eating places are nearby to the hotel, this was not a particular issue. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Samantha S
Reviews.Content: I've never had a bad experience at any Kimpton hotel, and this experience continued that trend. Upon arrival the staff is so friendly and accommodating and the rooms are so trendy and comfortable! We loved the happy hour (everyday!) at the 5th Floor restaurant and had a great time exploring the city from the convenient location. Definitely plan on returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like part of the family”
Reviews.Author: jennifer n
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Palomar in San Francisco recently for business and could not have been happier with my stay. The front desk staff was the best I have ever seen and they went above and beyond to make sure our stay was wonderful. I locked myself out of my room and the front desk staff was there in about 1 minute to joyfully unlock my room and ask if I needed anything else. Their service was always prompt and everyone seemed happy to do whatever we needed. The entire staff was wonderful and I never passed a staff member who did not greet me and ask how my stay was. I would most definitely stay at the Palomar any time I am in San Francisco and recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not all Klimptons are created equal; especially the front desk part”
Reviews.Author: Casualfamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to another stay at a Klimpton hotel, having thoroughly enjoyed my most recent stay at a Klimpton hotel in another city. My previous experiences involved extremely friendly and helpful staff members. The friendly people I encountered at this particular Klimpton hotel were the doormen, the valet, and the maid. It would probably help the overall feel of the hotel if the personalities of the doormen could be transferred to the front desk personnel. It's not that the front desk persons I dealt with during my stay were mean; they were ambivalent and there to earn a paycheck (like dealing with the DMV). Upon arriving at the front desk to check in (around 9:00 PM), I quietly waited to see if the clerk would look up from her handheld screen. I probably should have been vocal, but I was not in a hurry and was a bit intrigued by her fixation on whatever message it held. When she looked up, I have absolutely no idea what she said, but I assumed it was some sort of greeting. All I really got from her monotone monologue was that the bar on the 5th floor opened at midnight and that I had to use the free drink coupons then. Luckily the key pouch had my room number on it. The room itself has the same amazing sheets and bed as my other Klimpton stays. This decor of the room is better described as a business hotel than as a boutique hotel. Everything was clean, but worn (especially the carpet). It's basically a Marriott caliber room with Motel 6 carpet and a heavenly bed. The leopard skin and zebra skin robes in the closet that felt like they were several years old sum up the ambiance of the room. It's in a great location in terms of being able to walk to anything (BART, Chinatown, North Beach, the Moscone Center, and so on). I think it's overpriced for what you get, and if you are looking to be in that area at a lower price, you can find a few places close by. As instructed by the front desk clerk, I waited until just before midnight for the bar to open only to get there at 11:58 and learn they were closing. The waitress couldn't have been happy by the timing of my arrival, but was professional and offered a compromise of getting an easy to pour drink. I appreciate that she was willing to stay a little past the end of her shift to accommodate the fallout of my not getting valid information from the front desk clerk. The bar and restaurant are very well appointed and stylish. I think a heads up that parking was going to cost $51.30 a night would have been nice. That's not a typo either, we're talking $51.30 to store a car for fourteen hours on a weekend. I definitely got the feel that this hotel was all about the money. Dropping $289 + tax for a room and $51 for parking should have gotten me much more in terms of style. It was an okay stay, but one I'll never do again at this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the NE corner of the 5th floor”
Reviews.Author: everett_rainier
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Palomar in San Francisco. In terms of service, cleanliness, etc., everything met the lofty expectations set by my first stay. The problem I had with my room was that it was directly above the Old Navy beneath much of the hotel. As my trip was over Thanksgiving weekend, Old Navy was open for part of Thanksgiving and very, very early on Black Friday. I was treated to some terrible music both carried up from the store and from a transient synthesizer player (synthesist?) starting at about 3am. Needless to say it made sleep a bit difficult. I paid a little extra this trip for a corner room. It was certainly more spacious, but the space was not utilized well. The bathroom was not upgraded either. Not sure if I'd do the corner room again (even on another floor). The basic room I stayed in previously was ample enough. If you have the need for a roll-away bed, the corner room would be perfect, though. I hate to add this last gripe, as I could have potentially resolved the problem with a phone call but didn't. The pillows were huge and too firm. As a side sleeper, I was too askew to be comfortable. Not sure if the hotel has alternate pillows available and I should've made an effort to find out. Despite the negative tone of my review, I would definitely stay at the Palomar again. It is still one of the best values I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle K
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our quick trip to the city and cannot stop raving about The Palomar. Our room was beyond expectations and the staff was amazing. Lauren took our reservation and pushed it to the next level! When we checked in Matt (doorman) had bubbles and crafts for my sons. Rachel who checked us in, got us to our fabulous room very quickly. Then they sent up snickers bars for my sons. I truly could not ask for anything more. The staff made this a PERFECT family holiday get-a-way. Rachel even helped me hide Christmas gifts from my sons. We can hardly wait for our next trip to SF and the Hotel Palomar. They made us feel like 'the one and only' guest in the what appeared to be a full house.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite San Francisco hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gogogoin2010
Reviews.Content: With so many Kimpton hotels to choose from in the San Francisco area the Palomar is now my favorite. The Market and 4th location is centrally the best… especially for a shopper like me. Union Square is just up the street, the Westfield mall is a half block away… and the cable car stop is about the same distance… what more can one ask for!? The fact that it is a Kimpton hotel means coffee in the morning and cocktails in the afternoon! While I didn’t get to take advantage of it, there is also a fabulous restaurant on property. The rooms are of average size for a metropolitan city; mine overlooked Market St. It was comfortable and pleasant to return to. The front desk staff is wonderful, very helpful, well-informed AND personable!!! I also loved the fact that they set u p car service for me to the airport for just about the same amount as a cab; LOVE the attention!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: clivebear
Reviews.Content: Reception remembered us from last year... Everything was excellant please bring back aveda products...new are too strong perfumes

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Kimpton Doggie Customer here”
Reviews.Author: tiglao
Reviews.Content: Love the Kimpton Chain. Woof. This is one of our favorite hotels. Great Customer Service. Ryman (the bellman) was very helpful. Checking in was a breeze, they even gave a printed map to our human and pointed her to the direction of the restaurant she had reservations that night. The room is clean. It is also spacious, unlike Sir Francis Drake (Also a Kimpton Hotel) Unlike Sir Francis Drake, Palomar Staff provided us with a Doggie Bed, Treats and Dog Bowls. Thank you!!! Woof Woof! The hosted wine hour was a nice touch.. Wished it had a small patch of grass closer than by the church and the jewish museum.. when I need to go in a hurry we had to ruuuun. Mr. Ly (manager) was very nice to us. He was able to accommodate a late-check-out for us.. Which was absolutely helpful.. our human had time for a nice lunch and a walk in the surrounding area. We love walks. The Valet Staff was very very friendly and helpful. He was so nice to us... he even petted us. Too bad I did not get his name.. but woof woof to him too. Thank you Kimpton for starting this brand of boutique hotel chains that are extremely pet-friendly. We like visiting it. Your staff also make it a great place to stay. I hope you take care of them like they take care of us and our humans. Paws up. Woof! -Chewy and Captain

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton scores again”
Reviews.Author: wgr
Reviews.Content: My bias is that I am a Kimpton fan and the Palomar SF did not disappoint. Kimpton to me means a friendly, welcoming, well trained staff. Check. The location is fabulous. One block from the Powell Street BART station, handy for coming and going to SFO ($8.10 pp each way). The cable cars begin at the Powell Street Station, San Francisco Centre is 1/2 block away, Union Square is 2-3 blocks depending on which you walk, the SFMOMA is three blocks away and in between is the Contemporary Jewish Museum (great Houdini exhibit). With regard to the rooms, it was probably my least favourite Kimpton (Philadelphia is my favourite so far). We were in a corner suite which was a bit oddly shaped with colours that were not warm or otherwise appealing. People have mentionned the noise of Market Street but while we were conscious of traffic particularly if an ambulance or police car went by with siren on, it was not at all obtrusive. We were however on the 8th floor. The Fifth Floor restaurant was kind of disappointing; we only had breakfast there and it was mostly empty and the food was nothing to write home about (my poached eggs on an English muffin were not runny but solid; the fruit salad was almost flavourless. You had coffee next to the restaurant which was fine with plenty of NYTimes all around. It was our anniversary and the hotel provided a complimentary cheese plate and sparking apple cider (we were offered champagne but we are teetolers.) However, overall it did not disappoint and we will be back-just as soon as San Francisco improves its cab situation.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but Monaco is better”
Reviews.Author: Minke5
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hotel Monaco a few times before and really loved it. I wasn't as impressed with the Palomar. It didn't seem as clean and the room just wasn't very warm. I would choose the Monaco over the Palomar whenever possible. Everything else was fine, but just not wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “They need to change their front desk staff and their policies.”
Reviews.Author: MsBula
Reviews.Content: An officious front desk staff person did not bother to advise us that we had been assigned a one bed room when we booked in, despite us having booked and paid for in advance a twin room. Then as soon as i saw the room, I rang and requested the room we had booked, he said in a derogatory way that with 'your kind of booking we can't guarantee that kind of room availability and unfortunately there isn't any twin rooms available for the entire duration of your stay' (several days!) which I clearly understood to be a lie. He then offered to bring up a rollaway and he would generously waive the $35charge! He had also not provided sufficient numbers of complimentary breakfast vouchers for our stay, which I hadn't noticed until we were in our room requiring me to provide an explanation to the hotel staff taking over in the morning. I have booked and paid for in advance rooms in many states across the US and have never had any issue with getting the room i booked! The room itself was small and situated right next to the air conditioners so was noisy. I am a Kimpton hotel member and paid full price for the room months in advance! I will never book there again, and would not recommend. It is expensive, the staff are rude and their policies uncompetitive. In a nutshell, vote with your feet! Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love Kimpton - Great time at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: allysonnicole
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Palomar after switching from a disaster hotel situation. We're from the D.C. area and have stayed with the Palomar there, so thought we'd give San Fran's version a try with the great last-minute deal we got. Had such a wonderful time. The room was large, clean...only drawback was that they're doing construction across the street (but that's out of their control). Super helpful and friendly. The location was great for walking around and exploring. Don't forget to sign up for your inTouch membership so you can "Raid The Bar" in your room and keep an eye out for their friendly friend behind the concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar S.F. - Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: joanathang
Reviews.Content: We travel often and have stayed in top-ranked hotels around the world. Honestly, we loved this hotel! It is perfectly located, especially if you love to shop or need to be at the convention center. We have never encountered a friendlier or more helpful staff. Our room was perfect...nice decor, clean, and quiet with all the amenities. The bathroom was spic and span. We really felt like we were guests in a family member's home. We can't wait to return to S.F. and most certainly shall stay here again. We recommend Hotel Palomar without reservation! You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Twice as Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Runderful
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice for a local marathon. Here is why everyone should stay here: 1)Location 2) Beds-Awesome 3) Comfy Robes 4) Wine reception at night & coffee in the morning with great newspapers 4) Staff know the city and make great reccs 5) QUIET-ask for a quiet room and you shall recieve. 6) GOLDFISH IN YOUR ROOM IF YOU REQUEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room & staff”
Reviews.Author: italygoodness
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a beautiful 2-room suite for our anniversary stay - room 507 was awesome. Nice city view, killer location, super comfy bed, nice/comfy couch & chairs, large bathroom (**but SERIOUSLY tiny shower...almost cannot fit in it as a skinny female), and very nice common areas. They even sent us some bubbly and local chocolate with a hand written note...very nice touch. The only real disappointment, aside from extra charges for internet, the tiny shower was that our room rate increased over 3x's the online booking rate, simply because a big convention came to town...seemed a little over the top to gauge business travelers like that. Ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Shopping and Transport”
Reviews.Author: Howlar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is in a fantastic location very near to the Union Square shopping area. With the F Train, Bart and Cable Car locations very close by, getting around San Francisco is not a problem from the Palomar. The closest F Train is less than 25 metres from the hotels front door! We had a four night stay in a King room (835) and very much enjoyed the location and quality of the hotel. As noted above, the location is perfect for being centrally located in San Francisco but only a 15-20 minute ride on the F Train ($2 fare each way) to get to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel like all Kimptons we have experienced (Helix, DC & Muse, NY) are very nice hotels with very good service from the staff. Our room on Level 8 was only average in size and possibly smaller than The Muse in New York. The free wine hour is always appreciated as well as the small complimentary continental breakfast. This was not quite enough to satisfy but certainly worth having along with a little something else from the menu. As a Kimpton member, free Wi-Fi is also provided. We signed up to the Kimpton membership (for free) before leaving NZ and it is certainly worth doing. The Kimptons all have a free filter coffee service in the restaurant area for guests in the morning. This is a nice touch but as they don't have coffee making facilities in the rooms, one of us had to get up and go and get the coffee each morning. I am not sure why they don't offer a coffee service in the rooms? One issue we did have was the size and quality of the gym. With only three pieces of cardio (bike, X-Trainer and Treadmill), one multi-gym and some dumbbells, it was hardly big enough for two people. Having stayed at three Kimptons in October 2011, the Palomar had the worst gym set-up by some margin. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay at the Palomar in San Francisco and would definitely stay there again. Service was very good and as noted, the location for first timers to San Francisco was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Classy”
Reviews.Author: MK2000
Reviews.Content: Although it may no longer be the hippest place in town, the Palomar is still a good choice for travelers headed San Francisco for business or pleasure. It's convenient to either the convention center or Union Square and its environs. This hotel is a nice alternative to the nearby behmouths like the Marriott, Hilton, Westin and others. With its miniature lobby, it takes only a few steps from entering to the elevators. The rooms are mostly compact affairs but have all the comforts and amenities you expect from Kimpton. Bathrooms, however, are exceptionally small and can be somewhat challenging to navigate. There's morning coffee service on the 5th floor (why not throw in some nice baked goods and juices and call it a Continental Breakfast?) Service is fine. Although you can certainly pay less for a hotel room in San Francisco, you probably will not get the luxury touches and comfort that the Palomar offers.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel near convention center”
Reviews.Author: SarahMpls
Reviews.Content: Palomar is just a few blocks from the Moscone Convention center, an easy walk if you're in town for a meeting. While the rooms are a bit small, they are nice and modern. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, but it doesn't have some of the amenities that larger chain hotels have like coffee makers in the room or a coffee shop or gift shop in the hotel.Overall, it was a nice stay for a business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: lofa
Reviews.Content: I live only a couple of hours from SF so normally I would commute back and forth. This time my fiance and I decided to make a weekend out of it and stayed at the Palomar. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and the animal print robes add some fun to the romance side. They have a nice, complimentary wine tasting every evening. The location is excellent. You are just a few blocks from Union Square and the Powell street cable car plus BART are just a block away. My only complaint would be that parking costs 55 a day plus tax but that is common here in the city. Next time I will park at a bay area Bart Station and take Bart into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: minkewhaleNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel - granted it was expensive, but it met every expectation. Room was nicely designed and immaculate, the only improvement would be in-room coffee making facilities (although you can get free coffee from the 5th floor in the morning). There was also a games console in the room. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, and printed out documents for us on request, as well as arranging for some spare hair straighteners to be delivered to our room! I didn't take advantage of the staff-led jogging trips at 7 a.m., but thought it was a nice touch. The location is ideal, particularly for those keen on shopping, and is very close to the Powell Street BART for access to the airport and the cable car turnaround for trips to Fishermans Wharf and back. Also enjoyed the wine reception from 5-6 every evening!

Reviews.Title: “Setting a New Standard for SF!”
Reviews.Author: levtahor
Reviews.Content: Staff was super friendly and helpful. Room was well designed and quite large by SF standards. Nice large windows. Beds were comfortable. Really great location, particularly for events at the Moscone Convention Center. Very close to the Powell St BART station. Coffee in morning and wine in the evenings is a nice touch. Fitness facilities could be a little more extensive (perhaps an option to work out or swim at full health club in the area?) but this is nitpicking for a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING; Wonderful Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0travelt0gether
Reviews.Content: the head concierge (lauren, i believe) was amazing - she went above and beyond when helping to secure a particular room type, and spent so much time talking to me on the phone before i ever arrived. she gave us advice on room type and location, so we were excited about our room before we even arrived - feeling like we were "in the know" because of her information. the room was wonderful, and made our stay! she also went above and beyond in helping to make and then adjust a restaurant reservation for our large party. she made so many phone calls and follow-up phone calls, i can't believe her efforts on our behalf. she was awesome - and absolutely should be commended for her approach to customer service. i was not feeling well, and i called down to the front desk to inquire if there was a delivery service that could pick up our carry out order from a local restaurant. it makes me so sad to say that i don't have the young man's name that assisted me on the phone (i spoke with him in the early afternoon of tues 10/18 and wed 10/19). he called around to find out, and called us back to inform us that there was not, but actually offered to go and pick it up HIMSELF?!! i was floored! my husband was not ill, and went to get our order, because i couldn't imagine asking a hotel employee to pick it up even if they offered, but what an amazing willingness to help! i've stayed in 5 star and luxury hotels in most major cities in the US and eastern Canada, and I have NEVER encountered such service from staff members across the board. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mainlandhulagirl
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that delivers across the board. Great location near Union Square, steps from great shops, the boarding line for the cable car at the base of Powell, and direct bus line to the Piers. The staff is very helpful and attentive and accommodate every request. There's a complimentary wine reception every day at 5:00 on the 5th floor next to the lounge that draws a nice crowd of hotel guests and also offers morning coffee. The rooms are pristine, spacious, and sophisticated. We asked for a quiet room and received one. It was such a pleasure to return back to the room each time, but most of all the bed was dreamy. We stayed in several hotels during our 5-day galavant to the wine country and back and had the best sleep in this one. And if you have a pet they will be welcomed with a serving of dry food in their own silver bowl in the lobby. Plan your stay here and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: AuntieLulu01
Reviews.Content: A very big thanks to all at the Palomar. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff from the Valet, to the Doorman, to the Bellman, to the front desk and by the very helpful Lauren, Concierge. We were in a hurry as we requested an early check-in and had an event to attend. Everyone helped us secure our bags and make quick transport arrangements. The room was spotless and our little friend, the goldfish, made the room feel cozy, warm and comfortable. This was my first time at the Palomar and will not be my last. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: Kehau R
Reviews.Content: What I really like about Kimpton Hotels is that, for the most part, no matter which property you stay at, you know what you're going to get. It isn't hip like the W, but what you get are clean hotel rooms, friendly staff, complimentary coffee in the morning and wine happy hour 5-6 pm. My only wish it that the gym was better. It is room with a couple of cardio machines and weights (and this seems to be the case with other Kimptons I've stayed at). The Hotel Palomar has become my hotel of choice for my trips to San Francisco. The location is very convenient for my business purposes, it's reasonably priced and it's a short walk to shopping and restaurants. Maverick, the director of pet relations, is also on of my favorite things about the hotel. He's an amazing chocolate lab that you'll see most days sitting behind or sometimes on top of the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: moneret
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 4 nights at the end of September and had a great time The positives: -great location (close to shopping & public transport, walking distance to many attractions) -clean, spacious, comfortable room -quiet room (our room faced the courtyard) -GREAT front desk staff (Lauren arranged many of our plans before we arrived and Rachel was fantastic during our stay) -free wifi with Kimpton Intouch -free wine reception in the evening and coffee in the morning -optional goldfish in room was a nice touch Small quibbles: -no fan in the bathroom -no recycling bin Overall, this was a very comfortable place to stay. It is not as funky as other Kimpton hotels, but it still had a lot of personality. We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in San Francisco. The front desk staff was warm and friendly and really welcomed us to their city.

Reviews.Title: “Our new tradition!”
Reviews.Author: Claire P
Reviews.Content: We just had an excellent third stay at the Palomar in SF and I am happy I finally got around to write a review of this great place! The rooms are very nice with quality furniture and decor, clean, spacious, and very little noise. Most rooms have a view and if they don't face the street you can see skyscrapers, glass roofs of stores, and a zen garden in the interior facing rooms. The location could not be more perfect: just steps to hundreds of casual and designer stores, five star restaurants, and good vibes. The staff is friendly and outgoing and offer you many complimentary things such as pet care and a "companion" fish which is a nice touch! This is my favorite part of the city, especially at Christmas time! I don't plan to stay anywhere else in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPa64
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palomar for 2 nights end of September. The rooms were well done and service was great. The location cannot be better. Close to shopping, Caltrain, a 15-20 minute walk on fourth street and the BART station a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Plenty of shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. Great location if you want to experience the vibe of SF Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Great service”
Reviews.Author: MLSWorldwide
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a stop over from NYC back to Australia - I have to say that this was really a great experience. The hotels concierge staff, particularly the manager made our short stay so fabulous. We were recommended to local (non tourist) areas to explore by day and fabulous eating spots by night - Alexanders Japanese steak house was outstanding - along will all other spots we went to. The room we got was large and filled with all you could need, the morning coffee/ tea service was nice and overall it was a top place to stay. Its located right in the middle of the city but you didn't hear any noise at night and it made it easy to catch a tram, train, taxi or bus to where ever we wanted to go. At the end of the day if the room is clean and big enough and the hotel is in a good spot the only thing that makes them great over just good is the service - this hotel has that all worked out and you feel it as a guest from the minute you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at another Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: wes482
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Hotel Palomar in SF and glad we picked this hotel. Everyone from the front desk staff to the waitstaff in Fifth Floor were great. The rooms are well done and a nice size, the beds were comfortable which is a big deal in our book as with most people I imagine. We wound up eating at Fifth Floor simply out of convenience after having traveled and toured all day and it turned out to be our best dinner while in SF and Napa, what a great restaurant! I can't say enough good things about the great food and waitstaff there. The front desk staff steered us in the right direction for several other restaurant recommendations. All the staff provided great, personal service. All in all, a very nice hotel and I will continue to look for Kimpton hotels at our future vacation destinations.

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: RoseC178
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in SF and first time stay at a Kimpton. We were here to celebrate someone's birthday, and I meant to make it a wonderful experience to that special person. After reading thru lots of good reviews about this hotel on trip advisor, I decided to give it a try. Since this is a "Four star, Luxury Boutique" hotel, I had high expectations on it; unfortunately, it met none. Let me start with our “series of unfortunate events" - Arrived at 1.45pm, early for check-in time, but the front desk prompted us that our room is ready! I asked for upgrade but she said the hotel was fully committed. Regardless, we were happy and excited to check in early. As we arrived to our room, we found the room service lady was still in there, but we didn't mind. I then asked for her help turning on the AC, she did but not without struggling with it. Again, we did not mind. Then, as I walked the lady out & tried to close the door, we discovered that the door was stuck and wouldn't close. She said she would go for help. Ten minutes later, I called front desk for status and only then we had someone came. Eager to explore the city, we left our room while the gentleman was fixing the door. He assured us for the safety of our luggage and that the door would be fixed right away. -We got back to the hotel 5 hours later and found the door was fixed, but then we noticed that the water in our bath tub drained very very slow (at least 20 minutes for draining from a shower). Too tired from our long walk, we decided not to bother and went to bed. Our room is a deluxe double double which turns out to be quite small. It has 2 queen beds, 1 small table with only 2 chairs and so only 2 of us can seat while others had to stand. The beds are average but the pillows are very soft. I asked for a non-pet and quite room, and was given a non-pet and next to Market Street. We can hear lots of noise from the street: fire trucks, bus, ambulance....We could barely sleep during our entire stay. -The next morning, I went downstairs and reported the bathroom issue with the front desk. As soon as I got back to our room, someone showed up and got it fixed. We were offered a complementary movie for our not so good experience. While I appreciate the prompt response from the staff, I wished the room was fully checked before our arrival. -Next, while putting our stuff in the closet, I found 2 broken hangers, one of which I was able to fix. I left the other broken one on the ground, hoping someone would notice that and would replace it. When I got back to the hotel later that day, the broken hanger was still there, nicely hanging on the rack and was still broken. -Then we found a problem with the flush switch in out toilet. It stayed that way for the rest of our stay. In addition to the mentioned events, I have few positive and negative notes. I'll start with the negatives and then end on a positive one: -The hotel has no lobby and the lounge on fifth floor is tiny and dark (it has dim ceiling lights and no windows) -They play loud music early in the morning in the lounge, so loud that we could hear the music from our room on the same floor. In fact, the music woke me up one day. -The hotel advertises for a "Business center" where guests can use computer and internet without charge, but the room is closed during our entire 4 days stay. I was advised to use another computer near the lounge but there's a charge for everything I do on it. -When I booked, one of the listed amenities is Aveda bath products, but I found none during our stay there. There's shampoo, conditioner and lotion, but they are not Aveda. I felt I was cheated. -Bathroom has just a slide door and there's no fan. After the shower, we would have to wait for a while for the mist on the mirror to clear out. -The bathroom is right next to the bed and so all of us pretty much had to sleep or wake up at the same time. -As other reviewers noted, the wine reception only lasts from 5-6pm. While it is nice, we could never make it back to the hotel during this hour. -The fridge is tiny, but we managed. On a positive Note -Location: few minutes walk from BART station, cable car, F-line trains, Westfield mall, Union Square...About 15-20 minute walk to ChinaTown, North beach. I took the F-line to FishermanWharf -My son had a gold fish for his pet and there is a beautiful chocolate lab that greets us when we check in. -The staff is super nice and friendly. They are the only reasons for my positive feelings about this hotel. -The hotel is overall clean. Although the hotel doesn't have a lobby, they offer water flavored with various fruits near the check-in desk -Kimpton In Touch member can get free wifi and $10 mini bar treats. All in all....I think I would prefer to stay at the nearby Marriott next time. The lack of sleep and space were just too difficult to manage and certainly not worth the price we paid on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service”
Reviews.Author: aguyinthe818
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekender in SF. Great location, easy walk to everything. Tough to get a cab unless you walk across the street to the mariott (?) The upgraded king room with jacuzzi tub was nice, but unremarkable, comfy bed. Great view of market street but not much noise on the 8th floor which was nice. The tub accommodated two very comfortably.... Etro bath products smelled great and all were replenished daily (since they all ended up in my bag) You could hear the plumbing activity in other rooms, although it was not disruptive, probably since the building is old. Staff is typical Kimpton, excellent all the way. Daniel at the front desk was amazing, making sure all my particular desires were taken care of. Doorman and bellhop went out of their way to jump in the street to find cabs. At the $230ish/night on the aaa rate I was pleased. I've seen this hotel much higher, in which case I would have sought something more posh. Biggest complaint is that the restaurant does not serve breakfast (room service is available). I would definitely stay here again, provided the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “A good but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agendaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a quick trio to San Francisco. We sought a nice boutique hotel and were somewhat disappointed to find that this hotel did not really seem like it had any character. We had a nice room although it was slightly small with no views. We were awakened during the night by loud crowds across the hall. We did find that the bed was very comfortable. The next morning, I went to the Fifth Floor lobby for coffee. Despite it being 6:00 a.m., the music playing was loud rap music. I asked if they could turn it off or at least down but was told they couldn't do anything about it. They suggested I go to the business center for a quiet place to drink coffee and read the news. My wife and I went to the restaurant for breakfast which was tasty but slow. For the price, we had hoped this would be better than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: DK67858996
Reviews.Content: On my last visit to the Palomar in September of 2011, I arrived bleary-eyed: Afraid of being late for a noon meeting, I had gotten up at 3:30 a.m. that morning to catch an early flight. I was happy to find that I arrived at the hotel with a few hours to spare for a nap before the meeting. But it was still morning, and I was told that the room wasn't yet ready. I didn't complain - just probably slumped a bit and grumpily asked when it would be ready. One of the front desk staff, presumably noticing my crestfallen expression, volunteered to try to find a room that was available immediately. She called up for someone to check, and when that didn't work she personally went up to find a room that was ready - which she did, and I got my nap. I was very grateful for the personalized attention and for the staff's willingness to go the extra mile. This experience is typical of my stays at the Palomar, of which there have been many, as I regularly travel to San Francisco for business and have instructed my secretary to put me in the Palomar whenever it's available. It's an excellent hotel, with an attentive staff, a nice restaurant, and a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that's centrally located. SUPER, SUPER staff.”
Reviews.Author: KStarrr
Reviews.Content: The location is in a shopper's paradise, within walking distance of a mall, lots of shops and many restaurants. The hotel itself is very clean, as are the bedrooms. Nice contemporary bathrooms in the rooms, with high end fixtures. I agree that the room decor was just OK, but again, very clean and the bed was super comfy with fluffy pillows and down blankets. It was very comfortable. They have a free wine hour with appetizers in the evening. Yes, free. I can't stress enough how awesome the staff was. The nice person at reception made check-in a breeze. I had arrived around 11:00 am and he still allowed me to check in to a room that was available, even though check-in isn't until around 3 or 4. The bartenders, hosts, and waiters at the restaurant really went above and beyond and I would definitely return. If I had to rate the staff separately, I'd give them all a 5! Room service was expensive (expected),but with a limited menu with food that was just blah and lacking taste. Food in the restaurant was excellent and there was a lot of attention to detail. The restaurant is closed on Mondays, but the bar is open and offers a few food items. If you don't see anything on the menu that you like, just inquire! I did, and the very nice hostess kindly asked the chefs to prepare a special non-meat pasta dish that wasn't on the menu. Overall, my stay was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay 快適な滞在”
Reviews.Author: Akiko-Tokyobird
Reviews.Content: I traveled San Francisco from Tokyo, Japan and stayed at the hotel for four nights from September 15th. The location is perfect, easy to access to every stations of Bart, cable car, bus and street car. The hotel is located in the center of shopping area and many of popular boutiques and department stores are very close. If you a jogger, it might be fun to join their free running program with the stuff on every weekday morning. If you are a wine lover, you would be pleased with the free wine tasting service in the evening. At the lobby, they have flavored drinking water for free. The hotel stuff are friendly and polite. My friend and I were happy to find a nice lady who speaks in Japanese in them. (Thank you, Erika!) I advise the future guests at the hotel, it may better to compare the fare at some hotel booking sites and also the hotel website with promotional code.(you can find in in this trip advisor's article or the hotel site.) 初めてサンフランシスコを訪れましたが、清潔で快適な滞在ができました。どちらに行くにも駅やバス停が目の前ですので便利です。いつもではありませんが、日本語を話すスタッフの方がいらっしゃいます。

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel in a Very Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: GMak54
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be a nice "romantic getaway" place or a convenient stay for business. The rooms are clean, well-appointed but not "luxurious." The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is a 5 minute stroll to the Marconi Center for those looking for a very convenient hotel near the main convention center. For tourists, it's a short walk to the Powell Street Terminus of the cable car, Union Square and many other destinations. The "F" tram is at the end of the block and will take you straight to Fisherman's Wharf and the Alcatraz jumping off point. Free non-buffet breakfast! Of the two service requests I had, the staff responded within 5 minutes. Depending on the deal you can get on rooms, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good facilities, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AJ_0001
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to a Kimpton hotel (11th September for 4 nights) - and im pleased to say a very good stay.
