Now to the beginning...we booked our room through skoosh, got an awesome rate not knowing the Giants were going to win the World Series, got there to check in early and they couldn't find our reservation. Daniel at the front desk handled all of the phone calls to figure out the discrepancy and in the end skoosh had us booked at their sister hotel, The Serrano. Anyway, long story short, skoosh made the mistake and the Palomar honored our reservation and just for the inconvienience of it all they gave us a fabulous room!! The 8th floor corner room with a wall of windows that overlooked Market Street that gave us a front row seat to the parade. It was our 14th anniversary and Daniel made every effort to see that we had a fabulous stay...he even sent up a bottle of champaign. My first trip to San Francisco was awesome and it was because we had such a nice welcome at the Palomar. Thank you Daniel and your four legged friends!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure.”
Reviews.Author: sonshine-lover
Reviews.Content: Located near the Marscone Center, Hotel Palomar was a great hotel for our stay. The rooms are very nice, flat screen tv, comfortable beds (the pillows were very thick and hard, but we only had to ask, and flatter, down-filled pillows were delivered to our room promptly) and a nice bathroom with Aveda amenities. The free wine reception every evening for an hour was lovely, as was the beautiful coffee set up on the fifth floor every morning. Excellent service. Several free newspapers offered every day. Small fitness room available but jogging in San Francisco is great. 2 Michelin stars restarant on the Fifth floor. Pet friendly--they even have a resident chocolate lab in the lobby for you to pet! Quiet hotel on a busy street. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place gets it right on most every level”
Reviews.Author: 5gordons
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel Our first stay at a Kimpton, but not our last. It was our anniversary, and we were nicely greeted by a room upgrade and a bottle of sparkling wine. The room was great. The bathroom was decent, but not the best, but we're not there for bathrooms. The hotel was a feel-good kind of place. The concierge recommended a couple of bang-on restaurants that got us away from the tourists and made us feel like locals. The wine reception at the hotel each evening was a nice way to relax after a full day on the town, and a great way to get set for the evening. The location could not be beat. SoMA has a lot of neat places to explore, but it is really a Union Square/Market Street location that is convenient to everything. We had breakfast on Union Square, walked through Chinatown, North Beach, up Telegraph Hill, then to Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square. From there a single bus took us right back to the hotel's front door on time for the wine reception! Go here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maffei40
Reviews.Content: Well this is the second Kimpton hotel I have used in San Francisco and on the whole everything was great. The room was clean and well decorated but I found it slightly small for 3 people compared to my previous stay at the Sir Francis Drake which is a 10 minute walk up Powell street from the Palomar, maybe we were spoilt first time around. The beds very comfortable,but i did find the traffic noise a bit off putting and ended up using my ear plugs. Before leaving the UK I had joined the Kimpton members club and also contacted the Palomar direct stating it was a special trip for my 72YR old mother myself and fiance and that a good size room and a quiet one at that would be nice to request. Unfortunately we didnt get either on this occasion but 3yrs ago the Sir Francis came through 100% on all requests. The location is great and near the tram pick up ,shops and restaurants, perfect for first timers to San Fran. The staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful apart from the one doorman on our arrival night who ignored us all completely and was more interested in chatting to some petite blonde woman!!! Shame really as this mared the beginning of our stay at the hotel but everyone else and especiall Maverick the dog who stays in the foyer made up for it,. The valet parking is great and convenient but yes a bit pricey and I would say that if we do do San Fran a third time then we will rely on the public transport and taxis for staying in the immediate area as its cheaper than having a hire car. A hire car is great if you are going to venture out and about away from the city itself. On the whole yes I would stay here again and would recommend it, but if I could afford that little bit extra I would also return to the sister hotel The Sir Francis Drake too.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I spent 5 nights in San Fran for a conference at the Moscone Center, and other events at a nearby chain hotel that is the largest in San Francisco. While the latter is good (I've stayed there in the past,) the Palomar provided a better experience and value all around at a somewhat lower price. It is a short walk to the Moscone Center, and is centrally located to other short-walk attractions like Union Square and the Chinatown gate. It is very near a stop for the tram/streetcar and other mass transit options (and frankly, across the street from that major chain hotel where all the taxis seem to line up.) The San Fran Museum of Modern Art is a short walk. The Ferry Building is at the end of Market Street, either by tram or a good walk if you are in the mood. The spacious 2-bed room #720 was great for our purposes (I invited my sister during the stay.) The decor was sleek-modern but warm and comfortable. While overlooking busy Market Street and up towards Union Square, this room was very quiet except for the occaisional ambulance or fire truck -- and even those noises were subdued; we could have slept through it. Looking out over the life of a city is something we enjoy as long as it is quiet enough. This hotel does sound-proofing very well, even when it seemed like it was pretty full. Still, there was a nice-enough courtyard if you want more buffer with an inner-facing room. The beds were soooo comfortable, with a selection of pillows and bolsters for sleeping, reading, etc. There are perfect-weight, not-too-warm duvets and top sheets with quality linens. A/C worked quietly and perfectly. Good-size closet and drawer space. All of the usual-or-better amenities in a good business class hotel are there -- iron & board, mini bar that had room to store a few things besides the stocked items, safe (roomy but not large enough for my laptop,) good laundry service, high-quality towels, Aveda toiletries, large desk/work surface, good flat-screen TV and options, etc. There are a few extra-nice things: wonderful robes, an umbrella if it rains, complimentary quality newspapers like the New York Times and Wall Street Journal as well as the local SF paper, etc. Complimentary internet access (although you may have to register as a member of "the club" -- free -- I forget.) My incredibly minor, nit-picky gripe: the clock radio does not have a light-up dial, so it was hard to tell the time if you woke up at night. There was no in-room coffee maker, but excellent coffee/tea is served in the lounge 6 - 9 a.m. FREE wine is served 5-6 in the same area, but you could take it up to your room. It was nice to have this there when dressing for dinner or you just want to put your feet up, although the lounge is sociable, modern-sleek and comfortable. 'No stingy attitude by the wine server, either. Chilled waters in urns in the lobby provide refreshment throughout the day/evening. Spotless, friendly housekeeping. Exellent, helpful staff throughout, but Matt at the door deserves special attention for his helpfulness and advice. I had a wake-up call every morning that arrived right on time -- with a REAL PERSON at the other end!!! MUST MENTION the excellent restaurant, Fifth Floor. We dined well at many restaurants in San Fran, but this was a highlight of an American menu with French preparations. Small plates and mains provide a lot of variety and while note cheap, well-priced for this level of quality and menu. While not a large menu, the variety is good and there is lots to like. There were a few complimentary amuse-gouts surpises, too. Nice cheese selection of note. I understand that there may be a new chef in November, but we'd be happy with the one currently on duty. The waitstaff and hostess were friendly, polished professionals. I'd go back in a minute, even if I wasn't staying at this hotel. Also: the bar area is very comfortable with the bar and tables, and you can get dinner there, too, if you'd prefer not to be at a table in the restaurant. I've done this before when I was on my own and the restaurant was booked (which is how I learned about this hotel.) There is also a chocolate labrador dog at reception every day, 8-5, which reinforces the hotel's support of animal rescue and care. No business center to speak of, but the service at the desk makes up for it, e.g. will print boarding passes complimentary, ship things, etc. How much do I love this hotel? IT belongs to the Kimpton hotel group. I will now check the Kimpton directory when I travel to other cities, and hope that it meets the standards set by the Palomar. On a return visit to San Fran, I will check this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Audiodoc
Reviews.Content: We started our trip on business at Half Moon Bay and stayed at the oh so fabulous Ritz Carlton. This was a hard act to follow, but wanted to end our trip with a special 2 nights in San Francisco. We were very disappointed with this property as well as the service. The property itself was very dark and dreary. We were out of our hotel room all day on Sunday, back at 5pm only to find our room was not cleaned. Back in the room 5 minutes, husband in the shower and here comes housecleaning wanting to get in to clean the room. Breakfast room was dirty and service was extremely slow due to understaffing. Our previous stay in San Francisco was at the Hotel Vitale and it was such a special and memorable place, the Hotel Palomar was not even close in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Chicquita2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Palomar during our trip the San Francisco. The room was modern, clean, and cozy. The hotel was located right on the main shopping street and close to many attractions. The best surprise is the happy hour each day that includes sangria and wine. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel very clean excellent location”
Reviews.Author: blingster44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights very nice hotel excellent location here for shops and attractions..Hotel very clean nice light airy rooms..Shower is in the bath..but would recomend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Reflection of the signs of the times....”
Reviews.Author: kid_at_heart17
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hotel Palomar in 2000 when it was somewhere newly opened. From my several trips to and from the US and to San Francisco, my return this year to this hotel would have been a homecoming... NOT! What used to be the Hotel Palomar noted for being a boutique luxury hotel was terribly terribly all wrong. Perhaps it had something to do with a travel agent in the Philippines using another travel agent in the US, booking this hotel for me. I was charged $380 per night for a King Deluxe and breakfast was $35 per head. I eventually found out that continental breakfast was only $14.50 and that if I had booked through the internet, it would have just been $1 breakfast for two. For the last 5 years I had never booked my trips through the travel agency but corporate policies which are still living in the dinosaur ages dictate that we need to go through a travel agent for auditing purposes. Nevertheless, let me say that the King Deluxe was a letdown. There was no water available in the room (you had to buy it at the nearest Walgreens) and the place looked very desolate. The ambience overlooking the awkward looking Zen garden looked sad and pathetic. There was no view. While the room was kept clean by the cleaning lady, there needs to be a makeover and the carpets need to get changed as it smelled musky and moldy. The bathroom was small and the shower curtains (who still uses shower curtains?!?!) were smelly. This was another place in the room that needed a major makeover. Finally was the food. For $14.50 for a continental breakfast, one could get a more decent meal in the next door Westfield Mall for the same price! Talk about having a muffin, some fruits, a croissant, a cup of coffee or fruit juice for this price? There wasn't even yoghurt to go. Geez!! The fitness center was really tiny and you probably are better off jogging in your room than in the tiny place they called Fitness Center. Of course, coming from Sofitel Los Angeles last July and comparing what Sofitel offered and the price I paid for Hotel Palomar was a no brainer. I expect to get what I paid for and if this is what this hotel offers at this price, this must be really the signs of the times in the US...that they are in recession and will stay this way for a decade more with no more cash to upgrade their hotels and provide people with rooms worth their money. Disappointment is a kind word to describe this hotel. I don't think the Kimpton hotels will make it through the next decade.

Reviews.Title: “Parking and location devaluate the property.”
Reviews.Author: Duggars
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. They have what seemed like the hotels mascot who's name escapes us at the moment but is a well behaved chocolate lab. They dress him up in Giants gear on game days lol. Back to the hotel: the location is in a very busy, dirty, area of the city. Although there are many stores - and a shopping mall - right next to it, the bums begging for money are intolerable. We even had 2 - YES 2 - dressed in suits who were OBVIOUSLY begging for money, pretending to be businessmen who needed a couple of bucks for gas. Then there's the parking situation which devaluated this property even more. We ended up paying $48 PER DAY - For two days. That was a waste in our eyes as the valet attendant had us waiting 20 minutes on of the times we were trying to turn in the car. Another plus is a free wine reception daily - however we aren't wine drinkers so this didn't sway us at all. I wouldn't recommend the hotel f you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Up there with the best”
Reviews.Author: Panda_and_Flossy
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to San Francisco after staying at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins. On a dollar for dollar basis The Palomar was considerably better value. The rooms are very modern and spacious with nice bathrooms (Great Shower) and the most fantastic bathrobes you have ever seen (One leopard and one zebra). The hotel is ideally located virtually next door to the Westfield Centre and only a few blocks from Union Square. The guys on the door are very helpful as were the reception staff. Also the daily complimentary wine tasting and flavoured waters on reception were nice touches. If Trip advisor allowed half star ratings we would give this hotel 4.5 stars - Most people would give this hotel five stars but our criterea for five stars is a truely memorable hotel which we would talk about for years following the visit. In all an excellent hotel which we would highly recommend (and we will probably return to this hotel sometime in the future)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, very friendly staff. Good small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: loveJP
Reviews.Content: Staff were really friendly and nice. The Location was convenient. The rooms didn't seem too old, nice big room size. HOwever we didn't really like the decor of the room. Otherwise, great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous oasis in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: AnneInSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palomar several times, and have never had a less-than-stellar experience. Staff is friendly and helpful, hotel is super-clean, great bedding, and extra perks if you're a Kimpton Rewards member. One evening before a giant presentation, I was unexpectedly delivered a goldfish "Vincent" as an overnight pet - it totally was such a special and odd thing that I calmed down about the business at hand. Location is perfect, and fast in-and-out. My favorite hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MyreviewsMiami_FLUSA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, the nice dog at the reception is a cool touch. Staff mostly very friendly and professional. A/C, ice on the floor, but the windows don't open and gave me sort of a cage sensation, but again, we were out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMaureen
Reviews.Content: I arrived early from the SF Airport, and had e-mailed the hotel to ask if I could check in early, and they graciously allowed me to, had already made arrangements to do so. Very nice welcome! The room was great, nice size, very comfy, all amenities were fine, loved the robes! No complaints at all. Location is perfect, walking distance to shopping, Union Square, lots of restaurants, transit. Everyone at the reception desk was helpful, went out of their way to help out with anything asked of them. Lauren was very helpful, I had asked for advice on how to reach a relative's house south on the Peninsula, and she even gave me a number to reach her later in the day if I got lost on my way back. THAT kind of help is not something you find at many other hotels, and was much appreciated! Free wifi is a nice perk also. All in all, a very nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: nwlilac
Reviews.Content: We love the fact that we were on the view side of the hotel (9th floor, even number). We booked a room with two full beds - it was clean and comfortable. Everyone in the hotel was helpful. We liked the complimentary wine in the evening and coffee in the morning on the 5th floor. The hotel dog, Maverick, is sweet chocolate lab who also fundraises for Golden Gate Lab Retriever Rescue. The location was perfect for shopping, proximity to Chinatown and the Embarcadero, but as we came to town to do a StoryCorps recording at the Jewish Contemporary Museum that was also quite close! One word of warning - I think several times we were offered a towncar, instead of a taxi - which ended up costing us more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ToodieD
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in San Francisco recently. We stayed at the Palomar at 4th & Market. This was our first time at this hotel, and we thoroughly enjoyed everything about the place. From the friendly staff at reception to the wine hour in the fifth floor lounge to the large room with very comfortable king-size bed--everything was excellent. Of course you will encounter the occasional San Francisco character in this area of town, but that will not stop us from staying at the Palomar the next time we visit the City.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, dog friendly, nice decor”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: I tried to think of the first three things which came to mind regarding this hotel. First of all, it's very hip/trendy. The decor is nice and even a little quirky. I mean who really gets to use leopard print terrycloth robes outside of their own home? The rooms are small, but well appointed. I was a little taken aback by the number of dogs I saw entering/staying on the property, but my fears quickly subsided . . . I didn't hear one bark, see any fur balls or any "signs" of the furry critters! The staff are generally nice. I was really impressed to see two iced down water containers with my choice of either mint/lemon or strawberry infused water. Gratis! This is a lovely hotel, although it's almost impossible to get a taxi from this spot which was probably the only detractor I can come up with. The hotel is VERY convenient to shopping and also the BART. And, when the going gets tough, there's Blue Bottle Cafe just around the corner! Eat your heart out Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: madrew
Reviews.Content: The Palomar made our trip to San Francisco more special by allowing us to relax in their comfortable beds at the end of a hectic day of sightseeing and shopping. Love that this hotel is pet friendly and Maverick, the animal ambassador, was there to greet everyone coming and going. Also enjoyed the goldfish sent to our room - such a unique way to make one feel right at home! The staff are all friendly and knowledgable - looking forward to staying there soon! Thank you Palomar!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mllgdl
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with everything this hotel had to offer. I had read on line earlier that you should join the Kimpton Hotel group facebook page to receive the membership and "secret" word. Well it was well worth it as we were upgraded right off the bat along with having a bar credit and the free wifi in our room. The room was awesome, very large for the two of us. The only - and only - complaint we would have is that there is not a/c and the windows do not open. We came to realize though , that is the norm is San Francisco. We took advantage of the wine tasting hour on 2 nights. It was great - tasted Australian wine which was too bad! But not to complain! wine is wine and when it's free it even tastes better. Front desk staff and Lauren at the concierge were very helpful. Lauren booked our tours (Napa Valley Wine Country Tours - highly recommend and Alcatraz) and sent us up a special gift for our engagement. What a surprise that was! Emilie (front office manager) seemed to wear a couple of hats which included the wine tasting hour and helping us try to fix a reservation mishap. We didn't try the 5th floor restaurant , instead we went down the street to Mel's Diner for breakfast every morning and supper once. The price is right and they give you an insane amount of food. The location is perfect - for the cable car and the shopping. We recommend buying the weekly pass for $26 per person instead of $5 for each time you hop on.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in at least a dozen hotels in San Francisco within walking distance of the Palomar. Most cost a little less. For me, the slightly higher rate for the Palomar was worth it. It's not a true luxury hotel, so don't go there expecting something extraordinary; if you're content with a basic, comfortable room, you can find many at a lower rate. But at the Palomar, my room was definitely larger than average. Although I don't spend a lot of time in my hotel rooms, over a period of several days a small room can feel cramped. The bed was fine, the decor was understated and classy. Everything was clean. Flat screen TV with DVD player, mp3-player clock radio, mini bar, bathrobes and umbrella in the closet along with an iron, selection of good newspapers. The bathroom was average--nothing remarkable, but no problems with the shower or anything else (not always the case in my experience; sometimes showers are cramped, or the shower head is too low, or the water turns hot and cold by itself). I was on the seventh floor, and although the windows were covered by plate plexiglass, which dampened exterior noise from the busy street below, I could hear an occasional honk or dumpster routine in the middle of the night. But it was relatively quiet; I've been to many hotels in the area at which dumpsters being emptied in the middle of the night have made sleep impossible; not so here. It has a free wine hour in the evening. The location--around the corner from Market Street--is a matter of personal preference. It's a short walk to Union Square, but there are many hotels a few blocks closer. I always use the BART, so I liked having the station a minute from the hotel, instead of ten minutes. I was particularly impressed by the service. Each and every one of the people I dealt with at the front desk was extremely helpful as well as friendly. I got a good recommendation for a breakfast place nearby, and the staff person called to make sure it was serving before I walked over. I had a problem with my check at the hotel bar (under separate management) and the hotel took care of it without any hassle at all. I The doorman always wished me a nice day and asked if I wanted transportation, but he was never pushy. The room was cleaned unobtrusively. These are all things we should expect, but just don't always happen, so when everything works, I think it's worth mentioning. A few details: The hotel is pet friendly. If you're a Klimpton member, wi-fi is free. The lobby is small, so you won't want to sit in it a read a newspaper or hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton member so I like staying at this chain because they give you free internet, wine evenings, and upgrades. I'm also a Facebook friend and they have monthly "secret words" on there to get you extra perks/upgrades. Well, I had a little difficulty with booking. I had booked 3 nights for my business trip, tried to extend another 2 nights but they couldn't give me the same rate. I had to book the extra 2 nights elsewhere to get a good rate. Upon check in I gave the secret word and was told that they were full so the word could not get me upgraded. They offered nothing in exchange for that. I said that since I have another reservation could they try for that second part of my trip? Yes, it was available then. So, 3 days we stayed in the regular King room (835), which was nice. A little small, but the hotel is boutique-ish so it's expected. Due to being a member, we also got a coupon to "raid the minibar" for $10. We tried to eat dinner at Fifth Floor (restaurant) but it was way too crowded and noisy (swanky party, I guess). I loved the coffee/tea in the morning and the wine tasting from 5-6. Nice perk. The fitness room is a joke. There is one treadmill, one elliptical, one bike, and a stretching unit. People were getting frustrated waiting for equipment each day. That really should be made into a larger area with more equipment. Then we checked out of the courtyard view King (courtyard overlooks the inside of Old Navy LOL), and into our upgrade #826. It was about 2 ft larger and had a chair. LOL It overlooked Market St. but wasn't much noisier than the courtyard room. Couple of things that were wrong with the room - the sink in the bathroom is cracked and the shower is missing the wire shelf to put shampoo on. Other than that, it's the exact same room as the other one. Had I known, I wouldn't have bothered moving rooms. But the staff was very nice. And everything was as described. I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: StephKerry
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in San Fran. I like the Kimpton chain anyway, but loved this hotel. We had a room on the 8th floor and could hear no street noise. The room was great - quite large. The evening wine tasting is very nice and the morning coffee a lovely touch. The hotel is located in a great area for shopping and restaurants - only a 2-3 minute walk to Union Square. The service we received was excellent, from the front desk to the doorman to the restaurant staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here if we visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: mes97
Reviews.Content: While my room is nice, and a nice size, and the location is good, the staff is not very knowledgeable and not able to give good advice about restaurants, gyms, etc. in the area. The fitness facility in the hotel is very small, and the restaurant, although I've only tried to eat there once, was a very bad experience. There was one waitress and one busboy for about thirty people. The tables were all dirty. I left after about twenty minutes, and nobody had waited on me, and complained to the staff downstairs, who was not overly concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Caution: it's not so great...”
Reviews.Author: Gr8_FamilyAdventures
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this hotel is so highly rated by so many others--unless they got a much better rate than I did. I paid $225 avg. per night for a king deluxe room. I'm not sure what made it "deluxe"... The room was small, the bathroom was small and it opened up practically right onto the bed. ROOM: small, noisy air system, fewer amenities (chairs, etc.) than I am used to (I'ved stayed with Kimpton in Boston and Chicago previously) and for some odd reason my room vibrated (I thought it was an earthquake when we first got there). BATHROOM: The toilet ran--we had to keep jiggling the handle to stop it. The shower drained extremely slowly so I had water up to my ankles by the time my shower was done (gross). It was so small it had a pocket door (a regular door would hit the toilet, or on the other side, the bed)--which was particularly disturbing since it doesn't seal very well and the door is literally 2 feet from the bed (no bathroom privacy!) MORNING/AFTERNOON FREEBIES: If freebies are your thing, you'll be happy that you might get some. But the morning coffee was not staffed and there was not hot coffee for me two out of three days (other supplies were also out). STAFF: When you have their attention they are extremely friendly and kind, but in the end I found they were just yes-ing me and truly provided no real value. 1-I asked for something to be sent to my room and I was told it was on its way. It never came and I never heard from them again about it. 2-after complaining about our room, they said they could switch us to one with more space. We packed up ourselves and 3-yr old and went to the new room--with a bigger bathroom, but LESS space in the living area, even fewer chairs and one half window that was up so high I couldn't see out of it! Clearly they were just trying to move me along and didn't think about what I was saying when they switched us... I called the front desk and asked for the original room back and was told no problem, that the key would still work. But after lugging everyone and everything back it did not and we had to run for new keys... 3-Upon check out I was given our final bill charged to my credit card and it was wrong. The woman stared at me dumbfounded when I explained it was significantly higher than it should have been. I searched through my phone to find the proof of the rate I should have received and finally was issued a refund of $231 (if I paid $231 more for this room I would have checked out after the first night). FITNESS ROOM: Very small--on a busy day you're out of luck. PARKING: $45 per day is outrageous--how can it be the same as the 4 Seasons... come on now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: samarkand00
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Very convenient for muni transportation. Trolley, muni buses, BART all very close by. Within walking distance of many attractions. The location of the elevators are inconvenient, especially if your room is the at the opposite end of the hotel. It is an adventure making your way through the maze of hallway to get back to your room. The morning coffee was ok. They were out of some supplies two of the mornings we were there. The room was pretty clean, the bathroom could have used some additional attention. The room was a little small. It is a decent hotel at a great location and is somewhat of a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in my own city.”
Reviews.Author: cajehle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, the service is friendly and professional. All the amenities you could want. Even when I am on business I feel like I am on a luxury vacation when I stay here. 5:00 free wine hour is amazing. If you ask they will let you play Nintendo Wi and drink wine at the same time - even if the office behind the pouring station is occupied. Location is prime for access to anywhere in the city and surrounds. 5th Floor is an amazing restaurant but take-out Thai food is one bock away. Overall the hotel is a pricey treat when you need to feel like you are on vacation but require all of the things necessary to conduct business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Central Location with Special Birthday Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: mvparker2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this reservation online directly through their website and stayed in room 902, a deluxe suite. This was definitely the most expensive hotel stay I've ever booked, but since it was my husband's birthday I wanted it to be extra special. While I was a little disappointed with the city view (a direct shot into some offices across the street), I think my expectations were completely met in regards to the spa bath and everything else about the room. We were staying in the room closest to the elevator and didn't hear a thing, which was wonderful! The service we received was wonderful! I called in advance and spoke with Lauren, who was really nice and helped me set everything up for the room and my man's birthday. She had great recommendations for us. When we arrived, everything was arranged as well as a couple extra surprises which were so sweet! We did use the Museum Parc Garage which is within walking distance at 3rd and Folsom to avoid having to pay $45 a night. It worked out well for us. Bottom line- the best features of this hotel are location and service! :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property and Location!”
Reviews.Author: gat42
Reviews.Content: Granted, there is no pool if you have kids, but you are in SF! Great for couples and families, just keep an eye on the kids while walking around the streets. Close to movie theaters, and many restaurants (including cheap fast food). MANY Walgreens in the area and about a 5-6 block walk to Pier 1 of Fisherman's Warf and to Chinatown. Great transportation available (trollys, cablecars and busses) and BART station is a block away for commute to and from SFO (airport). Hotel is very clean, extremely friendly and the bell staff is really helpful. Compared to other prices, this is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Von_Shmavid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of my budget, but my work paid for it, so I got two enjoy two nights in a fairly spacious room with a cozy king bed. Every single member of the staff I dealt with (around 10 different people) was welcoming, courteous, and helpful. This includes the guys who parked my car and the maids I passed in the hallway. I tend to get a little discombobulated when traveling so appreciated that a lot. A few other details that made me happy: The room decor was tasteful and comfortable. The temperature setting in the room worked perfectly and quietly. The bathroom lighting had two levels: a low light and then a more intense light if needed (I have a pet peeve about bad lighting so I liked this a lot). The internet connection was super fast and hassle free. When I picked my car up in the basement upon leaving, the garage was immaculate. I did not try the restaurant except for breakfast room service, which was fine. I did not turn on the TV so I don't have any comments about the entertainment selection. If I'm able to budget it, I hope to bring my wife here for our next anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully warm and welcoming!!!”
Reviews.Author: richard45_10
Reviews.Content: We always stay at high end hotels and we were just delighted with our stay at the Palomar. The front desk could not do enough for us- they made great suggestions and were very accomodating with follow up calls for reservations often giving us the menus. They made us feel that it was an honor to be of service!!! They arranged car service for us at the price of a cab. The driver could not have been nicer . When we travel next ( which we often do) I will first look for a Kimpton hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation Fun”
Reviews.Author: jurdyo
Reviews.Content: Do you live in the Bay Area and can't find time to get out of town, but need a break from the routine? Try a Staycation at The Hotel Palomar! Perfect central location just off Market and a block from Yerba Buena within easy walking distance of nearly every venue. After check-in with the knowledgable & friendly staff you take private elevator to a modern, well appointed, clean & comfortable room above the city streets. The wine tasting from 5p-6p at the 5th Floor is a relaxing treat in a sophisticated bar and nice way to seque into your evening. Our first evening consisted of improptu swing-dancing one block walk away at Yerba Buena followed by stand-up comedy acts provided by SFCC on Mason St. nearby. Dancing, Laughing, Eating and the most comfortable beds yet. Large flatscreens and Ipod music docks add the the ambiance. Big win at great value close to home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 24 hours in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ptownbrit
Reviews.Content: Although my husband and I live only 45 minutes away, we had an opportunity to spend 24 hours in San Francisco. We booked ourselves into the Palomar Hotel, (having had successful stays in other Kimpton Hotels) and could not have been more delighted. Upon arrival, our car was handled quickly and efficiently by the doormen. Expecting to leave our luggage with Front Desk, we were surprised to find that not only could we check in a little early, but that we had been upgraded to a suite with a super deep spa bathtub as I had mentioned, at the time of making the reservation, that we were celebrating our Anniversary. I realized I had left my phone in the car, and we took the elevator down to the parking garage and were surprised by how light, and spacious the area was and that it would only be used by guests at the hotel. We felt content our car was safe for the night. The room was spacious, comfortable, with modern decor in black, cream and orange. The bathroom had both a powerful shower cubicle and this super bath tub. Everytime we walked past reception, the staff would wish us a great day, or say something to acknowledge us. In the evening, just as we were getting ready to venture out for dinner and the theatre, we were surprised with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries from the hotel. What a delight. The drapes cut out the early morning sun, and we heard no noise from the streets or other guests all night. We had a wonderful sleep in the firm but comfortable bed and were somewhat sad to have to check out! Great location for shopping in Union Square and the Westfield Center, and just a couple of blocks away from the Golden Gate Theatre. It was certainly the perfect choice and we look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the free wine at the end of the day was a treat”
Reviews.Author: wadywabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our travel agent in New Zealand recommended it (and because she said there were free drinks every evening). This hotel is in a brilliant location. Easy walking distance from the BART which we caught from the airport. Loads of great shopping on your doorstep. Easy to get to the great restaurants down by the ocean. The staff were really lovely and helpful. The room was nice also quiet with double glazing. Although we'd requested two double beds they only had king beds available but they put us in a bigger room so we could squeeze a roll away bed in. The roll away was not very comfy so we didn't use it. The happy hour was great and we enjoyed the 5th floor bar when we got in at the end of the day. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room - but there is free coffee in the lobby if you can get down there before 9am - i think. What ever time it was we managed to miss it each morning. All in all a really lovely place to stay and brilliant value for money. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best value in SF”
Reviews.Author: otto1297
Reviews.Content: Wow- everything here was excellent. Check in was a snap, and the desk staff were very pleasant. Room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable, with soft linens. Most importantly, despite its excellent location close to Union Square and the Moscone Center, the room was very quiet. The location is outstanding- you can walk just about anywhere within a few minutes. I can stay pretty much anywhere I want (since the companies I am visiting will cover the charges) but choose Kimpton for a variety of reasons (usually have a good restaurant/cafe in the hotel, well-trained staff-i.e. not rude and rarely say "i don't know"!, and they don't try to insult you by charging you to log onto an existing wireless internet signal!). Didn't eat in the restaurant so cannot comment. Parking rate ($29?) was fair for SF an d less than others I have used recently- which went up to $36/night. Even the garage in the basement has a sitting area with a couch to sit and wait and the valets were quite accomodating- minor things but something that might aggravate you if they were absent. I will definitely stay here again. BTW have already recommended this property to one friend who stayed and loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for a better experience”
Reviews.Author: grewmullins
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an anniversary trip to San Francisco and stayed at Hotel Palomar. I stressed over where to stay as we had never been to San Francisco and I wanted this trip to be extra special. Given the hotel choices, this was no easy feat. I knew as soon as I called to book my reservation that I had made the right choice. The hotel concierge, Lauren, offered to assist with all details related to our stay in San Francisco. Lauren recommended restaurants, wineries to visit in Napa and places to see in the city. She made dinner reservations at some of the nicest restaurants and each dinner was topped off with a special treat from the chef wishing us a happy anniversary - thanks to Lauren. I can't say enough about her - she is awesome! My one regret is not getting to meet her during our stay. However, she made sure that we were in good hands with Daniel as he stepped in to ensure that everything went off without a hitch in her absence. He even arranged a last minute car rental that met our exact specifications. The staff was incredible and asked throughout the stay if our anniversary trip was going well. Even though the prompt was in the reservation system, it still meant a lot for them to do this every time we visited the front desk. The hotel has the perfect location - close to the Ferry Building, Powell Street Cable Car Turnabout and shopping. I can't say enough about this place. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located to the Moscone center”
Reviews.Author: austinsong
Reviews.Content: my first Kimpton stay, won't be my last. I chose this because it is close to the convention center but also centrally located on Market St, easy to hop on the cable car or walk to Union Sq or Chinatown. The room was spacious, with a view of Market St. Noise was muted (we were on the 8th floor) by double-paned glass but you will be able to hear the trolley and the subway moving past. Staff were attentive when the room safe didn't work....twice. They brought a replacement hairdryer when the wall-mounted one caught on fire (yes, flames coming out the back). The beds are too soft for my taste and sag in the middle. Sign up for their frequent-guest program to get free wi-fi. This is a pet friendly hotel, with the manager's labrador sometimes behind the desk. Wish I could have brought my pup too.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hopscotch31
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Palomar because we had great experience with our other Kimpton Hotel stay. My one complaint and disappointment has to be the bed. Having spent a long day flying in, we look forward to a comfortable bed for some much needed snooze. When I pulled back the sheets, I was shocked and appalled to see the mattress through the sheets (very thin) - like a motel bed. The mattress pad was strapped on but it was much too small for the king size bad. Honestly, it was also paper thin. As brought up by one of the reviews, I had expected more. If not a pillow top (which is what I would expect given this is considered a luxury boutique hotel), at least a pad that covers up the mattress. Even more disconcerting was that when house keeping (very cordial and helpful - bless their hearts) came to help remedy the situation, they could not locate a pad that would fit a king size bed. What made it all ok was that the two house keeping staff were very accommodating with my request to pad the mattress with several sheets, which by the way helped to create a nice comfortable padding. I just felt bad that they had to remake my bed at midnight. Where's management in all of this. If this had been an earlier complaint, shouldn't management have already addressed this deficiency? Bottom line, it is unacceptable that a hotel of this caliber is lacking in something so fundamental as the comfort of its beds.

Reviews.Title: “just the ticket..”
Reviews.Author: weleasewodger
Reviews.Content: It's always great to find a hotel that doesn't stand out externally but has all the best bits on the inside. Location is perfect, service is casually elegant and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The restaurant on level 5 was a jewel in the crown - you pay a good price for a great meal. This will be our choice for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Food_Snob_PA
Reviews.Content: A unique and special hotel that happened to offer a great special rate! First class hotel, spectacular service, unbelievable location, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back here in a flash”
Reviews.Author: Buffalodeb
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful, boutique hotel with outstanding front desk & concierge (Chris S., Tim and Lauren went all out for us). We were given outstanding recommendations from restaurants to what tours we should & should not do. The directions to all our adventures were clear and allowed us to save money and enabled us to easily navigate the city. I would have given 5 stars all the way if our housekeeping was consistent each day. Upon arrival, we discovered our desk chair was covered with white stuff that came off all over my black pants. (Management did immediately resolve this and sent up a bottle of wine.) Our extra towel request (wash & hand) ended up being taken care of by the front desk each evening. Other than these minor issues, the room was very comfortable. Best coffee tip: Blue Bottle Best Breakfast: Harvey's Best Sushi: Ozumo & Ryoko's Best Vegetarian: Millennium and Greens Best Seafood w/ great service & view: Waterbar

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and more so”
Reviews.Author: cdnfamilytraveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughter for school break and had asked the concierge a lot of questions in advance. The concierge, DC, was so wonderful, patient and helpful that we ended up with a fantastically planned trip for us both. The room was beautiful. The desk staff, in particular Lauren, responded to all our requests there and made additional arrangements for us. The breakfast staff were also so lovely, remembered us every day and made arrangements for us. The whole experience was a delight and I can't think of how it could have been better! My daughter loved the whole experience and the hotel - for a teenage girl to love anything is a real accomplishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, locale, and clean”
Reviews.Author: Traveler93277
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this Hotel based on its raving reviews. Its definitely all the rave! Perfect location in Union Square. Staff was very helpful and polite. Decor was hip and stylish without being over the top. Fabulous water pressure in the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Palomar in March 2010. The hotel is very centrally located on the corner of Market and 4th street. From the airport we took the BART ($8.10 adult) to Powell street station which is just around the corner from the hotel. Our room was overlooking Market street which is one of the main streets in the city. There was some noise from the street, but it certainly didn't keep us awake at night. Our room had 2 double beds and we found it was quite spacious and modern. We booked up via the hotel website and received vouchers for continental breakfast. The selection wasn't huge, but the quality of the fruit, croissants and muffins were far superior to the majority of the other hotels we have stayed in. The staff were quite friendly with us and answered any questions we had in regards to travelling around the city etc. San Francisco is a great city to visit and the Hotel Palomar is well located to ensure you are able to get around on foot or by public transport. I would highly recommend a visit to Alcatraz, it is a good idea to book up online before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location for Money”
Reviews.Author: MrMoyeni
Reviews.Content: This is a great small private hotel with a very welcoming staff. The location is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and crisp good quality hotel in the heart of central San Fancisco. The hotel is close to everything including good shopping, public transport and Union Square. The rooms are clean and modern and the bed is very comfortable with quality linen. The shower head was powerful, and the room had a shower and bath. My roomed looked out into a central courtyard and to other rooms, but some rooms would have a street view which might be noisey. I have stayed in San Fran several times before and have often found hotel rooms to be noisey with street noise but this room was very quiet which was great. The rooms dont have a jug or cups which means you cant make a coffee when you want. The wine hour is a nice touch and I enjoyed the odd hot chocolate during the afternoon coffee hour. which they also host. I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful and genuine in their attempts to help. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a great base to explore San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Fun and friendly”
Reviews.Author: grywhp
Reviews.Content: Here for 3 nights - great location, lots of shopping and eating opportunities plus easy access to the Moscone. Only minor complaint - not the most comfortable bed. Staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us a map of Sonoma/Napa wineries with the hours, addresses, and phone numbers on the back and whether they were open to the public or we needed to make an appointment - saved me hours of research! Awesome hot chocolate bar in the lobby, perfect for a brisk March afternoon. Real whipped cream...need I say more? Got a yoga mat delivered to my room and complimentary yoga and pilates on the TV. I love Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: bluheron
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel it was a great bargain and very well located on rail / bart lines. The staff were so helpful and friendly. We loved our room, which is a bit on the small side but that is to be expected in the old historic buildings in SF.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly poor service”
Reviews.Author: NunuLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I have been a Kimpton in-touch member for a number of years. I travel to Berkeley from Los Angeles frequently on business and usually stay in the Monaco, Prescott or Triton--all Kimpton hotels--in SF. This time I joined my husband, who had been on business, for the weekend. I had once stayed in the Palomar in L.A., which is an outstanding hotel, and I had a special promotional deal, so I decided to book the Palomar. I met my husband on Friday evening at the hotel. We went out to dinner nearby and thought we would go to the bar to talk for about an hour at around 10:15. We were told that the manager had decided to close the bar early because the restaurant did not have much business, so it was the last call, but there was a mini bar in our room. That was not the point. Rather surprising for a supposedly full service hotel. This would never happen at the other Kimpton hotels I've stayed in. The room was certainly comfortable and adequate, though the bathroom was small. There was no "do not disturb" sign for the door. At 8:30AM the next morning the minibar person came knocking and woke us up. We asked for a sign to be put in our room when we left the hotel later on. When got back the sign was put on the door so housekeeping had not made it up by 6PM! It really was odd that the person did not have the common sense to realize that putting the sign on the door would produce this result. It took two hours to get housekeeping to come, by which time we left for dinner.( Earlier that day I asked the front desk make us a dinner reservation at nearby Fringale. They said they would. An hour later I came down to find they forgot, but they eventually made it.) A complimentary half bottle of wine was left as an apology for all this, which was nice and was appreciated as a gesture, but the poor service started again the next morning--Sunday. Housekeeping came by at 8AM on Monday and started banging doors and talking loudly, so we could not sleep. I then discovered that housekeeping had not left a shower cap or soap the previous day. When we checked out, the front desk gave us someone else's bill, misspelled my husband's name and had charged us for parking. (We had no car.)It took three tries before an accurate bill was produced. What was really appalling was the lack of professionalism on the part of the staff. They were without apology and sort of shrugged their shoulders indifferently. Many seem as if they are young kids with little training. The hotel's location is great, but I would not stay here again. If you want excellent and courteous service, try in this order for a Kimpton in SF: Monaco, Prescott, Triton, and the Monaco has a lovely restaurant and nice bar. Both of them will be open if you arrive late. In short, who needs to be treated badly and woken up early when you are trying to have a relaxing, romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Virginifer
Reviews.Content: We were on the tail end of our honeymoon and booked into the Palomar. We were lucky enough to receive an upgrade to a spa room. Staff are fantastic. Hotel is close to all amenities. Rooms are modern and clean. We enjoyed cocktail hour each afternoon. There is also a nice little restaurant about two doors down the road. Highly recommend and we will stay here next time we are in San Fran. Have just recommended it to my mother inlaw for her end of year stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Touches”
Reviews.Author: AmbiCoaster
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco at least twice a year for industry conferences so I try to limit my hotel stays to hotels close to Moscone Center. I've stayed at the Palomar numerous times over the years and I was pleasantly surprised that they remembered (I figured that I was just another digit in their database). And the way they remembered: The last stay, I was greeted with a complimentary plate of chocolate-dipped strawberries and a "Welcome Back!" card which was a pleasant surprise. As was the one before that where I got a "munchies basket." Very nice touch and makes me want to return, as I have over the years despite my occasional "deviations" to try other hotels to serve as comparisons. In all my stays over the years (usually for 9 to 10 days at a time), I've found the door staff extremely helpful, even once accommodating me on storing my luggage with them even after I had already checked out, attended another weeklong conference in Palo Alto and then returned to San Francisco to drop off the rental car but had a long layover until my flight left San Francisco that evening. The front desk staff has always been perfectly obliging and the one time I needed a cot for my room for a temporary guest, it was delivered as ordered, on time and without surcharge. They've also always granted my request to be assigned a non-smoking (I'm very particular about that) room far from the elevators, the ice machine and any vending machines, preferably at the end of the corridor so I don't have to deal with drunk, late-night revelers who like to have conversations at the top of their lungs at 3am in the morning. The free in-room WiFi access has always been up to snuff (I'm a data network engineer/designer) and I have no complaints. The location only two blocks away from the Moscone Center complex is invaluable when one needs to drop off a heavy load of computers before heading out to dinner with colleagues and is close enough even for the quick freshening up before dinner or even a quick nap! I only have two major quibbles. Firstly, that they don't always publish their special rates far enough ahead of time even on their own reservations portal (I'm a Kimpton In-Touch member and I sometimes book two months or more ahead of a stay) and really hate leaving things to the last minute so I end up booking with other hotels because the Palomar's regular rate is astronomical and I always look for their special rates (usually a difference between $400-500/night versus $140-190/night). Secondly, the Fifth Floor restaurant is high end but it also has portions at "high-end sizes" (i.e., you need to either be a stick-thin supermodel that eats like a bird or you have to order two complete meals just to not starve to death). The two times I've dined there, I've almost had to whip out a magnifying glass to see the portions. The following are not quibbles but just statements of fact. Sometimes, the rooms I've been assigned have been about the size of a postage stamp but I don't care because I spend 99% of my waking time outside of it anyway and so long as it's quiet (it always is) when I need to sleep or do some work, I'm fine with it. Other times, I've had rooms big enough to accommodate another full-sized bed in there. Without exception, the furniture has always been functional and perfectly comfortable and I love their soaps (unlike at other hotels in the SF area, their's doesn't leave a sticky film on my body after using them). Colors of the rooms and corridors are generally muted but that's also what I want because I want tranquil colors when I'm about to rest, not something jarring and dazzling to wake me up--for that I can always drink coffee! Room staff has always been adequate possibly because I am sufficiently multilingual to speak to many of them in their own language. Being a polyglot helps when you would like that extra touch. I've never ordered room service because I tend to dine out and not want to be limited by the menu offerings.

Reviews.Title: “What fun we had”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: We are three ladies in our 50s who travelled to San Francisco for Thanksgiving. We chose the Palomar because it suited our budget, was in a good location and looked to have a certain kind of quirkiness which appealed to us. We weren't disappointed. The room was lovely and we adored the different animal skin themes - robes, slippers, wallpaper, and carpet. The beds were comfortable and the hotel seemed to be very quiet. The staff are a great asset and were, without exception, helpful and friendly. We enjoyed some of the wine tasting, but didn't eat in the restaurant. Our Thanksgiving Meal at the Marines Memorial Club was amazing - both from the people watching and food point of view. We had a wonderful trip, San Francisco is a fantastic city and the Palomar is a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: AuntJester
Reviews.Content: We are extensive travelers for both business and pleasure. On a previous trip, we had stayed at a Kimpton property and we fell in love with this chain. We had high expectations for this hotel but it didn't meet them. We arrived and had to bring in our own luggage because there was no one in the lobby. The lobby was a small room with no personality. When we got to our rooms, we noticed that the furniture was worn, paint was chipped and there was dirty glasses, used soap and towels in the bathrooms. We let the manager know and he apologized and sent housekeeping back to clean. I will say he tried to make it right by sending up an appetizer that consisted of 3 pieces of cheese, five almonds and a honey comb. On our third day, we came back to our room unexpectedly and the housekeeper was going through our room. Once this hotel gets their housekeeping and maintenance fixed it will be a great place to stay. If you are attending a convention it is very convenient and the larger rooms are great. The staff was friendly and we love that they are pet friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in San Fran! You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Jess1779
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had two days to vacation in San Francisco. After reading reviews on numerous travel sites we chose Hotel Palomar and we couldn't be happier. The staff is fabulous! From the moment we walked in we were given the star treatment. They had a hot chocolate and apple cider bar - Yummy! Tip: Join Kimpton InTouch before you go and you will get 2 free items from the mini bar! You also get a complimentary shoe shine :) The rooms are very cozy and pretty spacious for San Francisco and the beds are comfortable. You must take advantage of the wine reception nightly! They serve decent wine and you get a chance to meet other hotel guests. The location is perfect - so close to Union Square and great restaurants. The cable car line is one block away so if you want to go to the Fisherman's Wharf it's a nice option. Bottom line - Great hotel! Stay here and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY AT THE PALOMAR”
Reviews.Author: BeachNut
Reviews.Content: If you’re used to staying at one of the big hotel chains, as we are, this hotel is NOT for you. Needless to say, we couldn’t leave fast enough. This small, contemporary, boutique style hotel caters to a ‘different’ type of clientele. Our luxury King room was small and came equipped with Zebra and Tiger striped bath robes, in room safe, a flat screen tv, small table and two chairs, clock radio with ipod dock and large mirror on the wall. One thing missing that most hotels seem to have, is the latch across the front of the entrance door, although it does have a deadbolt. Also attached, is a large bathroom complete with small corner shower, with barely enough room to turn around in, and a 4 ft. HIGH not wide jetted tub. Not sure how anyone could climb into that using the small step below the faucet. Also not sure why the shower stall is so small given the size of the bathroom. The hotel is located in the hub of San Francisco - close to Union Square, all kinds of shops, restaurants, and transportation, but difficult to find if you’re not familiar with the area and what to look for. We had to circle the block a few times, in the dark, before we found it. Pretty scary considering the kinds of people on the streets at midnight, and the amount of police cars on those streets. It’s located 5 floors above a storefront, with only a small, canopied, entranceway, and a practically non-existent lobby. Look for the hotel’s sign 5 floors above street level. The rooms are pretty noisy. We could hear people talking loudly in the hallway. Almost felt like they were in the room with us. We could hear toilets flushing, tubs being filled up, water flowing, etc. The noise from the street at night too is unbelievable. We couldn’t sleep with all the sirens from police cars, fire trucks, and honking at night. Unfortunately, we can’t provide details or feedback on the rest of the hotel, as we arrived close to midnight and checked out before 8 a.m. the following morning. Couldn’t leave fast enough. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: everett_rainier
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations for a big city hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerRick
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Half block from BART terminal and cable car stop. New Westfield Mall is just around corner that has a great food court with real food not fast food at reasonable price. Good central location. Room was nice,quiet and good sized. Good bed and shower with plenty of pressure and hot water. Daily paper provided (WSJ, NYT and local). Staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for site seeing!”
Reviews.Author: charcanmore
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel (from airport, Bart $8.50per/person or is only about $40 cab) the staff were ALL very friendly and very helpful. The front desk manager Jake, was also there to help and went out of his way to make sure we were happy with everything. We booked an Executive King ($160 night inc tx) room but found it very small for a couple as there was no space around the bedroom to put 1 or even 2 suitcases, but the hotel staff were very helpful in finding us a large suite ($305 night inc tx), we loved the decor and spaciousness and the separate soaker tub, but found the price, for low season, a tad high. We would only recommend the King room to a single person with little luggage! All the rooms were very nice with a modern style which is why we chose this hotel; although we liked the furniture, it needed some stain touch ups. The hotel should add a coffee-maker to the rooms! Very nice wine tasting was free to drop in, in the early evening and we had a wonderful dinner at the hotels restaurant "Fifth Floor" which was delicious, creative, elegant, including the service, and the price of wine and food was very correct. The hotel breakfast on the other hand seemed pricey for what it was. We went to San Fran for a long weekend holiday and found the hotels location very easy to find, easy to catch the Bart (1 block), the cable car (1 block) and the rail car (1 block). The amenities were all close as well, walgreens (2 with in 1 block), hundreds of boutiques lining Market St as well as a beautiful indoor shopping mall and we also found a nice liqor and wine shop (3 blocks). Take the rail car to the ferry building and fill up on amazing crab (crab tower or baked crab cake) and oysters at "Ferry Plaza Seafood" (inside ferry building on the water side). Other restaurants we enjoyed were "Annabelles Bar & Bistro" for dinner or just drinks, which is just 2 doors down from the hotels front entrance and another great dinner is a short cab West on Market St, "Zuni" is modern Italien/French food and the setting is sheek but rustic!!! About five blocks away is a great breakfast place called "Cafe de la Presse" (in front of the entrance gate to China Town). Overall we liked this hotel and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Room”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Palomar DC, i already had high hopes for the Palomar SF. Although the lobby wasn't near that of the DC version, who really cares about a lobby in a boutique hotel? Besides, the 5th Floor restaurant lounge area kicked major @ss over anything at the DC Palomar. Very swank and innovative how it is placed amidst the rooms of the 5th floor. Very neat. The staff (especially Lauren) were uber friendly and knowledgeable. The wine hour was great. The free internet and USA Today were major plusses. I got a super rate of $143 during the work week!! I took advantage of the $15/night upgrade (if available...and it was my week), and glad I did. I got an oversized room overlooking Ellis St. on the 8th floor. The room was very comfortable and the bed one of the best I've stayed in since the Ritz-Carlton St. Louis. It made it very difficult to get up for work in the morning!! Overall, a terrific stay and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find, good sized rooms, classy, great location”
Reviews.Author: bronzeroof
Reviews.Content: Good value in SF near Union Square. Very friendly staff, pet friendly. Modern hotel within a couple blocks of Union Square. Free breakfast, free internet, nice wine hour in evenings. Close to shopping, Metreon, restaurants. Would stay there again. Only knocks are $45 valet parking and smallish fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: mmarie
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been happier with my stay at Hotel Palomar. The hotel is in a great location, convenient to both BART, the trolleys, and incredible shopping. My room was quiet with a fantastic view. The hotel is modern yet comfortable and the staff is superb. I look forward to many return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: shelllady
Reviews.Content: I was going to San Francisco for an event at the Moscone Center so I looked at TripAdvisor to find a good hotel near by. I was impressed that the Palomar management read and responded to many of the reviews. This indicated that they are committed to excellent customer service, and they are. My room was clean and quiet with amenities including an extremely comfortable bed, a hairdryer that actually dries your hair, a make-up mirror, adjustable shower head, rosemary mint Aveda hair products, pocket bathroom door, iPod docking station, an evening wine hour and more. I joined Kimpton InTouch and also received free wi-fi, a ten dollar voucher for the mini-bar, and room, pillow and newspaper preferences. One reviewer complained because there was no coffee maker in the room. It is nice to be able to have coffee at any time without having to get dressed, but then you end up with powdered creamer rather than the fresh cream, milk, soy milk, honey and lemon wedges they provide with the coffee. Getting to and from the Palomar from SFO was easy. The Powell Street BART station is very close and it is only $8.20 each way. They even printed my airline boarding pass for me. I liked knowing that I could have brought my pets and enjoyed meeting Mo. I believe his title is Director of Pet Services. I wish I could have stayed longer. Kimpton has become my favorite hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nyc_digitaldad
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the hotel as part of a whirlwhind business trip. Checkin swift but friendly. I *like* the separation of lobby from other functions (lounge, bar, business center, whatever), so others' complaints regarding the minimal lobby are positives for me, as we had two intelligent and affable attendants to ourselves. The lounge (6th floor?) is swanky and comfortable. Restaurant a bit too pricey for my per diem so didn't try it. The room (their smaller, courtyard-view room) was perfect for solo traveler. Great design, clean, etc. Bonus: their contracted limo service to the airport was fabulous and with cost comparable to a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lp63
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be more disappointing. The lobby is small, the valet is MIA, the rooms are uninspired with windows that only start halfway up the wall. For the $300+ rate they're charging per night, you'd be much better off down the street at The Westin or Le Meridien.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HikerJohn
Reviews.Content: Fun place to stay in downtown San Francisco. Close to the BART and streetcar. Lots of shopping and good food within a few blocks. Infact it is above a giant Old Navy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: parkplace09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, in the executive King Room. The decor is very lovely and the bed comfortable. Our room was quiet. We loved the wine tasting and morning coffee. They also had complimentary ice cream in the afternoon but we weren't there in the day. I got a great deal for about $150 a night. The hotel is located right at a BART station and right near many muni and bus stops. I would definitely stay again. One thing that was odd was that the bathroom door opens right where the head of the bed is...unlike many hotel rooms where the bathroom opens into the entryway. Our bathroom had a weird smell of smoke sometimes - I think probably from some room below us (we were on the 5th floor, and the 4th floor does not belong to the hotel). The staff was very friendly and gave us chocolate bars when we checked in. We also liked the option to have them print up your boarding pass for your flight home. Its very convenient to check-out, and get on the BART to SFO. The free wireless internet was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location!”
Reviews.Author: VisaliaSimpleLife
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all...luxury and location! We were only there for 3 nights, but really hated to leave. Normally we stay on Powell street at the Villa Florence Hotel or in the financial district at the Omni Hotel. The Palomar blew them both out of the water with their quality of customer service, large quiet rooms and great location! The Palomar is within walking distance to the Farmer's Market, shopping, restaurants, public transportation and various attractions. Parking is a breeze at this hotel since they have an underground parking structure. We did not have a chance to try the restaurant located in the hotel because we had "shopped-till-we-dropped", but we do plan on staying there again next month so we will definately try it out at that time. If customer service is important to you, you gotta stay at the Hotel Palomar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: SusanCassidy
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to recommend the Hotel Palomar for anyone planning a trip to San Francisco, the location is amazing all local amenities to hand at your doorstep. From checking and throughout our stay the staff were helpful friendly and polite, nothing was too much trouble to them at all. It was my partners 40th Birthday when we were there and had pre arranged through Kuoni and the hotel concierge DC a hamper and birthday cake which were delivered without any problems. We were upgraded room when we arrived and wow what a surprise a view of the Zen Garden roof and so quiet a room, they also gave us tickets for daily continetal breakfast which was a nice treat and a $10 voucher for the mini bar. Albert who delivered our bags to our roomadvised us if we wanted somewhere cheap to eat and great food to visit the Westfield Mall just round the corner from the hotel and certainly this delivered Alberts promise, we especially would recommend Buckhorn's Tri-Tips sirlion steak, amazing and so inexpensive. We both fell in love with the San Francisco and the Hotel just put the icing on the cake for the trip. Will certainly use Kimpton Hotels again and advise you to sign up for the intouch card on their website before going.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaffa12
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than lived up to the great reviews. Fantastic location within walking distance to the BART at Union Square. We arrived around noon after an overseas flight and an early check-in was not a problem. Room was beautifully decorated and beds v. comfortable; no noise issues on the 5th floor. Pleasantly surprised with the wine at happy hour and the coffee/tea in the lounge in the morning. Staff at front desk v. friendly and helpful. Internet access a bit rich at $6/15 minutes,( but we found a cheaper place just down Market St.) Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: curlyjoeNJ
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to echo the positive sentiments expressed by prior reviewers because this hotel is a real find in San Francisco. We could not have felt more welcomed to the Palomar, from the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel. The guys who checked us in not only gave us a great corner room on a high floor, they spent a lot of time talking to us about our trip and what we wanted to see to make sure we did not miss anything in San Francisco. They really love their city and are great ambassadors. Everyone at the front desk and valet station was extremely helpful throughout our stay, for everything from bus directions to dinner reservations. Our room was very nice and spacious, with a large bedroom and separate sitting area. We had a corner room on the 8th floor, so we had a great view of Market Street and felt right in the middle of everything. The bed was very comfortable, and I loved the animal print robes. The bathroom was small (combined tub and shower) but very nice and clean, with little conveniences like a lighted makeup mirror. We also appreciated the morning coffee and tea on the 5th floor, which helped us wake up and get ready for the day before we hit that San Francisco wind (brrr). The location is perfect, because you are in the middle of Union Square (great for shopping, dining, etc.) and convenient to public transportation. Like other reviewers, we also noted that parking was quite expensive (twice the cost of parking in a nearby lot), but we appreciated the convenience of having the valet service right in the hotel and not having to worry that our car would get dented, ticketed, cold, whatever. Also, the hotel is such a good value that we did not feel terrible about the extra expense. Thank you to everyone for such a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service before arrival!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth247
Reviews.Content: One thing I have to say about this property is that the pre-arrival service is fantastic. I received an email from the manager - okay, probably automated, but it was very welcoming. Also, I had to make a change to my reservation that was sure to cost me money, and DC at the Front Desk was a gem and waved any additional costs. Wow, and I haven't even checked in yet. I am a member of their frequent stay program, but don't have any status with them, yet I feel treated as good or better than when I was Diamond at Hyatt... amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved the location”
Reviews.Author: pharrisslo
Reviews.Content: The Palomar was great for myself and a friend from Africa who arrived at SFO and wanted to shop, shop, shop! The room was large and the beds were great--our view was of the roof of The Container Store, which was a little weird, but since no one was shopping there at night it was very quiet and we both slept well. The bar is terrific and the bartender, Roland, was great (try his drink--I can't remember the name-- made with Buffalo Trace bourbon and pink lemonade. Addictive!) My only quibble is that the happy hour, with free wine, was downright strange--the bar and restaurant is on the 5th floor, and the set-up is in a room adjacent to the bar, which is an awful lot like a conference room. It was uncomfortable and not much fun. I have stayed at another Kimpton hotel in SF, the Triton--their happy hour is in the lobby where you can do some great people watching, meet the other guests, etc. Although the Palomar's lobby is small, it would be a lot more fun than this stuffy, dark spot on the 5th floor.
