One tip on parking--the rates are high here, so I left my car at the offsite parking at SFO, met my friend, we jumped on BART (right there at the Intl. terminal) and got off at Powell Street--basically at the front door of the hotel. We rode public transport, or walked, everywhere and the total cost for a weekend of parking: $27 (I got a coupon for a free night online)

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed with this Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: Nick4u
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a Deluxe suite. The suite was relatively small and the furniture in the sitting area was a tacky orange velour. What must have been a connecting door to another room was an ugly metal door. The king bed was comfortable and the drapes kept it very dark even in the morning. The room was quiet but we were on the 9th floor. The bathroom was large but the shower stall looked cheap and the 3' deep whirlpool tub unattractive. The lobby to the hotel was uninspired and just like the room needed a makeover. We took advantage of the valet parking but at $45.00/night it was expensive. The location was fine, close to Union Square and many high end retail stores. We have stayed at many Kimpton hotels but this hotel was a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBlackstock
Reviews.Content: Asked for a quiet room and got one on the street front, but not a problem as the glazing is that good, there was no noise. Very unusual for a city centre hotel. Ideally situated for just about everything, walking to wharf took only 20 minutes, most other places within the same time. The staff are great, extraordinarily helpful with recommendations and help on anything else. This will be my hotel of choice for San Francisco for future visits, although it is a wee bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar SF-Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jenranstork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our Honeymoon. Found a great deal for this Hotel stay on travelzoo. Excellent location in SF. Staff were fantastic. Wine in the evening, ice cream in the afternoon. A little Goldfish waiting for you when you get to your room. The staff were so kind to us. Sent us a bottle of Pink Champange and chocolate covered stawberries and upgraded our room to the huge jacuzzi tub..Very comforatble beds. This hotel was great. No street noise or from other rooms. Excellent stay. Highly recommend this location and hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here - You Will Not Regret It!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen624
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 7/8-7/11. This hotel is excellent - we received an extremely warm welcome from the front desk - room was roomy and had a great view of Market Street below. Staff was very informative about attractions and places to go. Location was right on Market Street, very central for all transportation and was actually adjoined to the Westfield Center Mall (you should visit here to see the dome). I felt comfortable enough to let my two teenagers 18 and 16 venture out for some independent exploring (do avoid Mission Street though). San Francisco is awesome - if I win the lottery I'm moving. Hotel had lovely touches such as free ice-cream and wine daily - excellent place - do remember to sign up for Kimpton Priority Club (something like that) for free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaW
Reviews.Content: Just stayed four days here and this was one of the nicest hotel stays I've ever had. The room was beautiful and everything very comfortable (including bed and pillows, which is very important to me). I requested a high-floor interior room as I really wanted quiet, and it was very quiet. Being on the interior, the high fllor probably wouldn't matter. It was very convienient to get the free coffee in the morning as that floor is in the middle of the hotel, and of course, the location is very convenient for public transportation anywhere in the city (being right on the cable car line and the trolley line running from the wharf along Embarcadero). The rates were very reasonable for that level hotel, I thought, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I have nothing bad to say at all about it. The only minor quibble I could make is I was surprised they didn't include a shower cap in their free bathroom amenities, as many hotels do, but I did bring my own, so it didn't matter to me. I rented a car to leave SF, and it is also very convenient as there is a Hertz rental desk in the Marriott right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: euroluxtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Palomar in SF last week. Very nice hotel with wonderful and very helpful employees. Rooms are nice and clean. Free Wi-Fi, which works quite good. Good location; short walk to Union Square, cable car, Moscone Centre, BART station,…. Great room service. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: momofmaddie
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Hotel Palomar as I write this review. I booked through Travelzoo, so I don't know if that had anything to do with the lack of service I received. There are many amazing pluses about this hotel. It has a great location, the rooms are beautiful, and they have ice cream in the afternoon, and a happy hour. Now for the negatives. We arrived at around 3:00 p.m. and promptly checked in. We had been up since 4 a.m. and were dying to take a nap in the luxurious linens. There happened to be a band playing right outside the window (which is not the hotel's fault) and it was so loud that we could not sleep. Hoping that the front desk had ear plugs, I called down and was met with a lukewarm response. "Uh, I don't know if we have any, but if we do I will send some up". So I got up and got dressed and waited for the ear plugs. Thirty minutes later, no ear plugs, and the band was still pounding. I called down again to the desk. "They are bringing them up right now". So I stayed dressed for another 30 minutes. No ear plugs. So I finally gave up. I wouldn't mind if they didn't have earplugs, but then they shouldn't repeatedly say that they do and then not send them to the room. My other issue is with the bath. I purposely booked a luxury king with the Fugi soaking tub, because I love to take baths while on vacation. According to their web site: "four feet deep Fuji Spa tub with a Tub Menu for a personalized bathing experience." I thought, "this is the ultimate tub experience!". So again I called down to the front desk and mentioned that on their website says that with the luxury king there is a tub menu, and asked what does that include? The young man at the front desk said, "Uh, look in the orange booklet, it tells you how to use the tub". I say, "well, your website mentions a "tub menu" with bath products." Young man: "well we might have bath salts here at the front desk, I will send some up." I think great, I will have a bath before I leave." So guess what they send up? A bar of soap, which I already have in the bathroom. So would I recommend this hotel? Yes, but with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: gypsytraveler01
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Palomar and had a wonderful experience. Our stay was from June 28, 2009 until July 1, 2009. The location of the hotel is great. It was easy to take buses and cable cars from this hotel. The cable car stop was a short walk to Union Square. Plenty of places to eat near this hotel also. Mel's Diner is on the next corner. Room service was perfect. The food was delicious and hot. Everything we ordered from room service was delivered within 15 minutes. The parking garage was great too. Our kids had bikes for the parks and bridge which were stored in our auto. Everything in out truck was perfectly safe because the parking garage is manned by Palomar employees. I have never been in a nicer parking garage. All employees were very nice and extrememly helpful. Our room was spotless and a great size. I would stay at this hotel anytime I am in San Fran and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: washoebob
Reviews.Content: Just a wonderful place. Great location. Helpful and friendly staff. Elegant yet casual. Great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymonkey
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal through expedia for $119 per night. the rooms are very modern, plasma tv, dvd player, I-dock and mini-bar. The bath-robes are a laugh. The location is terrific. Can't get any more central. There was a free wine reception between 5-6pm every day for guests. Nice touch. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is spectactular!!”
Reviews.Author: meeshelle81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very conveniently to shopping and restaurants. The staff is extremely friendly and so helpful. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: kglavin
Reviews.Content: This location, 2 blocks from Union Square, but on the bus and trolley line, was great. The desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. The rooms are up five floors and so even though on a major street, it was not noisy. Rooms were very nice and sleek, not overly big, but roomy for t wo. Bath was on small size and nothing special. Wine was served on 5th floor every night, but area was kind of dark with no windows or view. Hear the dining room was good. Front desk arranged a quick, 25min, van to airport for $15-20.00. Worth it because the hotel was last stop before airport and so it was very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel... Loved the calmness and cleaness”
Reviews.Author: GeoTes
Reviews.Content: I went for a business trip to San Francisco and I am from India. Before going I talked to the hotel reception guys over the phone and they really guided me how to reach the hotel from the SFO airport. They way they responded to my queries was first of all excellent. On reaching there they given me wonderful ideas on where to go for sight seeing and pleasure activities. Though my checkin time was 3 pm, they allowed me to check in earlier without any hesitation. Room was ready enough to welcome me. So calm hotel, atmosphere is so good. Cleaning and other stuff is fantasic. Next time I go there I would like to stay there at Hotel Palomar. Its really fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, just excellent”
Reviews.Author: a1_hotel_rater
Reviews.Content: The Palomar San Francisco is a great hotel in a great location just off Market Street, near a BART station, tram stops, and not too far from the Caltrain station which is further down 4th street (a 20 minute walk away). The hotel itself is excellent, the experience starts at the front desk when you check in, and throughout your stay the staff are excellent, and the rooms too are very well appointed, with a great bathroom. City centres can be stressful places, but when you step into the Palomar you feel like you leave the city behind. I highly recommend the hotel, for business and tourists alike, the location is excellent, with excellent rooms, and fabulous staff. My one tip is to avoid one of the rooms facing onto the internal 'zen garden', these are smaller rooms, with no view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jnnnn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Executive King during our 5 night stay in May 09 and it was fantastic. The reception and restaurant staff were great. The room was comfy, spacious and clean. We really appreciated the small touches - wine tasting, great toilettries, loads of tv channels, in-room yoga and free wireless internet throughout the hotel. The food at the restaurant on level 5 was YUM! and if you want to venture out, the reception staff were very happy to recommend a restaurant nearby. The gym, however, is tiny but then again you can get all the exercise you need walking up and down all the hills of the city. Overall, fantastic stay - great food, great rooms, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Swish - well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fearghas
Reviews.Content: First off this place is really expensive. A little tip - if you can wait until the night before to book, the price plummets and you can get a relatively good deal. The lobby is very small and pokey on the ground floor. The hotel then starts on the 5th floor (floors 1-4 are part of a store next door). The bar and restaurant is a bit lifeless and souless and not great although they have a vast selection of liquor. The rooms though are gorgeous. The theme in my room was 'animal print' done in a really subtle, elegant way. The carpet, bed spread and furniture had a tasteful animal print (all one colour) that was really subtle and designery looking and must have cost a fortune. There was tacky leopard skin print underwear (both male and femaie) for sale in the closet along with matching robes. That was fun and interesting. Huge TV, iPod centre, nice minibar, complimentary newspaper and nice toiletries. The place is just so luxurious with fabulously comfortable beds. I ordered coffee to my room and it cost $15. I like a place to have a bit of a buzz and this hotel doesn't have it. There's no focal point for people so it feels a bit dead sometimes. The up side of this is that it feels really private. The staff were friendly in a real kind of way - not the fake-'have-a-nice-day'-plastic-nauseating friendly that pervades this country. I did enjoy this place though but would never pay the full price as I dont' think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better is always possible, but difficult to achieve”
Reviews.Author: 1berto
Reviews.Content: Impeccable check-in. An effort to please was almost always present. Big room with nice view and a decent bathroom. Price/quality quite fair. A later check-out was refused… Availability problem? Anyway, I will stay there again and recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great accomodations, food and fun!”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights... Check in was quick and easy. My standard room was on the top floor, nicely appointed and comfortable. Awesome L'Occitane bath products... I just love that stuff! We had a meeting in a great room on the 7th floor. Small board rooms are set in the corners of each floor. It was a perfect room for our small group. The second night we had dinner at the restaurant, 5th Floor. It was awesome! I had the Foie Gras Ravioli with a mushroom soup that was very rich. The soup was a very rich reduced stock that was just divine. For an entree I had scallops that came with fresh cut corn covered in zucchini. It was awesome. The service was just perfect and the poor server did not seem to be irritated with my boss who made too many politically incorrect comments over the course of the evening. Check out was a breeze. All of the emplyees were really nice... you could not ask for a better location. A stones throw from Union Square. Shopping and dining options abound! I hope I get the chance to go back, or try another Kimpton product in SFO!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ndtpunk71
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels like this. Small and cozy on the outside, but the room is spacious, clean, and contemporary. It's located practically on Market St. with easy access to the Bart and within walking distance to the Ferry building. They have free wine/beer every day betwee 5-6 PM (happy hour) which was a nice surprise. The only negative was the gym, which was a tiny room with a few weights and barely any ventilation. Anyway, after seeing the gym, I decided to jog to the bay area and had one of the best views of the city while getting a nice cardio workout.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay – but you aren’t encouraged to spend your free time there”
Reviews.Author: Will-HE_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar for 5 nights (Sat – Thu) and generally enjoyed the experience. The hotel is décor is in good condition and uses striking shapes, colours and patterns. The room I had was on the same floor as the bar/restaurant, and right next door, but I wasn’t bothered by noise or vibrations at any time. The room was decently sized, and well equipped with interesting fabrics and textures all in good condition. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom spotless. Whilst there was no anchorage for securing my MacBook, the room’s safe was large enough to hold it. The hotel is excellently situated on the corner of Market Street and 4th Street, adjacent to the Powell St BART / Muni stations, 2 blocks from Union Square and has amongst the best public transport links in the city – I used BART to get to and from SFO, and was delighted by the ease and convenience. I was disappointed by the restaurant / bar – it was often closed and hidden behind forbidding black doors, leaving the lounge outside with the feel of a well-appointed waiting area. The tone of a hotel is often set by its communal areas, and in this case it seemed impersonal and slightly soulless. I must briefly mention the appalling ‘free’ wi-fi – on logging in, one is presented with the free guest/ conferee connection, or the chance to pay to upgrade to a higher speed service. I opted for the free connection and the memories of 56k fax-modems came flooding back. If you are going to be working whilst at the Palomar, you will have to upgrade. It is disappointing to present yourself as a business-friendly hotel and then provide a service so blatantly designed to force a paid upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spectacular for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Uppahclass
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at the Palomar but had a great time - I had a double twin room and I found it roomy enough for an additional crib without it getting in the way, the bathroom was on the small side but still decently sized, water pressure was good, the beds were wonderfully comfortable, and there was plenty of natural light. The front desk was kind enough to accommodate our early check in by 11am, although housekeeping services was not nearly as good as in Asia where people answer the phone around the clock. Location was amazing - close to pretty much everything a tourist might want, with easy access to bus and MUNI. Best part is, I didn't have to shop for the lowest price - available directly on the hotel's website itself. Compared to other $100+ hotels I was considering in the same area, this was by far the best deal. I'm going back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great great great place”
Reviews.Author: HDLBruxelles
Reviews.Content: in vacation: you look for: -location: you have it: civic center (one of the center base to visit in SF), muni in front (without side effect), restaurant around (affordable and tops), shops, safe the night -helpful reception desk: gentle, cool, helpful to find activities, allways available to listen to you - clean hotel and room: without any doubt you find it - great room: good surface, good bed, nice. Moreover is you are enrolled in the kimpton touch , you receive special attention, never forget this point. In summary, there's a lot of hotel in SF, if you look this one, don't go further and make a reservation

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: jwbiv
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar has a wonderful location, great service and although rooms are slightly small, the amenties are terrific. One word of caution for those with budget concerns is the high cost of breakfast. However, there is a fun Mel's Diner a half block away with great breakfast values. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great, central location in San Fran. Also, being right on 4th street, it is very easily accessible from San Fran Airport.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are fabulous. I felt like a movie star.”
Reviews.Author: NorWesterner
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels that looks as nice in person as it does in the pictures. We stayed in a deluxe suite on the inside of the building with windows facing away from Market street. I was there for both work and visiting friends and brought my SO with me. It was great for everything we did. It was extremely quiet, with plenty of space , and we could close the doors if one person was working and the other wanted to watch TV. But perhaps the best part was the huge jet tub! It is literally about 4' deep with jets. There is a stair into the bathtub and a separate shower. Bring bubble bath! It was a great place to work and then have a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Jetagain
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton Corporation describes this hotel as a 4 star and, indeed, the room was spacious with newer decoration, a comfortable mattress, and spotless. It lacked a coffee maker which meant you had to have coffee/breakfast in their very expensive restaurant or brave the legions of derelicts to get coffee at Starbucks. The bathroom was tiny and while it had a newer sink, toilet, and floor tile, it still had the original tub and dingy ceramic tub surround. Worse yet, it lacked an exhaust fan so even the briefest shower turned the bathroom into a sauna. Be prepared to wait if you want to use the exercise equipment. The "fitness center" is shoehorned into one of their smaller hotel rooms and consists of one treadmill, one elliptical, one recumbent bike, and two weight machines. I was forewarned by reviews to request a room on a "nonpet" floor which I did one week before my stay. Nevertheless, they put us on the 8th floor where we listened to a yappy dog from about 9 to 10 pm. While some may call this hotel well located--walking distance to the Moscone Center, Chinatown, North Beach, and public transportation--it is also an area swarming with aggressive panhandlers and people who's behavior is not only bizarre but bizarre at high volumes. I didn't appreciate being intimidated every time a walked out the door and will look for a hotel in a less menacing neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrendanVancouver
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in San Francisco. Had a gerat stay at the Palomar. We arrived at just after 10 am on Saturday morning and were expecting to have to drop our bags and check in later, but they had a room for us and were more than happy to let us check in early. The room was very clean and we did have the robes that people on here have mentioned that are tiger and leopard print...but it is a little funny too. A few people mentioned that doors slamming in the hallway, I did hear it from time to time but it wasn't something that kept me up at night. We attended the wine tasting a couple of times and it was nice to have a little drink in the early evening. The rooms were very clean and just enough space. If I had two comments to make it would be that the staff are not as knowledgable as they could be as we received directions a couple of times and ended up taking a long route. The other is that the room service menu is quite limited. The location is quite spectacular for shopping and is a short 10 minute walk to the Ferry Building. The BART stops a few steps from the hotel so don't bother wasting $45 on a cab from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Palomar met all expectations and was the perfect start to a very special holiday.”
Reviews.Author: 2GuysSW
Reviews.Content: We did extensive trawling of hotel sites on the 'net when planning our round-the-world holiday and found the Palomar which looked great. We wanted a decent hotel - a little bit of luxury - without having to spend a fortune. We arrived after a 14hr flight and were so pleased that the images and the things that we had read were a true reflection of the reality. The reception staff were so friendly and very efficient that straight away our tiredness from travelling slipped away and we soon felt suitably refreshed to go straight out and start exploring San Francisco. The room was very spacious and met/exceeded expectations regarding decor and fitments and the bed was huge and probably the most comfortable that we have slept in. The room was also very quiet – there was no noise to be heard from inside or outside of the hotel at any point during our stay. The design, style and cleanliness of hotel bathrooms are so often a good indication of the general standard of the rest of a given hotel – we could not fault our bathroom in any way. Free WiFi was much appreciated. The hotel is within 100m of the Powell Street BART station, so, ideal for transport from/to the airport. It is also right next to stops on Market Street for the street cars and almost opposite a cable car stop (across Market Street) which were both great for travelling around the city. We were put off other hotels by reviews that we read which mentioned that they were in or near less desirable areas of the city which raised concerns about safety but we had no problems at all at the Palomar in this respect. The daily wine tasting in the reception area was a nice idea but we were a little disappointed that the person manning the desk, although very pleasant, was not at all knowledgeable about the wine that they were serving other than reading the label on the bottle whether it was a Merlot, Shiraz, Chardonnay etc. Considering California is a major world wine producer it would be have been good to have been told a little more detail about the wines being offered. At all other times when we needed information or assistance we found the reception staff to be extremely knowledgeable and so willing to help make our stay in San Francisco such a pleasant experience. If we had any suggestions for improvement it would be that there could have been tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We booked our stay at the Palomar on Hotels.com and got a very good rate. The thing that we liked the most about the Palomar was the location (and the hotel room and the staff!). There really wasn’t anything that we didn’t like. If we return to San Francisco we would definitely want to stay at the Palomar - there is no need for us to look at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Mr_GDevon
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the Intercontinental around the corner and stayed there for 3 nights, the hotel was good and the room spacious...the only negitive was the charges for the internet....and they wouldnt give a favourable rate for the following three nights as a big conference was arriving in town....I found the Palomar on line and a great rate via Expedia, more than 50% less than the Intercontinental.... It was great not as new as the Intercontinental but the service was great and the room had everything we needed....and FREE internet!!! The team at the Palomar were excellent, very freindly, happy to help and they had a smile on their faces!!! A great hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NFA
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Francisco for a weekend, this is a great hotel to stay in. You have access to the whole city from Market &4th. You are right next to BART stations, bus lines, muni, MOMA, union square, shopping. The rooms are very small, but clean and tasteful. I was in a courtyard room during the weekend of the Chinese New Year Parade. I could hear the drums practicing from my hotel room, but for the rest of my stay, and all through the night, my room was very quiet. I didn't spend much time in the hotel-they had a restaurant and bar. I was not impressed with their business center-2 computers which you had to pay for internet service on. All in all-this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1896
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for just one night before leaving SF. The Palomar is very nice hotel. An urbane, fashionable lobby. The staff was upbeat. The room was smartly appointed & roomy. My one quibble was the bathroom. A bit tiny & easy to bump into things. We didn't dine at the famed Fifth Floor restaurant but the decor looked great! The location is good. The area is not attractive. But the hotel is close to many galleries & funky stores. Overall, an enjoyable stay & we would highly recommend the Palomar. FREE WIFI. A HUGE PLUS since hotels like the Stanford Court charge for daily use of the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful service, great location, lovely wine hour-- what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Iggy33
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its boutique nature and its proximity to the Moscone Center where I was for a convention and I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. From my late check-in (we arrived at 11pm and they brought a bottle of wine to our room since we missed the wine reception) to the last seconds before our departure (they gave us the latest possible checkout time) I felt that the staff bent over backwards to be helpful. I felt very at home in the hotel and by the second day it seemed that everyone there knew my name, which is something rare in a big town like SF. The rooms have all been redone and the bathrooms are on the small side but new and clean. I loved the l'Occitane shea butter toiletries and the animal print robes (could have done without the pj's for sale in the closet, though) and the room was peaceful for being in such a busy location. I know this will be the third time I mention wine in this review, but I just have to reiterate what a treat the wine reception each evening was- someone refilling your glass with local vignobles while you kick back in the leather armchairs of the restaurant lounge in dim lighting- I can't think of a more perfect way to unwind after a long day of business meetings and before an evening of work dinners. Having stayed in numerous other hotels in SF (Renaissance, Le Meridien, Westin St. Francis, Grand Hyatt, to name a few) I can say that if you prefer a boutique atmosphere this will beat out all of them (except maybe the St. Regis, to be fair :)... All in all, a great experience and I will be staying at the Palomar for all of my future meetings in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: agirling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city centre, just next to Westfield San Francisco (by far the best shopping in town) and on the other side next to really cool cinema. We found the staff quite not-caring and even recommending other hotels in the area... The feel of the hotel should be quite modern, but it lacked style. The room had a massive TV, which was nice. The bathroom was quite small and the products not really good. I think it was ok, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: salbolt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar San Francisco mainly because I love the Hotel Palomar Washington DC so much. Unfortunately the San Francisco hotel didn't quite live up to my expectations. My room was large but just didn't have the ambience to make it a really exceptional stay. In terms of location it is great, very close to Union Square and the large Westfield Shopping Mall on Market St. The location is also great if you are using public transport to get around. I didn't find anything wrong with the hotel per se, it just didn't do enough to entice me back again. With so many hotel options in SF, I will keep on looking until I find a favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: meblake
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed there for 3 days over the New Years holiday. The hotel is in a fantastic location, right off Market Street and close to Union Square. We booked a great rate through Orbitz and paid $160 per night. Check-in was fast. The room was fairly basic but clean. It's very similar in style to the W Hotel brand. The bathrooms are a bit dated and could stand to be renovated. Our room was on a lower floor, near the elevators, and did not have much of a view. We would've preferred a better room but I'm sure the low rate we paid had an impact on our placement. The complimentary wi-fi in the rooms is a nice touch. There's no real lobby bar (or even much of a lobby) due to its layout. We usally like to have a couple drinks at the hotel we're staying out before we go out to dinner or after a long day of sightseeing. Service at the hotel was great. The staff is younger and very friendly. We checked in on New Year's Eve and the staff suggested walking down to the Embaradero to watch fireworks which was a great idea. We had lunch at the Slanted Door in the Ferry Building and would definitely recommend it. It always has great food and nice atmosphere. There's always a wait there so make reservations if you know you want to eat there. On our last night, the concierge made a reservation for us at North Beach Restaurant and got us a town car service for transportation. Great food and speedy service (maybe even a little too quick if you're looking for a leisurely meal). During the meal, my partner noticed he had misplaced his cell phone, possibly in the car. When we arrived back at the hotel, the doorman asked if we had lost a phone and produced it immediately. Very nice touch! I'd recommend the hotel if you're looking for something that's reasonably priced, in a great location, and has a little bit of style. If I stayed there again, I'd suggest trying to book a better category room, on a higher floor, and with a view of Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Aother Wonderful Stay at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Palomar and were not disappointed. The staff are all so welcoming and helpful, particularly the front desk staff. I am noise-sensitive and love the courtyard rooms at the Palomar, where you can stay downtown without having your sleep disturbed. HOWEVER, the Palomar now is pet-friendly so do NOT stay on the 9th floor if noise is an issue. .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: gemini68
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a conference at a discounted conference rate. Our room was a quiet, thoughtfully appointed refuge from the crazy and loud streets. The nightly happy hour was an added bonus. The staff was attentive and helpful. I have absolutely no complaints. The work space in our room was comfortable and the big screen TV was a treat. Free wifi was a breeze. The restaurant is pricey, but delicious. The fitness center is very small, but has cardio equipment and free weights. Valet parking is expensive ($42/ day), but comparable to other parking options in the area and includes unlimited in and out. The only problem was that the toilet almost always needed 2 flushes. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMHMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Palomar over the past 2 years. Our second experience matched our first. Nice rooms, spacious, clean and staff courteous. Location is great. Would highly recommend the Kimpton Chain

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, super location”
Reviews.Author: cmgparsons
Reviews.Content: After spending endless hours searching online for a *good* price for a long weekend in San Francisco, I came across a short mention of the Hotel Palomar in Travel & Leisure magazine. This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. We had a lovely room, a bit small, but extremely comfortable with all of the amenities....even l'Occitane products in the bathroom. Nice comfy bed with crisp white down duvet.....very much appreciated after cross-country flight, then lots of walking in fun San Francisco. We faced the courtyard so the room was very quiet. Even the hallways, elevators, & public spaces were spotlessly clean & everything smelled so fresh. (After all, it is in a city!) Only negative was the snooty restaurant, but there are lots of dining options nearby....Mel's Diner for breakfast and Annabelle's for late nite dinner. And if you can't find something to eat in foodie heaven (aka San Francisco) there's something wrong with you! The parking was expensive & we agreed that you really don't need a car there. Definitely would return. And the price was the best part......$195 a night. Most city hotels there are double that!

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: crtwrnr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are fans of Kimpton Hotels in general. Their rooms are always designer looking, and hey, who can beat the free wine hour? We enjoyed a beautiful room here for two nights. You can't beat the location. Just blocks from union square, the trolleys, and tons of shopping. The staff was unbelievably cool and helpful. The only advice I'd have is not to get a room on Market Street. There isn't anything the hotel can do about street musicians down below, and we had a whole band out there one day as we were trying to take a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is one of our favorite hotels in SF, even though, we live 10 minutes outside of the city. We enjoyed a very lovely, modern and spacious room this past New Years. This is a dog friendly hotel, so our 3 year old goldendoolde looks forward to our stay, as well. In my opinion this is nicest boutique hotel in the area. The location is fantastic with just minutes from all the shopping and central sites. If you're visiting San Francisco, then definitely stay here and make sure to dine at the Fifth Floor (one of the top SF restaurants)- it's fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Eyelashtravels
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal via Expedia and had a suite up on the 9th floor. The rooms were lovely and spacious and the bathroom (especially the bath/tub) was really nice. Minutes away from all the shopping and central sites we will definitely stay here again if we find ourselves in San Fran. The staff at the desk were always pleasant and helpful and advised us on tours and helped with the bookings, and the doorman always had a smile and greeted you like an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountain2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Palomar over a long weekend while visiting friends in SF. I had never stayed there before, but knew of the hotel from previously living in SF. I received a great package deal price that included parking. (Booked through Kimpton's website directly.) For the level of hotel, it was the least expensive parking package I could find at comparable hotels in the city. It was a good deal. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and the accommodations very nice. I would recommend this hotel. Be sure to request a high floor, because of street noise. We were on the 8th floor and this was not an issue. The staff at checkout had some issues with our bill and charged an incorrect amount. Be sure to check your bill. However, this was just a mistake by a new staff person. It happens. Given the price and location, I would stay here again and recommend the Palomar. You have easy access to MUNI, BART, and Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPROVING”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms for our party of five adults, and we checked-in on July 26. My partner and I had already been staying here 2 years ago, and had been monitoring the website for some packages, which eventually showed, with more realistic value than the rack rates. Check-in was smooth, for all of us. Rooms : we felt that they had been upgraded, and were somewhat larger than we remembered. Bathrooms are small, like very small. They provide scrace L'Occitane shampoo and soap. Strangely, shower gel is NOT available. As I asked, I learnt that they did not have shower gel. Bar is a joke. The restaurant is turned into a bar, and you sit around tables. Breakfast is not very good and pricey. Concierge is more like students, whereas 2 years ago they turned up with really good suggestions. They have no SF insights. One morning, I asked for the best steakhouse in town. Back in the evening, no news, so I called, and they had obviously forgotten all about my request. After a while, they gave me an adress, where I had absolutely no reservation whatsoever. Harris' on Van Ness dealt with the issue in the most professionnal way. Another request was met with blank stares. Valet parking is still available. They do not bring your car up any more. You must go down to the garage, and wait for the guy to bring your car. Sometime the attendant is there. Sometime he is not, and you must call the font desk to get the attendant. Most inconvenient. It is still very conveniently located, and we like the room. Other than that, well, look for packages !

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ebnyc
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Hotel Palomar, and thought the location was great for the touristy part of SF. Half a block to the BART and Muni, which made travel to other neighborhoods and the airport easy, and short walk to Union Sqaure, Yerba Buena gardens, lots of shopping, etc. Staff at check-in were helpful, and the room was nicely decorated, very clean, and quiet as it was on the top floor overlooking the courtyard. Bathroom was nice, though the sliding door was a little weird (as opposed to a normal door leading to a bathroom), and I LOVED the l'Occitane bath products. As others have mentioned, it's a nice touch to have the wine tasting daily from 5-6, though we also never made it because we were out all day. I really enjoyed the Palomar, and would definitely stay there again if I got a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MeetingProDC
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton properties in general - Stayed here for business. Walking distance to the convention center. Nice updated rooms... flat screen tv. Great service - from the bellmen to the front desk. Had some slow service for breakfast but the waitress was very nice about it.. I actuall fell in the middle of the restaurant and no one came to see if i was ok - but that's ok since it was embarassing. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wear your winter woolies in the dining room”
Reviews.Author: rosco101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but as several reviewers have stated the rooms are very small. The big problem we had here was the michelin star restaurant, located on the 5th floor. The food was lovely but our table was situated near the air conditioning vent and it was absolutely freezing. Three times we asked for the air conditioning to be turned down before the manager eventually came to our table and told us they were aware of the problem but they were unable to do anything about it. I pointed out to him that three people in the table behind us were actually wearing their jackets and he agreed it was not a satisfactory situation. Our tea and coffee was on the house but considering we had paid $500 for the meal I felt this the least that could have been done.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Great value - Some communication issues”
Reviews.Author: QQ2008
Reviews.Content: Great rate on Travelzoo.com - $139.00 for two doubles. Nick-Dal thought room was small, but perhaps has never stayed in a NYC 85 sf shoebox "boutique" hotel for $350 ... our Palomar room was HUGE! Well appointed, comfortable (except for the pillows; I dislike down, and the foam pillows that were brought up were hard as rocks). Staff was very friendly, but it took forever for them to bring our bags to the room. (Three calls to the desk and one personal trip to look for them; apparently there was one bellman on duty and couldn't deal with several people checking in at once ... we were late for an appointment because of that. When he finally did deliver the bags he said there would be a bottle of wine delivered to our room for our trouble, but the wine never materialized.) Towels were not changed daily, which didn't bother me, but it did bother my travel companion (there was no note in the bathroom indicating that towels would not be changed, as I've seen in other hotels). Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, so can't comment on that. Annabelle's Bistro just down the block had one of the best Ceasar Salads that I've ever tasted. Hotel offers a free wine tasting daily from 5-6, which is a lovely idea, but we were out sightseeing all day, and never in our hotel at that hour. Would have been a nice end to the day at 9 pm or so. Overall, good experience at the Palomar. Very clean, comfortable, friendly and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “No closet, no service”
Reviews.Author: WGBLA
Reviews.Content: On busy Market Street, the hotel sits above an Old Navy retail store. The layout is a little odd with the main hotel starting on the 5th floor. The restaurant and bar offer very limited hours, and otherwise are dead space off the elevator. The room was on the small side as expected in San Francisco. But for the price I did not expect no closet (no hooks, no rod, no alcove, nothing ... NO closet). Service was non existant. Our request for towels not only resulted in no towels, but resulted in an unpleasant attitude from the front desk staff. I travel a great deal for work and spend about 200 nights a year in hotels. This was by far the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarolSLondon
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and modern. It is one of the nicest boutique hotels i've stayed in and its perfectly located in the centre of san francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Nick-Dal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nicely decorated but the rooms were very small and didn't have a dresser. We stayed four nights/five days which made having only a closet with a few hangers very impractical. The bathroom door did not close all the way. The bed was very uncomfortable. The staff was pretty friendly, but they didn't have directions to commonly requested places such as Sausalito or Monterey readily available (and the directions they did give us were terrible). Good location in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Had a room overlooking Market St, 8th floor, and it was a little noisy at night, specially ambulances/police in the middle of the night. The rooms are small. Would I stay again in it, maybe. The best thing of this hotel is it's location, the worst, the rooms should be a tad bigger and better window insulation. The service was excellent overall. Have been in SF many times all over the city and this is one of the better hotels we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LardB0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in April 2008 and would very highly recommend. Very central location but rooms facing courtyard are very quiet. Excellent facilities and unobtrusive but very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for 2 nights. It is a lovely hotel! The reception were very friendly. I had a room on the 8th floor which overlooked the courtyard. It was very quiet yet centrally located. The room was big and spacious. A nice place to come back to after a busy day with friends and sightseeing. It was definitely worth the extra few pounds over the other hotels in it's price range. The room came equipped with tons of gadgets! I didn't really get a chance to play with them but there was an iPod player, DVD player, cordless phones etc. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom had a bath/shower. There was a double curtain to keep the water in the bath. The hotel had wifi for people with laptops. I didn't have one so used a computer in the business centre although it is a bit pricey ($5 for 15 minutes) and it took credit cards only. When I checked out the concierge kindly carried my heavy suitcase to the car. There are not automatic doors into the hotel however the friendly concierge are happy to assist. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for four nights in June. As may be expected in downtown San Francisco, the rooms are quite small, but they were very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is also small. Also as expected in downtown SF, the hotel is expensive. If you're already spending that much, I'd suggest the chain hotels like the Marriott and the Westin nearby for larger rooms. The location is great. Right around the corner is the Powell BART station, makes it easy to get around the city and to the outskirts. About a 1/2 mile walk to Chinatown and a mile to the Embarcadero. Definitely walk-able if the weather's nice, although that's asking a lot of San Fran. Very nice shopping and restaurants nearby. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and helpful. The hotel offers free coffee/tea in the morning and wine in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: This hotels location is great and within walking distance to everything. You are right next to Union Square, China Town, and about a 15 min walk to the Embarcadero. The hotel rooms are small but nice. So if you are looking for lots of space, look else where. The room has a desk, bed, flat screen t.v. and an updated bathroom. I did not use the restaurant, or fitness center so I can not comment on those. There was free wireless internet, which was a great perk. I slept well and did not hear any street noise. I would stay here again if I was in the area. Of of course I was here for business and received a rate of $199/night, which was less than half of what they normally charge. But I think $400 is the going rate for 4 stars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: generx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier in the year for a week. Great location, had a 7th? floor room overlooking the Mac store. Although street noise was a concern, it was quiet at night (wife thought it was noisier than normal but I did not) Tiny lobby, however there were common areas as well as a fairly large dining room/restaurant on the upper floors. The actual hotel room was average US-sized, about the same as most Kimptons. Modern decor, decent linens, free high-speed internet connection, TV, DVD/MP3 player, minibar, COMFY BED!, room and bathroom was spotlessly clean. Fresh fruit and a 375ml bottle of wine in the room on arrival (for returning guests) The on-site restaurant was actually pretty decent, especially when compared to all the dining options around (in all fairness, ate mostly breakfast there every day) The manager even sent up some mini cakes and another half-bottle of wine when they found out it was my wife's b-day over the weekend (nice touch) They also have an afternoon "wine-hour" similar to other Kimptons. Just about all the sights are walkable from this hotel, the Moscone, Union Square, Chinatown, even North Beach if you're up to it. The BART station is < a block away and there are plenty of cabs in the area due to the high concentration of hotels (it's also almost directly across the street from the huge Marriott)

Reviews.Title: “Super Spot”
Reviews.Author: Raf1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights on business. The location was absolutely superb. I took the BART in from the airport and it was barely 5 mins walk which is easy these days with with suitcase you can pull behind you. I also took the BART back when i left. Its so easy and just $5. The room was furnished in traditional old style but was warm and welcoming. There was plenty of space and a good desk which was important for me. The internet access was excellent and free. The bathroom was a little dated but it worked fine and the L'occitane products never fail to help. They didn't have tea making facilities and it took 3 goes to get a kettle up to the room. I guess my Spanish is useless. Other than that the room was great. No noise to speak of even though its in a busy location. The breakfast was in a meeting room as they were refurbishing the main hotel restaurant and bar which was a shame. it was average but they had fresh fruit which is always great. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel had a general impression of being tailored for business/tourists. The location was great for getting around. The Apple store was just across the road and Union Square a stones throw. I didn't have any room service but there is a great little french bistro 5 doors down on the right which i recommend highly. i ate there twice on my own and really enjoyed the food. also another block down on the right is a good cafe serving breakfast and nice juices for a quick start. I'd stay there again as was good value, good location and overall a tidy place.

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: hardtopleasetexan
Reviews.Content: We are frequent guests of Kimptom hotels. We were a little disappointed in this one. I guess we are spoiled because this was the first one which did not upgrade our room. Perhaps there was no availability. The room was fine but we had requested a quiet room on a higher floor. We got a room next to the ice machine on a lower floor. Unfortunately, we did not notice the ice maker until we were unpacked and too tired to move. That was a big mistake because there was a party down the hall at 10 p.m. and there were many visits to the ice machine! Since we belong to their club, we were greatly disappointed and will not stay at this Kimpton again. I have to give Lauren at the front desk kudos, though. She went out of her way to make last-minute dinner reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LMC_Canada
Reviews.Content: A great location right down town. This is a small hotel with excellent service. The rooms while small are nice and very clean. A good choice for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: laleeleela
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Palomar! Four girlfriends and I stayed there last weekend and it was a great experience from beginning to end - nice atmosphere, convenient location, and friendly and helpful employees, especially Kevin the bellhop, Lauren at the front desk, and the concierge (sorry I forgot his name, but he was the one working on May 30-31) We had dinner at Lark Creek Steak (which I also highly recommend) and watched a movie at the Century Theaters which are both inside the San Francisco Centre just around the corner, but the hotel is also a good base for visiting many other sights in the city and has easy access to public transportation like Muni and BART. I definitely plan to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPHO
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a special rate I found at Travelzoo. It was $139/night. It was a great hotel. The room was small but it had all the comforts, great bed, LCD TV, L'Occitane products. I have stayed at the Kimpton in Cambridge MA and had a great stay there as well. Kimptons are great and you can usually find good deals. Have a drink at the Marriott View Lounge across the street from the Hotel Palomar for a great view of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding-Loved Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: uniquesoul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar from May 21-May 25, 2008. Everything was wonderful. Hotel staff goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable. Our room was an executive king on the 9th floor; which was a comfortable size. The property was always quiet, thus making it ideal for uninterupted slumber. Every evening we returned to find our bed turned down and soft jazz playing on the radio. This made for a great prelude to winding down from a busy day sightseeing. As a previous guest stated...the hotel left nothing to be desired. Would most definately stay at the Palomar again. Kimpton Hotels are just FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: angelacatz
Reviews.Content: The good: 1) In a great neighborhood (near plenty of restaurants and shops) with amazing public transportation options nearby to get you quickly to the piers and parks. We rented a car-- didn't need it. 2) Very clean rooms. Very friendly staff. 3) Environmentally conscious hotel. 4) Complimentary wine/ beer hour in the lobby around 5pm. 5) Spring for the suite with the big jacuzzi bathtub. So worth it-- if you like that kind of thing. The bad: 1) Our robes were missing from the room when we got there. They were brought to us promptly after a phone call. 2) The plug for our giant 4 foot deep bathtub was also missing. We were ready to draw a nice bath after a long day--- and then had to wait around 15 minutes for a plug to be brought up for us. 3) We were missing a room service menu. 4) We once waited over 15 minutes for the valet to appear so we could get our car from the garage. He actually saw us going to the garage, and proceeded to get on an elevator and disappear. No apology upon return. 5) The overnight parking fee is $42-- not including tax. Yes, that's $42 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: whirlwind79
Reviews.Content: We had two separate stays at the Palomar at the start and end of our holiday, and both were great. The standard rooms are adequatetly sized and there is nothing missing. The location is excellent, the staff are helpful and we couldn't have asked for anymore. It was the most reasonably priced 5* hotel at the time and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: mollyhp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the basic, King delux. We paid $233 per night excluding taxes and parking, which ultimately put us at $300 per night. The rooms were fine, except for the tiny bathrooms that had you brushing up against the toilet to enter the tub. The biggest complaints I have are that continental breakfast isn't included and the lobby is so small that their wine tasting from 5-6 lacks any type of atmosphere to make it worth the while. If you could get a much cheaper room than what we paid, it's probably worth it. But at this price, skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: tkelly7
Reviews.Content: I had to come to San Francisco for a conference at the Marriott downtown. Because I prefer to stay in smaller hotels, I booked the Palomar which is right across the street from the Marriott. I couldn't have been happier with the experience. The staff was welcoming and very helpful, the room was spacious and comfortable. My first night they sent a plate of fresh fruit to my room. And the price was only $10 more than what I would have paid at the Marriott. The hotel is just two blocks from the SF MOMA and at a public transportation nexus (BART, tram, cable cars). My only complaint is that eating in the hotel is quite expensive ($6 Rice Crispies). So I ate out the entire time. For cheap eats to go, I recommend the Alexandria Cafe or the Coffee Bean around the corner one way on Market. Or the Westfield Mall food court around the corner on Market the other way. It sounds cheesy to eat in a mall food court, but this is a very upscale mall and the food was excellent and a full meal could be had for around $10. The King of Thai Noodles on the opposite side of the block from the hotel is also excellent and reasonably priced. I will stay here every time I come to San Francisco from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury, great location”
Reviews.Author: jennevans
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few Kimpton Group hotels in San Francisco, but this is our favorite. It is very clean with sleek, modern furnishings. Easy walking distance to Union Square, Westfield Mall, cable car and restaurants. Quiet, too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: kazman5
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel!!. It was located in the heart of everything. You were a block and half away from the cable car pick up; you were on the corner of all the shops including Walgreen’s. The visitors’ center was about two blocks away, and I know I was worried about parking but there was a parking structure around the block which was safe and secure and it costs $30 for 24 hours, which was a great deal compared to everywhere else. Now the hotel..... Amazing, beautiful, and very comfortable. We had a free upgrade to an executive suite which was great. The staff was super friendly. You order towels; housekeeping would be there in 3 minutes. You also have a dvd\cd player in the room which was very convenient if you want to lie back in your room and watch your favorite movie. I am a very clean guy and I got to tell you this room was super clean. The bed was very comfortable and soft. Overall this was an excellent hotel. A++++

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay alot in San Francisco. The Palomar is by far a better hotel than I would have thought. I thought, oh a knock off of the W. This hotel exceeds the W. The service was impecable. Anything we needed, we called for and it was in our room within minutes. The location is fantastic! Right there by Union Square and what amazed me was the while you are right there, you can not hear the noise from below. It is worth the money to stay at this property!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Topert
Reviews.Content: unfortunately chosen a wrong rainy season to visit, the the hotel staff and the location are some of the things to make my trip wonderful. having said that, on the other side is that we have enjoyed sf with less tourist, it's like the whole city is yours. me and my partner absolutely loved the decor of the hotel, it's simple, modern, and mostly, very clean; we were upgraded right away to the exec. floor; that is true, sf is such a small city, and it does not matter where you stay; the hotel is in the heart of downtown, union sq. is also all surrounded by christmas display, the hotel is actually facing a quieter street, so it is in the center of the city, yet it is actually very quiet. do not hesitate to ask the wonderful hotel staff regarding any questions, and luckily they are all also with great taste to tell you where is the hottest spot in town. few suggestions: def do the alcatraz "night" tour, we were all surprised with the spooky atmosphere at night, they also provide partially free guided tour; strongly recommended reservation for all the great restaurant, i mean book them before the trip; the hayes street, the best place to eat, shop, and ppl watching, ignore union street, dated shops but great place to find food; the wonderful food court in westfield mall, yes, a food court, and it is a 5 star hotel like food court where you can find all types of food. again, sf is a small city, do not plan to do one section (i.e. ashbury, soma) in one day, you can easily finish few of them all together, so def plan an escape or two during the trip, either wine tasting or muir woods, they are actually fun!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an overhaul, but still a pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: imperator12
Reviews.Content: The Palomar brand is now popping up all across the country; my first experience was with the exceedingly glamorous Palomar in Washington, DC. Last year I booked a room at the Palomar in San Francisco and have since made it my preferred hotel in that city. The SF Palomar is NOT glamorous. It may have been when it first opened but it is now definitely showing its age. The decor is firmly rooted in a mid-1990's aesthetic. Nonetheless, it is well maintained and I still find the lobby (except for the battered sofa) and elevator vestibules to be quite attractive. The rooms could use an update. They are very comfortable but definitely bland. The cream-colored walls really wash-out the rooms and no amount of brightly colored accessories can alleviate the drabness. And that's pretty much the only negative I have for the place. The rooms may be dull in decor--and a bit too snug at times--but the comfort factor is high. The beds and linen encourages one to sleep-in on rainy San Francisco mornings. The bathrooms are non-descript, but they work and I've always had plenty of hot water when I needed it. Housekeeping is gracious (Marina leaves me cute notes) and very efficient. The picture windows in the rooms facing Market Street are well insulated against the noise generated by the pandemonium below. However, those who are particularly sensitive to outside noise may prefer one of the inside rooms; they have an almost tomb-like quality. The location is great. The Pal is right on the corner of Market and 4th, just a very short walk away from the epicenter of the best shopping on the west coast. If you're lucky, you'll get one of the precious few outside rooms. The windows are huge and it's fun watching all the scurrying below; society ladies with Armani bags, protesters, backpackers, Buddhist monks, guys in drag, street performers, investment bankers, and seemingly every other example of humanity all collide together right outside the hotel. Another big plus is that the Powell Street MUNI/BART station is right around the corner from the Palomar's entrance. The Pal is great for museum junkies (like me); the spectacular DeYoung is a MUNI ride away and the Museum of Modern Art is just a ten minute walk from the Pal's doors. The Palomar has an interesting advantage in that it's located next door to the Westfield Mall. During my first few visits to the hotel, the staff would direct me to the Westfield's food court when I asked where I could get a quick bite to eat. I initially scoffed at the idea of getting a meal at a food court but this is no ordinary food court. The Korean BBQ joint is quick, cheap, and so very delicious. Corriander, right next to it, has wonderful Thai food at bargain prices. I truly enjoy grabbing a meal at the Westfield food court and bringing it back to my room to watch a movie (the rooms at the Palomar are equipped with DVD players.) One time I asked one of the front desk people (I shall not name the person) about room service; the person just shook his head and mouthed the words "You don't want to do that." That pretty well sums up the quality of the Palomar's room service. The Pal has a very formal restaurant called the Fifth Floor. It's very good but for a truly awesome meal in an achingly romantic setting ask Stephen, the concierge, to get you reservations at Chez Spencer. Which brings me to the Palomar's most shining asset: the staff. These people are no corporate drones; they are charming, wacky, funny, and vibrant. They are also very competant at what they do. I'm away from home quite a bit and almost always travel by myself; it is such a luxury to walk into a hotel and be welcomed back as an old friend. Overall, if you want up-to-date style go to the W. If you need pampered luxury--and are willing to pay dearly for it--go to the Mandarin Oriental. The Palomar is for those who place comfort above trendy luxury and who appreciate a warm, welcoming staff. And the Pal's location just cannot be beat if you're in SF for shopping, clubbing and/or museum hopping.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty place in center of downtown”
Reviews.Author: WeeKee
Reviews.Content: The small lobby with its very warm and friendly staff gives the place a small boutique feel, for what is actually a large 198 room hotel. The zen subdued look of the premise is charming. The pretty room was well equipped with all the usual frills like a fridge and bar, then a little bit more like a DVD player and complimentary wireless internet. A sign that the hotel is designed for tourists rather than for businesspeople, the hotel has few extra facilities besides a small restaurant (or 2) and a tiny gym. This might as well, since the hotel is right on Market Street and a short stroll from Union Square with lots of activities in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “nice but generally underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDrummer
Reviews.Content: A great location. A relatively nice place, and hip... in a kinda tired mid-90s way. There were a few too many problems (clogged drain, broken room phone) that went unfixed despite my polite requsts to fix them. The desk people didn't seem to care about the problems despite my requests to fix them. Parking is really expensive, but it's the norm in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the palomar end of october. I was in San Francisco for a conference at the Moscone convention center. While the hotel is very clean, the bedding sheets very soft, the hotel certainly does not deserve the 300 $ I was paying for per night. The rooms were small, breakfast available for almost 20$. I stayed for one night a the donatello hotel in union square for 1/2 the price and breakfast was included. Rooms larger, service was excellent. So unless you obtain a cheaper rate and you have a conference at the Moscone convention center, there are definitely better choices. On the plus side, the staff was very helpful and professional. One of the ladies working at the desk ( Flavia) even contacted me on my cell phone to confirm a restaurant reservation! As for restaurants, huge choice . Nevertheless do not go to Zuni Cafe! Minimal choice of food ( 3 appetizers, 3 entrees), located in a bad area of town. I do not know what all the fuss was about. Try 1930 shangai for chinese food. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay in the Smoking Rooms at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr_herbalist
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my second room of the night, after the putrid stench of nestled in tobacco kept me up and coughing for most of the early morning hours. It is 6 AM, I am unable to sleep for my big presentations tomorrow and have generally had to worst experience as a business traveler in a hotel in years (this is for someone who spends 12 weeks a year away from home on travel) Let's see where to start with my list of issues: 1) sealed shut smoking rooms, with no fresh air, making you feel like a lab rat in a Anti-smoking campaign commercial. 2) When I asked for an ionizer (After a suggestion by a hotel employee upon my second statement of dissatisfaction with the smoke in the room) or something to freshen the air, I was promised one. When I returned from dinner, what i found was someone had haphazardly sprayed the room with air freshner trying to mask the smell, instead creating a second layer of irritants. 3) when at 5 AM i stumbled down with blood shot eyes and obvious agitation at the rotten state of affairs at the palomar and begged the front desk for a second room so that i could just get at least 2-3 hours of sleep before a full day of meetings, I was granted this request (upon my 3rd attempt) finally but told that I had to pack my bags in the middle of the night and move rooms immediately. Let me tell you nothing like packing your bags at the crack of dawn with half sleepy head to make you really appreciate coming back to a place. Needless to say, i just booked my reservations for a second hotel for my second night and will check out of here first thing in the morning. The non-smoking room is not half-bad and perhaps what salvages the one star for this review....but if you even dare to think of yourself as a smoker, stay far far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christiaan16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 8 days. I selected this hotel because of the good reviews. I was especially looking for a quiet hotel, as I'm not a good sleeper, and I was not disappointed. I got a room on the 8th floor, at the 4th Street side; I didn't hear any noise! And the bed was very comfortable. The room was quite spacious, and very clean. The staff at the front desk were very friendly. The location is very good, close to the shopping area, Moscone Center and BART Powell station. My only complaint is about the lobby, which is small and cold. I didn't have dinner at the restaurant. The breakfast was okay, but I prefer a self-service breakfast. C.K. Jansen, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgiabd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited San Fran for the first time. We spent two nights at the Palomar. It's a nice, small boutique hotel. The staff was very welcoming upon check-in. Our room was modern and clean. It had a very small shower and a large soaking tub. Nice honor bar and bath products. For us, the location was just so-so. It's VERY near shopping but we would probably stay in Nob Hill next time. The restaurant, Fifth Floor, is very nice and chic. We had breakfast there both days. Great lox and bagels. It's supposed to be great for dinner. My one major complaint about the Palomar is that there wasn't a dedicated concierge on duty. The front desk staff were friendly but weren't able to recommend good restaurants and make compairsons among them for us. Also, there seems to be a taxi shortage in the area so we had problems getting one for dinner. The Palomar lacks the large hotel atmosphere of a lobby bar, music, etc. but we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service and location”
Reviews.Author: maverickmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid week and the service was very good. When I checked in there was no wait and they had free iced tea in the lobby. The hotel is right around the corner from the Westfield/Nordstrom mall and they have a great food court there. We stopped by the bar at the hotel restaurant which is called the Fifth Floor. They were pretty busy and we did not get served quickly. Once we were served the staff was very apologetic and even sent a bottle of wine to our room! The room is very nice and clean and they have these amazing giant tubs. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: martin66
Reviews.Content: Hotel comfortable enough though with smallish rooms and tiny bathroom next to bed. My wife and I are city walkers and as a result the Hotel Palomar was a poor choice for us. What to say about Market St and its environs? The local leadership has tried repeatedly to "upgrade" this dismal area of this beautiful city but the results leave much to be desired. While the hotel's doorman says the area is much improved, we read today that someone was murdered on the streets outside a nightclub a block away just hours after we returned from dinner. Unless you must be near Moscone Center or plan to enter and exit exclusively by car, I would advise staying away from any SF hotel near Market unless you were within a block or two of the Embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PlanesTrainsAutos4
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't classify this hotel as luxury but it's definitely an excellent choice. The location is fantastic, right near the corner of Fourth and Market so if shopping is your main reason for going to SF, you are going to be right in the thick of it. As a boutique hotel, the lobby is small which is fine with me... if you want to drop of f packages or make a stop up to your room you don't have to meander through a huge lobby, wait for an elevator, etc. The room was small with an interior view (overlooked the escalators in the Old Navy store below) but comfy and the space in the room was utilized very well, loved the bedding and the L'Occitane toiletries. No problems with the shower either... this is a big deal for me... enough hot water and good water pressure. The staff is friendly and professional. There were cold drinks in the lobby throughout the day and they serve coffee there in the a.m. - no coffee maker in the room unless you request one. If you have a car, there is parking under the hotel (really expensive) or you can park around the corner in the Fifth & Mission garage for a bit less (I think it was about $28 a day?). There is a movie theater right across the street (The Metreon) and a Marriott is also across the street. We went up to the 39th floor there at night for a drink and a fabulous view. Great breakfast at Mel's Diner (yes, the one from American Graffiti) around the corner on Mission St. The Palomar has a lounge as well and a restaurant, but unfortunately we didn't get a chance to check either one out. The restaurant had excellent reviews. Our rate at this hotel was about $180 a night which I thought was reasonable. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Surperb for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller100
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day business trip to SF. We needed to be close to downtown businesses off Market Street with Govt Rates. Few hotels had availability even several months ago when we booked. It is the height of the tourist season afterall. We chose the Hotel Palomar based on other TripAdvisor reviews. Good choice. We had two rooms--atrium room was very light and quiet. Street rooms are noisy on lower floors; fine above five or six. Atrium room and bath was exceptionally large; other was small and tight with two beds. Handicapped bathroom was without a walk or roll in shower. However, the excess of grab bars made it useable. The staff ARE very attentive. We especially enjoyed and visited with the Head Bell Man, the doormen and the security men on in the evenings. Because we were there a full week they got to know us, and our comings and goings. They made the best suggestions. Concierge service was adequate, but not very experienced or with first hand knowledge. Often they relied on reports or questions from prior guests all stored in the hotel computer. They did suggest a 12 person van tour of the wine country for us that I also recommend--Pacific Tours. Although the hotel was short-staffed in housekeeping, what ever we asked for at the front desk was promptly received or corrected--too few bath towels for two, more soap, change the hypoallergic pillows, etc. Yes the low flush toilets are noisy...they all are. Yes the lobby is minimal--but there is a lovely quiet sitting area on the fifth floor which we used nightly for business meetings. We could even have a drink or order soup or lite fare during our meetings. My mom sat out there with a friend one day while the room was being made up. Yes, the restaurant is pricey. But it is totally in line with any other top flight restaurant in SF. It is rated THE BEST French restaurant in the city. Nearby is Annabelle's which is reasonable and the food is very good. Note Annabelle's has a restaurant and a bar menu that are totally different. Also nearby in the Westfield Mall is a food court with all types of ethnic and uncommon fare at low or more typical SF prices. In the mornings we used the hotel car service to go to our work location. Ideal with our brief cases and computers, we went door to door at low cost and maximum convenience. That should be arranged with the door man in advance. The service is first come first serve on weekdays. Our rooms were exceptionally clean, comfortable, and the location cannot be beat. It is about two blocks from Moscone Center too. I recommend the Palomar to every moderate priced business traveller. They had free wi-fi too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RedMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar after a few days in Healdsburg. Even though the hotel is not in the "quaintest" or "funkiest" area of town, I must say that we were very happy with the location. The building is connected to a shopping mall with a fabulous food court for a quick bite. There is a movie theater across the street & all public transportation, etc is either outside your door or a few steps away.
