We still were able to access all areas of SF easily & meet up with friends for dinners, etc in a few minutes. Check-in was a breeze. All the staff were exceptionally friendly. Our room was modern & clean. Very quiet. (8th Floor) The bathroom was quite small, but sufficient for the 2 days. The housekeeping service was great. We didn't use the gym, business center or dine at the restaurant. We did, however,have great meals at Zuni Cafe & The Slanted Door. All in all, we were very please with our stay at the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar was so comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: suzygd2
Reviews.Content: I recently met my daughters, ages 20 & 22, in San Francisco for a few days of fun. I picked the Palomar based on TA reviews, and I was very pleased. Our room had 2 full size beds, and was very spacious. The clean, modern design was relaxing. The bathroom was small, but perfectly adequate. We were on the 5th floor and the sitting area near the restaurant was convenient, and felt like our personal lobby. The location was perfect. Near cable cars, trolleys, buses & BART. We were 100 ft from amazing shopping. Yet, our room was perfectly quiet. One small disappointment was the failure to receive the expected newspaper at my door each moring. I always was up early and picked one up at the elevator. The coffee in the lobby was lukewarm, and when it was empty, they would not make another pot. I would recommend requesting a coffee maker for your room & bypass this problem. Last, the concierge never answered his/her phone our entire trip. We just left messages that were never returned. The comfort of the room trumps all else, and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near the Moscone Center”
Reviews.Author: ewe35
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palomar when I went to the SF Gift Show at the Moscone Center. The location is great! The hotel itself was quite good. The rate was a special show rate of $185 per night and it was worth it. There was a problem worth noting, however. We checked in late and the desk staff is very casual, a tad unprofessional, I would say. We had a requested a king bed and that was not available , So they said, we can give you a king bed in a suite but it will cost $150 more per night. I was pretty tired so I said okay for tonight. The suite was a real suite, but really nothing special, certainly not worth $150 more. Anyway, the next day we switched to a standard room with a king bed, which was then avaialble. The whole thing was annoying. We had requested the king bed and even confirmed it a few days before. I am happy to report that when I checked out, the woman at the front desk, immediately deleted the $150 charge as soon as I explained the story. She was a pleasure to deal with and it left me with a really good feeling about the Palomar. Other than that, the room was very nice. The hotel is very clean and the lobby restaurant breakfast is quite good-not cheap, but these sort of places rarely are. But the restaurant is very comfortable and the service is good.The fitness center is merely a treadmill and a stepper or two, so don't expect much. All in all, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great-If At the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar, a member of the Klimpton Hotel Group, was reputed to be a "luxurious" representative of this prolific chain. Although the Palomar was very pleasant, I would not call it a luxury hotel. The lobby is quite tiny and guests take one of two small elevators up to their rooms. There are a few chairs in the lobby, and a coffee urn is left out all day for guests use. The rooms were a nice size with pleasant furnishings that were quite understated and calm for a Klimpton hotel. The bathroom was comfortable, but just like the room, nothing I would call luxurious. The staff were quite nice and tried to be helpful, but the Concierge did cop a bit of an attitude when asked about restaurants and bars even though I gave him a twenty dollar tip. I never did ask him to make a reservation for me. The restaurant is one of the most expensive in San Francisco and was rather stiff for this progressive city. The lofty ambiance of the restaurant did not match the pedestrian design of the hotel rooms. The location is excellent if you want to be near SOMA and Union Square. However, if you know San Francisco, the hotel's location on Market Street means that you will encounter the street people that are an integral part of the fabric of this city. (The entrance of the hotel is on Fourth Street) The health club can hardly be called that since it consists of a few pieces of equipment that are right on top of each other. I think my perspiration was spraying everyone in the room! The Hotel Palomar is a very nice hotel, but it is lacking certain elements that would bring it into the luxury reign of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, yet again.”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in the last year that I have stayed in this property for 4-5 nights. Again, they exceeded my expectations! The location is excellent - close to union square, transportation, etc. The decor is beautiful - the room had new carpet, chairs and blankets since I was there in the spring. They looked very nice. My room, a deluxe king, was a nice size for SF. Huge windows overlooked Market Street. The internet worked great (and was free). The table in the room was great to meet with a coworker (and someone not have to sit on a bed). The only negative is there is not breakfast available except at the marginal, overpriced restaurant on the fifth floor. There are plenty of places within a few blocks though. The staff are amazing - always friendly, helpful, accomodating, etc. I already have booked my next trip in a few months at the Palomar - what a great property!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent six nights at the Hotel Palomar. There was an initial problem with the reservation but it was handled promptly, professionally and much to our satisfaction. As with most Kimpton hotels the room was impeccibly clean and nicely appointed. Daily the room was cleaned perfectly, was done very promptly and caused no inconvenience to us. The nightly turn down service is nice. Although our room looked out over Market Street, we heard no noise, nor did we hear other guests inside. The beds were great and the linens are fantastic. Newspapers that were requested were delivered early each morning. As pointed out in previous reviews the lobby is very, very small (about three adults can sit in it). The staff at the desk was very professional, but we did not have any dealings with them except for check-in and check-out. This hotel is a great peaceful escape after running around San Francisco all day. The location is great and the lobby exits on Fourth Street right at a very busy bus stop. We were able to walk to Union Square several times, the Curran Theatre and Yerba Buena Gardens. The BART Powell St station is less than a half a block away. The Westfield Shopping Center is right next door. I am not a shopping-type person but that is a must-see. What a gorgeous mall!! The only negatives we felt were the size of the fitness room (very small with one treadmill and limited weights). I know you can go to another fitness facilty down the street but it is much more convenient when you can use the hotel's fitness center. We missed the nightly wine gatherings that we have enjoyed at other Kimpton hotels. It is so nice to relax with other guests, but the Hotel Palomar does not offer that amenity. The restaurant dinner menu was very different -- not what most people would eat. It is obvious they know this since the dining room is very small and never crowded. We had breakfast there a couple of times and it was very good. We would definitely recommend this hotel for the high quality and great location that it has. Kimpton does a very nice job taking care of their guests in a subtle way.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar Best Part of our California Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BCOS_7
Reviews.Content: We selected this property for a 4-day visit to San Francisco because of the reviews at this website. Several local people suggested that www.tripadvisor.com was the most relevent place to read valid reviews from people used to traveling to this city. The hotel was even better than any review that I saw...my first interaction was with the hotel's front desk staff when I needed a local pharmacy prior to arrival for an unexpected medical problem with one of my teenage children. They were exceptionally helpful and also confirmed that we would have adjoining rooms when we arrived that evening. The valet parking was convenient, the concierge staff always gave us good advice, and even the valet staff was great with getting us around on public transportation. Rooms were unexpectedly upscale, stylish, and comfortable. Maid service mirrored what we found in the rest of the staff. The parent company must do a great job emphazing customer service because it was outstanding everywhere. There was a good French Bistro next door (Annabelle's) that we used twice after long days around the city, and closer to Union Square were many other excellent places for casual and more upscale dining. I travel to NYC 3 weeks a month for work and wish that there was anything like this property there!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: J-Lvs-2Travel
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is full of wonderful places to stay. Still, I was so glad I booked here. I picked it for it's proximity to the BART and buses, downtown, shopping, restaurants, museums, it's decor, and it's eco-friendliness. I was dropping off a child at college for the summer and after having stayed at another hotel I also like back in January, The Rex, I thought it would be wise to be closer to the shopping and the school's main buildings. I didn't realize the orientation was not very close to us though, and her dorm was actually closer to The Rex; so oops! But it was no big deal. We grabbed a cab from the hotel to her dorm when it was time for her to move in there. Btw: I never rent a car in SF. Have never needed one there as parking is a nightmare and very expensive. As it turned out, and unbeknowest to me, we were there the same weekend of the Gay Pride Parade. What a hoot! The Parade went right past our hotel and we had a pretty good view of it. However, this wasn't why were in town, so I never did actually go out to see it much. However, my kids did and they loved it! I loved this hotel for it's eco-friendliness, cleanliness, spacious, comfortable, well appointed rooms. The staff was wonderful. Can't say much else though. Never ate in the restaurant as we were doing all the college orientation events and a bit of shopping for the dorm room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: CB90292
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Palomar on numerous occasions and they have always met or exceeded my expectations. The location is great, around the corner from Market Street, with excellent public transportation, both street car and BART right outside the door. Front desk staff are pleasant, check in is friendly and efficient. One time I mentioned I was in town to celebrate my birthday, and about 30 minutes later a bottle of wine and some goodies from the hotel's 4 star restaurant we offered gratis. Love the room, nice amenities, high thread count sheets and free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Place”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We just got back from SF and stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 3 nights (F/S/S). The location of the hotel is very good, near Union Stn and adjacent to Moscone Centre. We checked in late (around midnight) and found the front desk staff to be rather "informal" and questioned our reservation requirements. Although I had requested an Exec Room we were not provided one, and were given a standard room with feather pillows when my profile says synthetic due to allergies. In the morning asked for a different room. We were provided an Exec Room and the pillows were replaced to meet our request. At 315 sq ft, the Exec Room is small for 2 people, and pretty basis. Décor is straight out of Ikea. The hotel itself has no real amenities and the lobby is very small - so small that when we checked out, people crowded into the street out front – which by the way has street people and a bus stop. There is no bar, coffee area etc. on the main floor lobby level. We would stay again here, but only if the rate was very good as it does not warrant 4 star pricing. We rate this place as 3.5 stars - due to lack of amenities in the hotel itself, inadequate lobby, and lack of attention to details of reservation made. One final note: we stored out luggage for a while on checkout and it took 30 minutes to have it retrieved – so watch your time.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and easy travel”
Reviews.Author: kdhicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends just prior to the 4th and All-Star Game week. This is a wonderful and cute boutique hotel. Easy to get to from Airport on BART (Powell St.) station..Hotel is located next to the Old Navy store...its all connected to Westfield Mall. Walking / transit is at the door. Will stay at this hotel again. Great rates on non-busy event days. Very comfortable. Loved IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrity treatment at Palomar”
Reviews.Author: willdancefortravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palomar (4th and Market) July 4-8, 2007. We loved it! It is in a perfect location to catch public transit (Bart and Muni) - no need to pay high valet prices for a rental car. Easy to "Bart" in from the airport as the station is across the street from hotel. All staff were above and beyond - friendly, out going, accomadating and genuinely nice! This is the first time in ages we have stayed at a Hotel where there is nothing untrivial to complain about. The rooms are clean and modern - not too big or overly fancy but perfect for a comfortable place to stay and relax after a long day of sightseeing. Ask for a "queit" room and they will put you against the hotel's inner courtyard - no view but we heard nothing at all! We recommend Mel's diner (only a block away) for breakfast or a late night snack. Frisson in the (244 Jefferson) FInanical district is the best meal we had in the city. Impeccable service and fab food. Concierge at Palomar will make all your reservations. Limon in the Mission district is also a must - very crowded but food (Peruvian) is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 2-day offsite session for work. The hotel is part of the Kimpton chain, and it upholds the Kimpton reputation of a small, boutique, chic hotel. The room was spacious; the decor was modern and chic. I was extremely impressed with the housekeeping/maid service--they actually CLEANED the room instead of just making the bed. The location is terrific--steps from Market Street, Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf, and the best shopping in SF. Bell staff is friendly and helpful. Oh, they let pets stay at the hotel. If you aren't bothered by the sight of seeing a dog walking down the hallways or in the elevator, then you should be okay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton's average boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmadr
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton hotel fan and I took advantage that this hotel was only 2 blocks away from the conference I was attending at the Moscone West centre. Unfortunately, there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. This hotel is a great location for shopping enthusiasts. I would say that the Macy's in Union square is probably the second largest next to New York's Herald Square. The 315 sq ft King/Double Deluxe room is too small for two people. The decor and comfort is slighty above average but really nothing special about this hotel. The valet parking at most of the hotels in this area are the same ($42 per day with in/out privileges).

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatoin - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: audaciousred
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Palomar when in San Francisco for work. The rooms are large and the decor is nice. It's in a great location and the staff is always very helpful and friendly. I would stay there for leisure as well - great location for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ToddA
Reviews.Content: This is at least my third time staying at the Palomar and I enjoy it every time. The location is excellent for the conferences I attend at the nearby Moscone Center, as well as for shopping Union Square or catching the BART or the cable car out of the Powell Street terminus. The staff are invariably friendly and helpful. This includes the reception, cleaning, maintenance, and the doormen. The hotel is clean, well-run, stylish, and very comfortable. If you can get a discount rate, it's also quite a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rjslatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights over Memorial day weekend. The first night we were on the 5th floor and there was quite a bit of noise below us. We never identified what was below us, but it wasn't a guest room. Maybe part of the kitchen? The front desk took care of the problem the next morning. The rooms were spacious and clean. We didn't think the bathrooms were up to 4* standards. Both rooms had a basic tub with a shower curtain. The hotel was in a great spot for shopping, SF Moma and other attractions. The concierge was very helpful and the staff were always very friendly. We enjoyed our stay and would return. If you're not just there for the shopping I would stay over by Pacific Heights. There are quite a few good restaurants and funky shops over there.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific, stylish shopper's hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerMPLS
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I visited San Francisco and I walked by an extra nice hotel and noted the Palomar name. Last month I finally got around to staying there. From SF International Airport to the center of town you can take a cab, a shuttle, a bus or BART. I chose the Bay Area Rapid Transit System (BART) as my method of reaching central San Franciso because all I had to drag on wheels was my carry-on bag. The fare was $5.10 or $5.20. It takes half an hour. As you go up the esculator from the Powell Street station you can see the sign for the Palomar. Can't beat that. Half a block walk and you are there. Map it online ahead of time. I was early for my reservation but the staff got me directed to my room. It faced away from the street and over a glass atrium. It was also a bit cramped. I could be in any hotel in the country with this view. I went back to the lobby and asked for a better room. For $20.00 a night more I got a slightly larger room that overlooked Market Street, a main San Franciso street. Granted I did hear some street musicians through the window in the evening but stuff like this stops at around 10 PM. I had three quiet nights of sleep. I can't say enough nice things about the staff. Want an opinion about a restaurant? You can get several. It happens that the historic, reasonably priced John's Grill is only a couple of blocks away. As for the room again. It was clean. No walk-in shower but a nice bath. Nice, light cover for the bed so you can see how clean it is. Kind of weird to have two desk chairs. Great if you are going to have a couple of visitors to your room. Reading lights for bed reading could be better (as with most hotels). Mattress was comfortable as were the pillows. NY Times delivered to the door. At check out I was told I could have gotten a SF paper if I had told them. I have to admit that the room didn't have any cutting edge design features like I have seen in Park Hyatts or Westins but it had a nice contemporay look and I felt it was a notch higher than the standard HIlton, domestic Radisson or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobPrice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night at the Palomar after seeing Jersey Boys. We have stayed here several times and have enjoyed each stay. The hotel is well-located and well-appointed. This is a boutique hotel so if you want the large, overdone lobby stay across the street at the Marriott. The Palomar staff is friendly and helpful. For a great breakfast, go around the corner to Mel's Diner. You'll get a filling breakfast at a reasonable price. The hotel is very close to shopping and the Moscone Center. We highly recommend the Palomar for its comfortable beds, upscale furnishings and decor, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: dephal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a 1 night stay at the Palomar, and we really enjoyed it. We got a great rate from the hotel's website--$140 for a Saturday night (plus parking, which is expensive). The staff was really nice. When we first arrived, a bevy of 3 or 4 people ran up to help us. The staff paid special attention to my daughter, who's 7. The desk clerk actually encouraged her to jump on the bed, and the doorman jokingly chided her for not wearing a jacket. Despite the good service, none of the staff seems to particularly expect tips, and they seem genuinely thankful when they do receive them. The room was quite large and attractive, and the beds very comfortable. We were on the 8th floor and had a very nice view across Market Street and up toward Union Square. The L'Occitane amenities are nice, too. The location is really fantastic--BART and MUNI stop downstairs, great shopping is steps away, and SFMOMA and other museums are just a short walk away. I don't like this hotel quite as much as another Kimpton Hotel in SF, the Argonaut, but the Palomar's location is superior (unless you want to be at Fisherman's Wharf). The room was quiet in that we didn't hear a peep from neighboring rooms or the hallway. However, at 8pm a band set up across the street, and it was quite audible, even through the double-paned windows. We didn't mind, but if you don't want to hear Jimi Hendrix tunes until 11 pm (plus the occasional siren and other street noise) ask for an interior room. I only have a couple small complaints. 1. The bathroom has a pocket door. These seem to be popular in SF hotels, but I don't like them. 2. The lobby, although attractive, is small. Unlike other Kimpton properties, I don't think this one has a free wine hour in the evening. 3. I'm a Kimpton In-Touch member, but didn't get the usual welcome amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, better than I thought!”
Reviews.Author: petkee
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Palomar for 2 nights in February. I read a lot of the previous reviews, so had some reservations, however i was quite pleasantly surprised. Rooms: We booked our room, surprise-surprise, via the hotel's own website, which was the cheapest (incl. expedia, priceline, corp. rates, via travel agents, etc). Our package even included 2 bottles of soda, popcorn and a $20 hmv coupon to buy cds/dvds. Our room faced the internal court yard, so it was quite quiet in the evening. In addition, it was quite large, well appointed and looked like it was in pretty decent condition (not like some of the other reviews). I can only conclude that the conditions of the rooms vary. Location: This was main reason we stayed at the Palomar, since we were only spending 3 days in SF, 1 min. walking distance to Union Square is very important. Just check out where it is located on the map. Only complaint, which is a bit hard to avoid in sf, is some of the rif-rafts around the area, but I understand it's even worse closer to Union Square station. Anyways never really had any problems. Service: It was okay, not great not bad. The doorman was extremely nice and helpful, however they took more than 15 mins to retrieve our luggage, which almost caused us to miss our transfer to the airport. I would consider going back to the Palomar due to the convenient location. The service was acceptable. I have been living in Asia for over 12 years now, so I normally don't expect the service level in N. America to be anywhere close to those in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “great service!”
Reviews.Author: WIDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here with our three kids in two adjoining rooms. The location is very busy, if you like being where all the action is, this is the place for you. It is right in the heart of Union square near all the shopping. The staff goes way out of their way to help you in every way. They treated us like royalty all the time. My kids liked the bellman so much they kept telling us to tip them more money cause they were so "cool". Beds are super comfortable if a bit small, why do hotels have double beds when a queen would fit? Bathrooms were very fancy. The only thing I did not like was the view, there was none. Our rooms looked into the office building next door, that was a litte weird.

Reviews.Title: “my home in SF”
Reviews.Author: Bobert1
Reviews.Content: My favorite in SF. I've enjoyed at least 10 stays at the Palomar over 8 years. The only reason I ever stay elsewhere is if I can't get a good rate there. It's often not cheap, but it's worth it to keep checking for a low rate. To be fair, a big part of why I love it is the location--right at the BART station, and 5 blocks from our HQ. But it's also because they really go out of their way to take care of their guests. On my most recent stay, my day had gotten off to an awful start. Woke up to find my flight to SF cancelled, and I had to be there for an annual departmental meeting at noon. I arranged a replacement flight, but my cab no-showed, and I missed it. Another taxi to another airport, bad traffic, not enough time to check in; but I managed somehow, only to end up in the very back row next to a woman with a coughing brat in her lap. I got to the Palomar at 11:15am. I stopped in, figuring I'd at least drop my bag and use a men's room. The clerk at the front desk asked how she could help me, so I asked if it were possible to check in, explaining that I knew it was very early, etc. While she was checking, she asked how my morning was going--so I told her the story. Well the room they had set aside for me wasn't ready, so she upgraded me. And I had half an hour to relax in a deluxe room before going to the meeting. Now I hadn't been to the hotel in over a year, and I had booked my room on their website at the cheapest special rate they offer all year. But I was able to go to my meeting in a good frame of mind because the Palomar took care of me. Will I stay there again? You beat--every time I can get a rate that won't alarm our auditors.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: heffkids
Reviews.Content: This place was the best!! The rooms were very large and comfortable. The beds were great! The hospitality was second to none. I have stayed at Ritz and at the JW Marriott both 5 star and exquisite. The Hotel Palomar is in their league in hospitality and may even rival these folks. We had 2 rooms that were joined and there was at least 1000 sq of living area between them. The ‘Door-man’ had great recommendations for breakfast and dinner every day and with out exception all were of great San Francisco flavor. The Hotel is right by the trolley car system and for $1.50 you can travel through out the city. Hotel Palomar is located right in the heart of Union Square so shopping was close. We forgot the charger for our camera and found that there was a full discount camera store within a one minute walk. The hotel front desk located the store and printed us a map when we arrived and we were able to solve the problem for $29 within 30 minutes of arriving. Over all a great place we give 6 stars out of a 5 star system.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheWinston
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel March 14-15. The beds were extremely comfortable and provided a great night's sleep. The location is also a huge plus....close to the cable car and right next to bus/street car stops and lots of dining nearby. However, the hotel definately does not have the 'luxury' feel, though you may pay a luxury price for it. The rooms were small and the bathrooms were tiny. We had a view of market street which was great, though they originally tried sticking us in on the interior of the building, facing the roof, so we called the front desk to get into the other room. And keep in mind, if you reserve online, don't expect them to uphold any special requests you may make. We requested a room on the highest floor possible, yet we were given a room on the 5th floor (the lowest floor in the hotel.) Our second room was on the 6th floor and given to us 10 min after check-in, so they obviously had rooms available on higher levels. All the staff was very friendly and usually helpful. The 'business center' had computers with internet connections, though know in advance that the internet there costs extra, which should not be the case for the price you pay for a night's stay. The parking was $42 a day with valet, which is comparable to other hotels in the area. All in all it was a 'nice' hotel, but the price does not reflect what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “New decor makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: Fernleigh1
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights there at the end of February -- Wednesday thru Monday. It must have been our 4th or 5th visit to the Palomar. The hotel is nearing completion of a substantial remodeling of the sleeping rooms. The previous zebra motif has given way to soft modern colors and lines. The rooms seem both calmer and larger than previously, but also more luxurious. Only complaint is that the desk chairs were not really desk chairs, and more stylish than useful when being used for that work thing. The bathrooms also seem to have been refurbished, and a new range of toiletries is on display. Overall, it was an excellent experience. Staff are a little impersonal, with a somewhat forced "welcome back" when you come through the door. But, they did what was requested, and everything worked just fine. Out the front door and around the side is the entrance to the Bloomingdales in the expanded Westfields center. Diagnoally across the street is the Metreon theater complex. Across the street is the Marriott. So, the location is quite good, the hotel is quiet and upscale. Staff do their jobs. It was a good thing. We'll definitely use the Palomar again. Like so many of the Kimpton properties, it's a classy but affordable act.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: EmmEff
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Palomar, however only for a single night at the end of our San Francisco vacation in 2005. My previous stay there was for 4 nights in 2003. This is probably the finest hotel I have stayed at. The staff's attention to detail was impeccable. The bell hops, valet drivers, and front desk, all were very hospitable. The room was modern, well appointed and generally very comfortable. I enjoy boutique style hotels, as the Palomar is and it did not fail to disappoint. This room had a Market St. view which was also nice. My only regret was that we only stayed for a single night! Getting a discount rate on such a great hotel was excellent! Valet parking was a bit hefty, however I know parking is expensive in San Francisco. I hope to stay at the Palomar on my next visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, huge room”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: First, I don't understand the comments about the rooms being small. I booked the cheapest room, and it was huge! I just presumed all the rooms were that size. I asked for a quiet room, and didn't want one overlooking the street, as I guessed that would be noisy, and also wanted a non-smoking room (I think the whole hotel is non-smoking, but I didn't want a room that someone had smoked in). We were given a room at the back of the hotel, with apologies that it overlooked offices, as that was the quietest. The room was super quiet, once the door was shut we couldn't hear a thing. It was a huge room though. We didn't really watch tv, but if someone did, they might find the tv too far away from the beds, especially for watching a movie. We kind of felt that a lot of the room space was wasted, but it was certainly a large room. The bathroom also was huge. Lovely fittings in the bathroom, and we liked the 'arty' touch throughout the hotel. The location was great. I purposefully wanted something not right on Union Square, as that sounded noisy. I liked this location just south of the square, as it was easy to get to for transportation, stores, a grocery store down the road. We walked everywhere from the hotel. We're good walkers, but still we walked up hills, over to China Town and on to North Beach, across to Nob Hill, and took public transportation to the Haight, etc. No coffee maker in the rooms, but excellent organic coffee in the lobby, so I'd just go down there each morning and bring some up. Free internet access in the room was handy. Also, various newspapers available on each floor or outside your room. I liked the smaller size of the hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mring
Reviews.Content: First of all, we got great rates on Travelovity - $250/pp round trip from Orange County to San Francisco plus 2 nights stay. Maybe because it was in February? The hotel is close to the mall and all the shops around Union Square. It is really close to cable cars and electric cars. Virgil the concierge was very helpful. Ask him about the restaurants in an alley called Belden. Matt th bell captain, Josu and the rest of the front office staff were nice too. The only complaint I have is that our bathtub drain wasn't functioning properly. We had water up to our ankles when taking showers. We let the front desk know about the problem before we left the hotel one morning. We got back late in the evening and the problem was not fixed. The maintenance people had gone for the day. Josu tried to help us but couldn't and instead offered for us to move to another room. But it was about 11 pm in the evening and it was our last night so we decided to just tough it out. Next time I will just ask to be moved to another room right away. The rooms are on the small side but the beds are really comfortable. I definitely would stay at this hotel again!!! Next time I will try the Fifth Floor Restaurant in the hotel which has been described as expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: youcanon
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple reviews online (mainly this website) I booked a room for our family of four at the Palomar. We were a family of four with two older teenagers, and I was looking for something that would accomodate varying personalities. My husband is older, hates shopping, favors museums. My daughter wanted to SHOP, SHOP, SHOP! Our son would probably have preferred to have been left home, and I just wanted everyone to be happy. The Palomar seemed tucked back from the traffic on the main road, but it was within easy walking distance of several museums and LOADS of shopping. Chinatown was also within easy walking distance. The staff at the Palomar was SO courteous--always greeting us with a smile, opening doors (It may have helped to have the attractive 20 year old daughter along.) The room was not large, but luxuriously appointed with down comforters, really nice sheets and towels. I thought at one point that I should have booked TWO rooms, but we weren't IN the room that much, and we really didn't mind the rare family closeness. As a matter of fact, when we look back on the trip more than a year later, we talk about the night we stayed in and ordered a movie on the television as one of our favorite times on the trip. We booked one of those tours to Alcatraz, Muir Woods, Sauselito, and the bus stopped right in front of the hotel and picked us up the morning we were going to Muir Woods. We found the location perfect for our needs. My husband and I would wake up early and head out for one of the Starbucks within easy walking distance. Later we'd wake the teenagers and go DO something. Later in the day my husband would rest in the room while I shopped with one or both kids. The location was wonderful, the room VERY nice, the staff extre mely courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paubri
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Hotel Palomar through a great deal my travel agent got for me. The property has a great location right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Check-in was handled flawlessly and my room was comfortable and spotlessly clean, if a bit small. Considering that I was not planning on spending a great deal of time in my room, this wasn't an issue. The decor is modern and tasteful and the staff was never too busy to handle any request. All of the four-star touches one would expect were present and service was impeccable. In addition the Palomar has free wireless internet. Things that might be issues for some travelers would be room size (small - would have been even smaller with a second person in the room) and view (mine was of the Old Navy skylight). That being said, these weren't big issues for me as I wasn't spending a lot of time in my room, and the positives far outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: DRS1
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of (almost) every Kimpton I have stayed at, and Palomar was a special treat. The normal great amenities of a Kimpton (fabulous beds, etc). The standout was the fantastic staff--out of their way helpful (security walking me to an ATM at 2am, terrific bellmen). Great dinner recommendations. What made this so fantastic was this jewel on Market Street! Everything was so close, Union Square, shopping on Market, the Galleria. I love the Hotel Monaco, but this was pretty sweet!

Reviews.Title: “very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Pradagal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the same weekend we stayed at the Hotel Monaco. Had one night at each due to Hotel Monaco being booked. It was a great location for shopping and close to Bart which we use to get to the city. Our room was very large and clean.The two double beds were very comfortable. As always the mini bar is a great set up in a kimpton hotel.I'm a "intouch member" through Kimpton hotels and recieved a "welcome back "snack from management in the evening. Very nice touch! Also turn down service with chocolates love that. Robes in the room,plenty of towels. Would of liked a room with a view of Market not the container store but only complaint not too bad. Love the Kimpton hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: UnitedKingdomTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2006. The hotel has a great location and Union Square, Cable cars and most of the other tourist districs are within walking distance. However the hotel and restaurant is expensive for what you get and the room was of average size. We upgraded to take advantage of the Hot Tub, but unless your in San Fransciso for more then 4 days, you won't get time to use it so don't bother......

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, business-oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: DixieToronto
Reviews.Content: Booked this one through Amex for a conference. Completely pleasant, but nothing out of the ordinary. I didn't have much time for shopping, but can see it has a totally awesome location for the big shopping chains (Saks, etc..). The one very good thing was it's close proximity to the tram that takes you out to Ocean Beach, which was absolutely beautiful. The staff was lovely and helpful; forgive me, I loved that it was next door to a large Container store, which being from Canada I'd never seen. Smallish room, not unlike Manhattan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not really a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: loveridden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in a few different hotels in the Union Square area, and were disappointed by the Palomar. While it has an excellent location, the hotel itself leaves a bit to be desired. Rooms seemed tired, small, with pillows that were covered in either lint or white dog hair. Staff did not seem interested in hospitality- they seemed unresponsive when we stood at the front desk waiting for help (had to finish a personal conversation before helping). Walls are thin. If you like a boutique-hotel feel, then this is the place for you (enjoy the leopard print carpet!) but if you are looking for a more comfortable, 4 star hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at central hotel”
Reviews.Author: heman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this central hotel, was very average, but close enough to centre. Service was fairly decent, but just found some basics were missing for a hotel that should be 4 star. Easy to take the 'streetcar' to the wharf and to take No.30 to Chinatown. It was nice trip, whether was hot in early November. we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Expensive to eat in hotel, we went out to Chinatown. Restaurants are average in SF. Airport - watch out for the shuttle bus! Do not be conned to take one, even if they appear to be in a nice shirt and tie, the drivers are dodgy, be aware. It cost $35, when it shoud have been $32, better to take a taxi, it is actually cheaper! ($32). Finally when you book online via travelocity you get a good deal, and also get tonnes of spam, just be sure you use an email you dont care about. Travelocity, naughty naughty, you spammed me, and sold my email to make money did you not? Tut tut, will not book through you next time for that, so I hope you learn next time. Overall I would say this is an average hotel. probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holidayand I am extremely fussy! Perhaps not the most convenient if all you want to do is walk around abit.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kokko
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Palomar in early September. This was our first hotel in San Francisco (we stayed four nights and split it up into two hotels so we could sample two different locations). This is a very beautiful hotel. Very stylish. Great interior (especially the "restaurant" floor). Loved the floors in the lobby. The staff is very friendly. The location is great, especially if you want to go to the Museum of Modern Art, which is just a few blocks away. Very easy to walk to Union Square and lots of other places. Easy to catch public transportation also.

Reviews.Title: “A nice property”
Reviews.Author: nsvlbimmerguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for quite a while, 9 nights while attending a conference in the city. Access to the hotel via the BART system from the bay airports is easy as there's a stop across the street. Check-in was fast and pleasant, the lobby small, but well turned out. Our room was was nicely appointed. Though, while artfully done, the finishes, textiles and carpet all looked a little tired and in need of a touch up. One annoyance was the lack of a proper dresser or bureau the only piece of storage furniture being the TV armoire which also housed the mini bar, books, etc. The bathroom was just "ok". A couple annoyances, while access to public transport is nice, there is a prominent stop right in front of the hotel so quite often during the day the sidewalk is packed with people waiting for the bus, also the housekeeping service started out ok, but slowly became more inconsistent as the week unfolded. The front desk staff were very helpful, attentive and able to answer most questions I had about the city, etc. Free WiFi, a pay option at most hotels of comparable quality in the area, was nice as well. This is a great location for shopping in Union Square and area restaurants, etc. Also, this is the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at in SF, particularly with having a 6th floor room on Market St. I would probably stay again, though only for less than the $219 reserved through the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Got to sleep on the floor”
Reviews.Author: Travelalberta
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience. We had booked a double / double room, when we checked in, we asked for a cot for our son as the two teenagers sleeping in a double bed had not been successful so far on our trip. We asked if we could get either another room, or get a cot and were told that would be no problem giving us a cot. At 9:30 when we got back into the hotel from dinner, there was no cot. Upon calling to see when it was to be delivered we were told that they had run out and they would send blankets up for one of our sons to sleep on the floor. I don't know what happened between the 3pm check in and the 9:30 phone call - and we never did get a satisfactory answer, even after going past the front desk to the night manager. Other than that, the hotel was purely mid road at high end prices. The location was fine, but nothing spectacular. The room was ok, but not exceptional. The pocket door to the bathroom offered very little privacy such that others in the room could hear everything! Everytime the houskeeping staff cleaned the room, they only left two towels, so we were constantly calling the desk to get tow more towels sent up as there were four of us staying in the room. The Concierge was fantastic - he always had a great suggestion as to a fun place to eat or how to get around. He was the best part of the stay. We would not stay at a Kimton hotel again, we will go back to Renasainnce or Fairmont where we are always treated well, and they seem to want our return business. Plus we don't have to sleep on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: claire1912
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar for 4 nights before heading off to Las Vegas. I found the staff very friendly, we arrived just as the world cup was starting and wanted to catch the games, the staff gave us a list of all the games/what time they were on and what channels they were on. Did find the food expensive but we didn't eat there so can't comment on if it was nice or not. Location is the winner for this hotel, lots of shops nearby and a few bars/restaurants. We went to fishermans wharf a few times and that means a taxi ride from what i remember it was normally about $12. The only down fall i found was the size of the rooms they were tiny. Would have preferred a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!! A+++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Seb126
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor. Excellent location, very nice rooms friendly staff. Could not be better, A++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: pjcutr
Reviews.Content: Our familiy of six stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Palomar in connecting rooms. The rooms were above average and service was superior, especially the bell desk staff. The bar was nice for a drink. We would recommend eating breakfast elsewhere as the service was slow and food expensive. We ate at Lori's Diner after the first day and found the service and expense more in line. The Union Square area is within 1.5 blocks. We would stay here on our next trip to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: SYV
Reviews.Content: Since it was our first visit to San Francisco, we decided it would be fun to stay at two different hotels. We chose the Palomar and Harbor Court hotels, and according to TripAdvisor, they were similar in traveler satisfaction. That was certainly not our experience, and we wished we had stayed at the Palomar the entire trip. The Palomar has the best staff of any hotel we have ever visited. Everyone, from the bell desk to concierge was friendly, professional, and knowledgable. I booked a Executive King through the hotel's website and when we checked in we had been upgraded to Room 816, which was a beautiful room with large windows that overlooked the street. I was concerned at first that the noise from the street would be bothersome but it wasn't. At night we didn't hear anything and slept great. The bathroom was very nice, with thoughtful amenities like a magnifying makeup mirror and ample room to put personal belongings. The room was very comfortable and the decor was beautiful, but also fun, with leopard print carpeting. The bed was very comfortable with high quality bed linens. There were four bed pillows, something we really appreciated. A pretty room means nothing to us, though, if the hotel staff isn't what it should be. The staff is great, we felt welcome and pampered from the minute we walked in. I used the concierge (Yeme) several times and she gave us great advice and was so very nice. We also asked directions several times and the bell desk was helpful and accurate. The location is great, and we didn't rent a car while we were there. We walked everywhere, or took public transportation which is easily accessible. A couple of tips that are very important - if you plan to visit Alcatraz, be sure to buy your tickets through blueandgoldfleet[""]ahead of time. There were many people trying to get tickets and they couldn't - sold out. Also, if you want to take a wine tour and plan to use a tour company or limo, it would be best to choose the company ahead of time and make reservations. The company we wanted to use (recommended by Yeme) was sold out for the weekend, so we had to go with someone else. It was ok, glad we did it, but the other would have been better. Best meal we had was at Scomas, on Pier 47. Great seafood! We were so pleased with this hotel that we will definately come back to it next time we go to San Francisco, which I hope will be soon. It is a beautiful, wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bathtub in the world!”
Reviews.Author: drummerliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite at the Palomar recently with my nephew and we had a great time. All the amenities you could want, great room service (which we used and abused) wonderful decor. We chilled with a friend, watched dvd's, drank champagne and spoiled ourselves rotten. The best part by far for me was the Fuji soaking tub. If you can swing a room with one of these tubs do it! (luxury kings and suites) I'm a big girl and some hotel tubs don't cover all my parts but this tub was huge, I was completely covered up to my neck. I could swim in it. You know when you're two and the tub is the funnest place in the world? That's this tub. They should provide toys. I took three baths in 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Jem of a find”
Reviews.Author: ADouble
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, quiet setting. Overall very lovely experience. Liked: clean room modern decor with awesome ammenities great TV service great adequate gym good location nice bathroom Disliked smallish room, but didn't mind at all as it was very well furnished, very clean and quiet $$$ restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Palomar for eight nights while on business. Rooms: Average sized for San Francisco. Aveda products. Clean sheets. Beds are not as comfortable as those at the W. Service: The staff at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. Great staff. Gym: Tiny gym. Three cardio machines and a universal system. They offer a $15 day pass to a local gym. Food: I only had breakfast at the hotel. The food was good. I would stay at the hotel again; however, other hotels might have more comfortable beds. Its a nice hotel, its just not the best hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Nikon70
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is not quite a 5 star hotel, after all. I would class it at a 4 at best. The lux king was small and those rooms are located on the noisey side of the hotel which I wasn't told when booking. The reception desk was nice and helpful, but do not expect a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Palomar”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: Palomar is a small boutique hotel, part of Kimpton Hotels located on Market and Fourth St. The hotel itself is not that big, it's only 9 stories high, however, it was very homey and inviting. Positives: - Location is perfect, a few blocks away from Union Square, less than a block away from Sony Metreon and San Francisco Shopping Center. - We are big on Customer Service, so that is the first thing that we noticed when we arrived. Everyone was friendly and very approachable. They always greeted us with a big smile and was willing to help. - During our check in, we were upgraded to a Suite without even asking. Perhaps because we are members of the Kimpton? They also greeted us with a welcome bag which consisted of a bottle of distiled water and an apple. It's not a big thing, but it's a nice gesture. - We have stayed at many different hotels in San Francisco, but we have never encountered hotel rooms so quiet before. We were on the 8th floor and we could not hear the busy streets at all. We were expecting to hear a lot of noises, (I even had my earplugs ready) so this was a nice surprise. Some of the problems we encountered during our stay: - I usually don't use shampoo and conditioners provided by Hotels, but Kimpton usually provides great amentines, so I decided not to bother to bring my own. The shampoo (Aveda) really dried up my hair. Not a big deal really, for I was smacked in the middle of downtown, an easy walk to get my regular shampoo. - The pillows were small. We are used to having either queen/king size pillows on a king size bed, but these pillows provided were the standard pillows. They were so small that they looked out of place on such a large bed. - The bathroom was nice, and the tub was big enough, however, the water in the tub took forever to drain. In fact, the water reached my ankle when I was taking a shower. We let the hotel know about this, but we were encountering the same problems the whole time we were there. The toilet wasn't flushing properly also. We had to flush at least twice or three times each time. Overall, we had a great stay at Palomar, and most likely will return.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: Ridgesas
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance via Expedia and booked it give the positive reviews on TA. This hotel is a great “boutique” style property situated right in the heart of San Fran. All the places we wanted to see were easily accessible from this hotel either by walking or by tram/train/streetcar/bus all of which are within a block of this hotel. Outside the hotel you will find pan handlers and homeless people however, this is to be expected anywhere in San Fran (you can also expect this outside the Four Season’s which is only a block away). The property is very clean and stylish without being too over the top. The room was on the smaller side but very clean and comfortable. The bed was great along with the linens and towels. We rented a car and took a day trip to Napa which is highly recommended. The wineries were great and the food was amazing. Being the 4th of July, we expected warm weather and were somewhat surprised at how cold it is in San Fran. The weather reports said the temperature would be around 20 but with the wind/fog it was more like 10. Other than the cold weather we enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrownBalto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palomar for two nights in late June. My husband and I stayed in a room that overlooked Old Navy and my daughters, ages 14 and 17 shared a room that faced the street. Both rooms were quiet and all four of us loved the hotel. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms large with plenty of room to put personal toiletries, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient, near to various forms of public transportation. The beds were comfortable. I can only say great things about the hotel, would stay there again, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up For The Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful, long weekend in San Francisco and have only good things to say about the Hotel Palomar. From it's ground zero location in downtown SF, to its' friendly, polite and professional staff and wonderfully stocked rooms. My room on the 8th floor faced busy Market St. yet couldn't have been more serene. It had a beautiful view up Stockton Street and the fog rolling in every evening. My apologies to the wonderful staff for my poor memory with their names. I do remember that some of them had name tags that also included an artist name of their choice. One very polite employee who showed me my room had the name M. C. Escher on his name tag. Everyone smiled and was polite and professional. SFMOMA and Yerba Buena Gardens are steps away as is Union Square. The hotel has a small workout room which was nice. They also have day passes to Club One which is a fully stocked gym and an easy walk from the hotel. Restaurant Recommendations: LJ's at 101 4th for martinis and delicious dinners, Thai House at 599 Castro and 2223 Restaurant on Market at the same number. Both are bustling, stylish places with great food at reasonable prices. Recommended Site to See: the Asian Art Museum at 200 Larkin St.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great location”
Reviews.Author: KellyMarschall
Reviews.Content: This property is refined and welcoming, with excellent staff and a fabulous 5th floor resteraunt. The location is tremendous, allowing us to dine in Union Square, attend a musical and walk to the Cubs-Giants game. It is right around the corner from the Yerba Buena gardens and within walking distance of the aquarium. Shopping within a block includes crate and barrel, AX emporium, Macy's and United Colors of Benetton. Rooms are well decorated, mini bar nicely stocked and the turn down service is a nice touch. We celebrated my birthday at the 5th floor and considered it one of the best dining experiences we have had anywhere in the world. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saps
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a getaway weekend. The hotel was very nice. The bathroom was great - it had a seperate deep soaking tub. The location is perfect - it is 2 blocks from Union Square. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Room service was excellent. The one negative thing I would say about the hotel is that it does not have a comfortable lounge area to get a cocktail. The lounge is part of the restaurant Fifth Floor and is a bit too stuffy and formal for me...but that is just my opinion. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “downtown san fran”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location...easily accessible to all major venues, nothing spectacular about this hotel. clean, friendly. quaint, and slightly trendy without all the snobbishness that is so highly favored by the clientelle at the W. would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “You'll probably enjoy this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoGustoSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right above the Old Navy store on Market street, just blocks from Union Square shopping, and one short block from the Sony Metreon. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to arrange in-room massages via the concierge, no problem. The room service was prompt, tasty and reasonably priced for that kind of thing. There is a convenient self-service business center (for Internet access, etc) and a small health machine facility, both of which looked quite new and up-to-date, and well-maintained. My only slight disappointment was with the restaurant. I arrived at the hotel in the later afternoon, and the place hadn't opened yet. I wanted a snack and a drink, and had to settle for something from the mini-bar instead. Not a big deal, given the location in the midst of some of the finest dining on the West Coast, but be prepared for limited opening hours of the in-house watering hole. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet enough for a restful stay. I would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: california2006
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault the location. My family and I satyed at the Hotel Palomar for 3 nights and found plenty to see and do within easy walking distance of the hotel. I don't feel that the hotel deserves it's 5* status, the carpets were dirty and rooms rather dark. The rooms were also not decorated to my taste at all (leopard print caprets-yuck!) but don't let this put you off...the beds were so comfy it was hard to get up-down matress toppers are a genious invention! We ate at the reastrant (Fifth Floor) and were very dissapointed having read many rave reviews. Yes the food is lovely but it is incredibly pretentious with overly attentive staff. I'm sure there are places to eat with a much nicer atmosphere for a fraction of the price (though it was the best steak i've ever eaten!!) I'd be tempted to stay at the Four seasons next time, or one of the hotels we passed on Union Square, which all have equally excellent locations.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in SF”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy in NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a suite - two adults in the king bedroom and our adult son in the living room. Wonderful space, pullout couch was excellent (he's 6'2" and he was very comfortable). Bathroom huge, shower terrific, big two person soaking tub with jets. City noise outside, but that's to be expected - hotel is very quiet internally. We had a car, and valet service was good. Service, in general, is the problem here, and it's just spotty - not mean. Examples: asked for a coffee maker in room, was told it would be there, never saw it. Coffee in the lobby was very good, though, so we gave up. Alos, manager emailed me in advance asking for input, so I told him we were would like to have enough towels and bedding for our third person; he agreed. I mentioned it again when we checked in, but we ended up having to ask yet again before we saw pillows and a couple of ratty old (but clean) blankets for the pull out. Oh, and the "down comforter" on our king bed was an old worn blanket, too, encased in sheets. Generally, the space was well planned, clean, spacious, and comfortable, with good lighting. This a great location for walking to the MOMA, Yerba Buena gardens, Union Square and shopping, Chinatown, the Embarcadero, and lots of wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: hairykid
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is simply one of the most comfortable, cosy hotels that I have ever experienced, and I travel a lot for business. I usually stick to the large chain hotels because you can rely on consistency, but I was so happy to have chosen the Palomar for my last trip. My double room ($259 per night) was vast (love the leopard print carpet), with a good-sized bathroom. Although only steps away from Market Street, there was no noise to disturb my sleep in the huge bed. When I arrived in my room, the TV was playing soft music and calming pictures of waterfalls - just what I needed after a gruelling 10-hour flight from London. All the fixtures were stylish and clean, with thick robes in the closet and chocolate every night on the pillow. I would definitely stay here again as a tourist, my only negative points are as a business traveller. Room service breakfast does not start for hot food until 7 am weekdays/8 am weekends. While this is fine for tourists, for those of us who have 8 am Sunday meetings it's not ideal. I found the room service food to be the only aspect of my stay which let the place down - dinner on my first night was really disappointing. Expensive and badly cooked. The room service food does not come from the restaurant kitchen, and it shows. Also, there is no business centre in the hotel, although it is possible to send faxes from the front desk. There is no coffee machine in the room either, another negative for the seriously jet-lagged. But these points did not make me regret not staying in the Marriott across the road. I'm not used to the kind of personal attention that you get at the Palomar, and it was a very nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Palomar for business and even had a meeting there. The staff was very professional and friendly. My guest room was very neat and clean. The meeting room, de Young Boardroom, was a perfect room for a meeting. The food service staff was very friendly and not in the way at all during our meeting. I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: froggyUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in late March. Terrific location just steps from Market Street and easy access to all public transport (including the BART station literally round the corner - 30 minutes direct from SFO for $5.15). Second Kimpson Hotel in San Francisco (the other was the equally excellent Argonaut) I've stayed at and they're very impressive. The Palomar had it all - friendly greeting at the front desk, immaculate room (very well appointed including DVD player and large TV) with perfect housekeeping and a very comfy bed. Turn down service and chocolate too. Almost no noise from the street - all the rooms are on the fifth floor or above. Bit more pricey than your standard tourist hotel, but well worth those extra bucks for the extra quality.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cbfnyc
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palomar Hotel during a weekend birthday celebration. The front desk staff is exceedingly pleasant and thoughtful and they make every effort to make the check procedure as fast and easy as possible. The room is well appointed, with every amenity. The beds are comfy, the sheets soft and everything is spotless. They offer free wireless internet, which lots of hotels charge $10/day extra for. The exceptional thing that happened is that I had mentioned being in town for my birthday. About an hour after checking in, there was a gentleman at the door with a complimentary half bottle of wine and a box of truffles from their restaurant, The Fifth Floor. It was so wonderful and thoughtful and truly made the day special. In terms of location, you can't do much better in San Francisco. It's a two block walk to Union Square, all the shopping is in close proximity, and there is a BART station a half block away. There are many hotels in this area, and I have stayed at a few others, but for a total package in terms of price, location, amenities and service, would definitely give the Palomar top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Positive Stay at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: PaintTheCity
Reviews.Content: The location of the Palomar is perfect for stepping out any time of the day or night - you're less than 2 blocks from Union Square, lots of shopping, restaurants and people. The Ferry Market is a 15 minute walk, highly recommended - and if you don't want to walk anymore, public transportation, cable cars and taxis are literally a step away. Ultimately, the staff makes a stay at a hotel matter - and they were all above and beyond my expectations. The hotel partners with a limo service that was fantastic - which is another great suggestion in touring the city and beyond. Money well spent. The doormen will arrange the service for you. I booked a king and upgraded to a suite on the 9th floor - which was divine. If you need the room to spread out and enjoy the view, do it. And after walking all over the city all day, the jacuzzi tub and the shower take away all your aches and pains. And if you don't have the energy to get back out for dinner, or you want a good breakfast to start off the day right - the restaurant's food is great. A little on the high-end price wise, but it's convenient. The bed was wonderful, the room service was great and it was quiet and peaceful when I retired for the night. There wasn't one single negative thing to report about the Hotel Palomar. I will always choose this hotel in future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: voll002
Reviews.Content: Reading the last review, I feel obligated to post my recent experience at the Hotel Palomar. Maybe I'm not quite as "picky" as other people, but I found the customer service at the hotel to be excellent, as compared to the 200+ other hotels I've stayed at in the last 12 months. Apparently the hotel was good enough to win the "Conde Nast" Traveler's 2005 Gold List of World's Best Places to stay, so I guess I'm not alone in thinking that it's a nice place to stay. Being a "road warrior", I'm also an "Inner Circle Elite Member", so it's possible I get treated a little better than the average customer, but compared with my treatment at other chains (Intercontinental, Marriott, Starwood), I found the customer service to be more than adequate. Checkin: I arrived early at the hotel (approx 1 PM), and didn't expect to be given a room, but the desk clerk found one for me without a problem. Based on my "Inner Circle" status, I asked if I could get upgraded. Again, based on past experiences with equal status at other chains, I was more than prepared to accept a negative response. The desk clerk upgraded me to a jacuzzi suite, no extra charge. She was very friendly, smiling, and welcoming, traits that I unfortunately see a paucity of in the hotel business. Room Service: I believe that room service at most Kimpton hotels is not quite at the same level as larger hotels, because they are boutique hotels, which are smaller in scale by definition than main chain hotels. That said, I think the quality of food I've ordered at Kimptons hotels exceeds their rivals. I did have breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and though expensive, it really was not any more than rival hotels (esp. for San Francisco). Service was fast and good, so no problems there. Room: Clean, with relatively new appearing furniture (again, maybe I'm just not as picky as others - but I do stay in enough hotels to be able to judge quality of room accomodations). The bathroom had a jacuzzi with separate walk-in shower with Aveda toiletries. Overall: Considering I booked the room with a Travelzoo discount of 150 (with $25 discount towards restaurant meal), I would most definitely stay there again. And the friendly, welcoming staff was the icing on the top which is the feature that would lead me to stay there again. I think that the same Travelzoo offer also has free parking for those driving, and may be running through March (on the weekend). They also have "Hot Date Hot Rate" specials (like all Kimptons)

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else - luxury hotels should make your stay better not worse”
Reviews.Author: SWEngineer
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Friday night in Feb 2006 I will start with the issues that reflect less preferential then on to my quirks... 1) When you order room service at 10:30PM then a) the person that answers the phone should know the offerings b) the person that is to call you back (supposedly knowing the offerings) does so within 30 minutes c) When you call back after 30 minutes then you should get someone to answer the phone within the first 10 rings d) during this call (after 13 rings) the person should handle the problem promptly e) there should be more than the scant offerings of one (the only one) pot pie and a chefs salad f) When you order and they say that the food will be there in 30 minutes it should be there in less thank 1.5 hours g) The salad should be cold and not populated with brown lettuce, stale/dry cold cuts, and white tomatoes On to my quirks... Quirk #1: I do NOT want a bell hop to touch my luggage I do NOT wnat a bell hop to 'push my trolley" I do NOT want a bell hop to even know my name I am paying for the facilities of the hotel - the trolley is part of these facilities - I should not have a bell hop tell me that I cannot use the bloody trolley. If I say I want to ferry my luggage to my room myself using the trolley then that s my perogotive - LET ME. Quirk #2: I do NOT want a valet to touch my car I accept that I generally have to tolerate this and so, when I do so, and I pay for parking as well as tipping the valet - then, when I call down for my car at 7:30PM then 1) The concierge should answer the phone 2) When I call the front desk and ask for my car they shouldn't tell me "take a number" 3) It shouldn't take 25 minutes for them to get my car (NOTE: only one other car was brought in that 25 minutes and the next day - they had it within 5 minutes). Quirk #3: We selected the hotel because it was "pet friendly". A pet friendly hotel should allow me to leave my pet in the room if I feel that doing so was safe and I am willing to take the responsibility. There was no indication of the requirement for attending my dog at all times until check in (not quite bait and switch as they don't tell -how- friendly they are). We had to take the dog with us - to our event requiring that we leave her in the car, further requiring that we drive rather than take a taxi, and eliminating the need to go to the drink-and-dance party as remaining 100% sober is the only way to drive. When I travel to europe, to a little burgh along the Rhine then I get better service knowing that there is no service available rather than feeling that the service is available and isn't. When I travel to Singapore to a luxury hotel none of the issues raised above had been near visible - much less than occuring. When I travel to Mobile Alabama I get treated better... In the future I will opt for the motels further away from the location of the event and take three rooms for the price of the luxury hotel be able to walk to the resturaunts for evening meal - leave my dog in the room and pay nothing for parking, need no valet, use the trolley all I want with no bleeding bell hop to tell me that I cannot ferry my own luggage to my room.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is fabulous. First of all It's in a great location - right off of Market Street in the heart of San Francisco. It is within walking distance of a multitude of shops, restaurants, the Sony Metreon and the Moscone Convention center. The staff is courteous and the hotel itself has a wonderful decor. The rooms are on the small side, and the view left something to be desired, (we had a view into the Old Navy Store downstairs) but I would stay there again tonight if I could! I wish I had dined at the restaurant, (because the aroma coming out of there was great) but I didn't have time.. Next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as always!”
Reviews.Author: bshanson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Palomar on 3 occasions. A group of friends and I take an annual trip to San Francisco to have some girl time and to do lots of shopping. The staff at Hotel Palomar is outstanding. I have never felt more welcome in any hotel before or after this. We have considered staying at another hotel, since the nightly rate is fairly high, but I have to say we cannot switch! We are completely spoiled rotten now!! The location cannot be beat. We are able to walk to everything we need. Once we check in, we never have to get the car out of the garage! If you can possibly swing the price, stay there! You will not be disappointed. From the moment you check in, rest assured, you will be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Chill”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: What a find, and a price to match! Everything about this hotel was perfect from the friendly clerks to the soft sheets and comfy bed. The service was impeccable, treated me like family immediately, and even gave me the location of the closest inexpensive garage. The room was large, particularly by San Francisco standards and I was treated like royalty. The only place I will stay in SF from now on....

Reviews.Title: “Service as it Should Be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is a striking hotel. Everything is subtle and refined and very comfortable. You know you have arrived somewhere special from the moment you walk in. One staff member, however, was absolutely sublime. Ana, the front desk manager, is the star player on Palomar's well-oiled team. She represents the kind of customer service that is nearly non-existant these days. Many front desk managers I have encountered in my travel try to pomp themselves up and end up coming off completely offensive and ineffective. Ana was exceptional--often greeting us by name and inquiring about our satisfaction. She was ever-humble and responsive. I know of many Four Seasons managers who could learn much from her style.

Reviews.Title: “Be happy to come back”
Reviews.Author: wandering-soprano
Reviews.Content: Visiting San Francisco on business, I did not have enough time to the good things the hotel had to offer. No time to visit the famed French restaurant on the fifth floor... The room I had was spacious, nicely decorated. Bed was firm, had down pillows, and I loved their turn-down service. Their business center on the fifth floor was unattended but well maintained. Even if you travel without your personal computer, you can check email, browse web or print material there. It was also ideal for browsing nespapers in the morning. What I loved most was their DVD/CD player. I wish to come back for a leisure visit so that I can take fuller advantage of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel: Won't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: thode
Reviews.Content: This hotel will not disappoint. The room we were in had soothing decor with plenty of space, and the bed was more than comfortable. Our room faced the inside square, so there was never any noise. Every staff person we encountered, from the people at the desk to the wonderful doormen, was friendly and helpful. We even had a room service dinner one evening when our team was playing - excellent! The location is in the midst of almost anywhere you want to go. This one is a gem! As dog lovers, we could not help but notice that you can have your pets accompany you here. In addition, you can call up a masseuse for your dog and have a 30 minute or 60 minute massage! Unfortunately, our dogs did not accompany us - perhaps next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is a terrific hotel -- very stylish, great service, and a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Much better than the 'W'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a super hotel. We recently stayed one night (after one night at the pricey "W" in San Fran) and the Hotel Palomar was far superior! They are located very close to one another -- convenient location -- but the Hotel Palomar had nicer (and larger) rooms, friendlier service & better amenities (free wireless access in-room). The Hotel Palomar also had much cleaner rooms (the W's were far from spotless). All this, and the Hotel Palomar was $129 less! The Palomar is a Kimpton hotel, and if this is representative of their hotels, I will look for them from now on. Skip the overrated W and enjoy this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good looking albeit small hotel”
