Reviews.Author: Alan1111111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 6 nights during Labor Day week for a small vacation. This is my first stay at a "boutique" hotel as I usually stay at chains. The location is only a block away from the Market street cable car turnaround, a block away from Union Square, a block away from a huge movie theater complex and garden area, and about 3 blocks away (well within walking distance) of Chinatown. You can't ask for a better location for a hotel, tons of shopping and restaurants nearby. All the employees were very friendly and accomodating. The room was on the small side but looked great and was clean, the bed was very comfortable. The interior decoration of the hotel is just awesome, really trendy and hip looking. All in all, I enjoyed my stay and can't beat the price for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: Lanea
Reviews.Content: We had planned an 8 day trip to explore SF and chose the Palomar largely due to the high rating on Trip Advisor. I had requested a high floor and a city view. We ended up with a fairfly high floor but no city view probably due to my travel agent (Liberty Travel) stinking. We had a non descript view but it was super quiet which ended up being fine since there was plenty of noise in the city when we went out. I have nothing to compare this to in SF so please keep that in mind. The room (deluxe king) was small but nicely arranged. Use their luggage rack as there is not enough drawer space but who really cares. The bathroom does have that sliding door but it ended being fine. The bed was super comfortable although the TV reception was lousy due to neaby construction. The concierges there are great. Super friendly and helpful. The whole staff really makes you feel like you are the only ones in the hotel (wait.. were we?). Actually there was a big Intel convention down the street so I think the hotel was fairly crowded. The hotel is a couple o' blocks below all the major shopping in Union Square which is fine. We are natural food eaters so we lucked out that there was a Whole Foods about a 10 minute walk South. No problem since too much room service gets expensive. They give you free use of Yoga equipment for use in your room or, as in our case, for use in the numerous SF yoga studios. Plenty of nearby great food and every recommendation we received from the concierges were spot on. If you want to catch a movie you will be one block from the largest Loews? multiplex ever created. A million screens. Housekeeping was quite excellent. I was worried when I read a less than stellar review just before we left but our experience was in line with our fairly high expectations. Clean, great service, great location.. Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bettyjo
Reviews.Content: A really great find! This hotel had a really personal feel and friendly staff, we managed to get a good rate directly through the hotel and they extended our stay when we requested, and honoured the same rate for the second night. The turn-down service was a nice touch and we were made to feel very welcomed by the staff. It is in a great location, on fourth and market street and lots of good shops, and not far from union square and transport to other parts of the city. We would most definately stay at this hotel again. One tip is not to bring your car to San Francisco if you can avoid it! We felt the valet parking was quite expensive and we had real problems getting to the hotel, even though it is in a great location it is surrounded by a confusing one-way system and we had to go around the block several (stressful!) times, passing the hotel but unable to get to there!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you get a hot rate”
Reviews.Author: PT1976
Reviews.Content: BF and I stayed here July 4-6, taking advantage of the Hot Dates, Great Rates on their website. Room was $139 a night and a good value for that price. Location was fantastic, right by Market Street, about a twenty minute walk to the Embarcadero, Giants stadium, ten minutes tops to Union Square. Decor was modern (no flowers), room was small but furniture was solid and bed was heavenly. No view, but also no noise. The turndown service was a nice touch - they even selected music for us. Clean and stylish. I like that they give you the option of replacing your towels and linens in an effort to conserve energy and water. Front desk was fantastic, doormen were super-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an awesome weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Hotel Palomar. I have never been more impressed with a hotel and their staff as I presently am with the Hotel Palomar. It is a beautiful and contemporary boutique hotel located almost 2 blocks from Union Square, close enough to public transportation and major attractions. The rooms are generously proportioned with fantastic accents and the beds are soo warm and comfortable. Especially with the down comforters....The staff went out of their way to help celebrate my partners birthday and even left a gift in our room. Whenever we return to San Francisco, we will not stay anywhere but the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a good solid boutique hotel where you will have a comfortable stay. There is no wow factor - so if you are looking for spectacular views or grand lobbies, this is not the place. The location is good - about a block from Union Square. The rooms are decent sized - we had a executive king on the 6th floor. At first they gave us a similar room on the seventh flr which was facing a wall - terrible view. But upon request, they gave us the one on the 6th flr with a view of market street - much better. The bed, pillows, linens are all very high quality and comfortable. Service was for Room Service (good food!), Valet parking and Housekeeping. The doubleglazed windows really do block the street noise out. We could however hear the street musicians everyday on market street right below our room. They stop before 10:00 pm. And the music was actually very good and added to the general atmosphere. The lobby is very nondescript, and breakfast was blah.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar from July 1st - 4th and had a fantastic time. From the moment that we stepped out of the taxi, we were greeted by the doormen. The bellman promptly brought our luggage to our room and instructed us on the use of the AC, etc. The staff was always friendly, and especially the concierge, Virgil, was most helpful and cheerful when we had questions. He always made us feel like special friends. The room was very sleek and clean, the beds and blankets,were "most"comfortable, and the Aveda toiletries were nice. We also enjoyed the nice music and in room CD's. The housecleaning staff was efficient, and came in every afternoon to fill the ice bucket and to do turn down service. They also always left a nice Ghirardelli chocolate candy with us. :) A nice extra was the complimentary yoga basket to use in the room. It was a nice way to unwind after the plane ride. We also enjoyed the complimentary coffee and tea in the morning in the lobby. The only downside was that since it was downtown, the nights felt unsafe to walk around, but as soon as we got to the hotel, the doormen were there to open the doors. Check out was a breeze, and the bellman was there to take our luggage to the taxi. A perfect get away at an intimate hotel. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: SCFCanton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to San Francisco & Napa for our 10th anniversary. We stayed at the Palomar at the back end of our trip - and it was well worth it. The staff made us feel special and took really good care of us. We only stayed two nights, but their hospitality made us feel like we were long-time friends and frequent guests. The bell staff was very efficient and they brought up our bags right away. When we were getting ready to leave for the airport, they helped us box up and seal a case of wine we were checking as luggage on our flight. For our anniversary they gave us a nice bottle of red and box of chocolates. They also obtained great dinner reservations for us. Our room was really nice and spacious. Turn down service was a nice touch - they left more chocolates. My wife loved the bath accessories, hair-dryer, etc. I really liked having the nice stereo, etc. in the enterainment cabinet. It was nice to listen to music on a decent sound system in your room. The hotel is in a great location if you going to use Market Street as your home base for your San Francisco stay. Palomar is close to the Pier/Wharf areas, the Financial District and the chain shopping (Macy's Nordstrom, etc.) We booked using a online special rate that included a parking credit - but most of the rental car agencies have return counters close to the hotel. Thus we could have returned our rental car two days earlier and used the parking credit for credit at the Fifth Floor restaurant (one of SF's best.) If we had any complaints, its that the staff did not always give us the best or clearest directions to the various sites/restaurants that we were going to visit. The directions were mostly vague ... "walk up 4th three blocks, turn right - its on that street" kind of thing. Because of that it took us 10-15 minutes to find the hotel, find one of our restaurants, etc. We liked the overall look and feel of the hotel, the location, and our stay. For the price we expected a good experience and we got it.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: dwldds
Reviews.Content: I went to San Francisco on business and found the Palomar after unsuccessfully booking at the Marriott across the way. This was my first experience at a "boutique" hotel. The main thing that attracted me to this hotel was the modern style and attention to detail without the expensive room rates. When I arrived, I was not disappointed. The lobby, though small was minimalistically classy. There was something different about this place.....The check in was fine, and the front desk staff were quite friendly. My room was wonderful. Lots of characteristic swank, very modern, sharp and clean. I was impressed with the CD/radio, the decor, and the AVEDA toilettries which all indicate Kimpton's desire to offer high quality affordably. I had a bit of trouble during my stay - a false alarm and a premature check-out botch. However, The staff were quite apologetic and did what they could to accommodate me. I was moved to a different room and discovered that the decor was essentially the same from room to room. Not surprising, but probably the secret to allowing them to offer what they do. The hotel has a restaurant/lounge that - as it turns out - is frequented by locals moreso than hotel guests (at least so I think). This would be fine, but the fact that the lounge was located on a floor adjacent to guest rooms makes me wonder if this was the wisest form of planning. Still, the noise level rises only around happy hour and is not otherwise a problem. The fitness room is compact but the essentials are there. Business types may frequent this hotel, and this is why I found the fitness room to be used very rarely by hotel guests. The novelty of the hotel may wear off, since it's a lot of surface wow and not too much depth in amenities. But this is not a resort, and as far as hotels go, this is a winner if you match style and class with the manageable room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the good and bad about the Palomar...”
Reviews.Author: thoggy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited San Francisco for 4 nights and after looking around online a lot, we chose to stay at the Hotel Palomar. Here's my thoughts on it: - Once you have done your looking around online and found what you think is the best deal, go to the Palomar website and see what they are charging for the exact same type o room. If you call the number for reservations or go to the Kimpton Group website you can see they have a "best rate guaranteed" deal where they match the rate you found plus you get late checkout times and a room upgrade if available. The room upgrade is probably a little iffy according to other reviews on this site, but it did work for us. We booked a King Deluxe (their base room) and were upgraded to a Executive King room which is slightly larger and faces out rather than looking at the inner courtyard. The room is still not overly large (350 square feet) but the view was nice (Market Street, with Macy's etc. in view). I should mention that I wrote an email to the reservations people at the hotel asking for a room upgrade as well so not sure if the upgrade happened as a resut of the Kimpton guarantee or my email. Still, well worth a try. We got ours for $200 U.S. a night including all taxes which while not a huge steal was decent. - Hotel location is pretty decent, located right in the middle of the shopping district and centrally located for any touristy things you are plannin on doing. The one thing I would say is that while the immediate neighbourhood is good, SF has a big problem with homeless people and you will often see them in front of the hotel. This is true everyhere in the downtown area so not a big deal but still a little unsettling. It was always relieving to have the doormen open the oor for you as you approach and escape into the lobby. - Service was fine for us, though we didn't ask for very much. We checked in late in the evening with no problem and the bellhop was very friendly and informative. The desk staff were polite but never seemed to go out of their way to say hello as you walk by or anything. Maids were friendly and said hi and smiled whenever they saw you. - Design and decor was great. It is a beautiful hotel if you are into modern style and some nice luxury touches. There was nothing in our room that turned me off the place. I hate when you stay at a hotel and it seems nice but then you notice scuff marks on the wall or cracks in the bathroom tiles and so on. The king bed was super comfortable though if you or your partner are a restless sleeper it might be problematic as it was somewhat springy and when my girlfriend would turn over, I would bounce a little on my side. That said, it was a great sleep with wonderful linens and pillows. One of the best beds I have slept in, in a hotel. The TV was fine and the Sony CD player was very nice with some music and a light jazz station coming in very clearly. The bathroom does lack a little bit in privacy as it is a sliding door that does not latch or close. It is not see through or anything but when the bed is right beside the bathroom door you may hear more noises when someone uses it then you would prefer. If you aren't shy though, no problem! - Overall it was a pretty good experience. If we returned to San Francisco I would probably stay there again, though I would be tempted to stay in a different part of the city. We were there on vacation and it proved a decent home base from which to go out each day. Hope you found this useful as I know reading the reviews helped me decide!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Syphrite
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my boyfriend and I feel like superstars. They were incredibly attentive from the moment we arrived....even allowing us to check in to our room 3 hours early. I even had a pair of pants dry cleaned in 4 hours. The room was very nicely appointed and clean. The decorations and ambiance were very modern and well done. The 5th Floor restaurant was SUPERB. We ate some of the best scallops ever there. We sat at the bar for a couple of drinks, the bartender and waitstaff were all very nice. When the bartender overheard my boyfriend and I discussing how we were going to make a reservation at a restaurant he immediately called and made the reservation for us. We didn't even have to ask! Upon check out the hotel arranged for a luxury town car to take us to the airport. We were extremely impressed by the service and location of this hotel. It is right in the center of everything: shopping, dining, tourism. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the San Fran area.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly pleased, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stop-over stay in the Hotel Palomar based on the positive reviews on this website and I certainly didn't disagree. We were greeted after a long journey in a friendly and professional manner by all members of staff. The room, although interior facing was nicely decorated and extremely quiet. The bed was the most comfortable bed I'd ever slept in a hotel which meant we had a wonderful nights sleep. The location of this hotel is brilliant if you want to be close to Union Square. It is just two blocks away and all flat walking, so no steep hills to climb! The only negative was the pricey restaurant in the hotel. We ate there being jet lagged and needing an early night but $23 for a couple of scallops, although very nice, was a little over the top!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: rosebud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our 4 night stay at the Hotel Palomar. They honored my request for an exterior facing room, higher floor. Limited views of Market Street and nearby tall buildings/Marriott. Very spacious room, great layout and calming interior design with in room CD and all the tech equipment you could want. Phenomenal service, great location between Soma and Union Square shopping, a stone's throw from the Moscone Convention Center, half a short block from the Bart Station. We ate at the hotel's posh five star restaurant, "The Fifth Floor", which was a splurge but worth every penny for a memorable evening of out of this world cuisine, romantic atmosphere and doting service (the much more affordable breakfast was also very good, with quick and convenient service). A great home base in a world class city.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, not-so-great service”
Reviews.Author: mgoebel
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to be here for a convention for four nights. When I arrived, they told me that they were full because "another party had decided unexpectedly to extend their stay," and so they booked me and about ten other convention attendees at another hotel. Though I thought the lack of a room was inexcusable, the situation was handled reasonably well by the front desk staff. However, when I went back the next day for my room at noon (they had said I would be scheduled for an earlier arrival), the Palomar told me that my room was still being cleaned and to come back in a half-hour. Three hours later, at 3:00 pm, I was again told to come back in a half-hour for my room. Finally, at about 5:00 pm, I was given a room key. The room itself was smallish but very nice. Sleek, yet attractive and comfortable. Great amenities, including some cool CD samplers. Very nice bathroom, though the tub grout could use a good cleaning. They upgraded me to a room with a nice exterior view and sent a bottle of wine for my troubles, plus coupons for free breakfast every day. But I had to push for those. The restaurant is intended primarily for dinner. They'll serve you breakfast, but only grudgingly -- the waitresses in the morning have tons of attitude and were very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar Christmas, 2004. Lobby felt more like an office building than hotel, though it still had appeal. Rooms were excellent. Chic decor. Well appointed and designed, cheerful and modern. Great little CD stereo with cool music assortment provided. Asian/Zen inspired touches in hallways that culminated in a impressive looking bar and restaurant on (and called) Fifth Floor. Well rated, offering french-modern cuisine. Excellent wine list (not just CA wines, strong on Burgundy). Good food. However, over priced. Small but servicable gym. We've stayed at places costing twice as much that haven't matched the Palomar (Klimpton owned).

Reviews.Title: “nice and different”
Reviews.Author: ATourist2day
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is not what we expected. It is very modern and has an understated European luxury feel to it. While the room was immaculate, it seemed small and the bathroom door gave little privacy. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 4th floor had an outstanding view! The restaraunt is hidden and there really is no lobby to speak of, so waiting for friends to arrive was not convienent. On departure they offered a Lincoln Town car to take us to the Airport for the same price as a Taxi. A nice touch to end our vacation. All in all, not a bad place to stay. But I felt out of place as a tourist. It seems more like a high end Hotel for the Business traveller. The location was very conveinent to the cable cars, street cars and subway. DavidinHartford.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: heymista
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for large rooms in SF, then Palomar may be a great value. While it is expensive during the week, they have great weekend rates and the rooms are huge in comparison. We had a suite and our friends had a standard room, and we were both very happy with the accomodations. We found the staff very helpful. The only knock I would have is that the restaurant is overpriced. We would definitely stay again. Can't beat the location if you want be near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the palomar in november 2004 for a week. we visit the usa on a fairly regular basis and never book a hotel without checking the reviews on tripadvisor. having read the reviews we decided to book our stay.we were not dissapointed, the rooms are very nice, the bed was the best we have ever slept in, the staff were pleasant and helpful, and the hotel is centrally located, union square being only a few minutes walk away. we never dined in the restaurant but did have breakfast one morning, the food was great if a little pricey, we would definitely stay there again. well worth its four stars.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Palomar!!”
Reviews.Author: funnygirl1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Palomar and it was fantastic! Who cares if they have a coffee maker in their room? Everything about the place was great. We took a morning flight so we got to the hotel way before check-in time. The front desk said "no problem, we can put you in an inside room now or store your luggage while you explore the city and we'll give you a city view room later"! Took the latter suggestion and when we arrived back our room was ready. The room was not the biggest I've ever seen (what in San Francisco is) but was very stylish and clean. The bed was as good as sleeping at home! The Aveda bath products were a great treat! Everyone on staff at the Palomar was courteous, polite and VERY helpful. The location is perfect for Union Square shopping and exploring by public transportation. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great fun...”
Reviews.Author: uniceverse
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Palomar has revived my love for the Kimpton Group hotels. Recent stays at a couple of their locations were a bit disappointing in terms of overall condition and maintanance- no doubt it's difficult to keep up with high room turnover- however this was not at all the case at the Palomar. I never had occasion to use the Concierge but the desk staff was always pleasant and accomodating (a noisy fan in my first room was easily resolved by a move to a new room) with a friendly greeting each and everytime I came or went. The location is unbeatable- being close to Union Square, the business district, public transportation if you need it, etc.- and the rooms themselves are quiet and very comfortable (high marks for the fun and kicky decore) with great housekeeping. A very pleasant expereince compels me to give this hotel very high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: I respectfully disagree with the coffee complainers who have posted recently. If you want that, stay at the chain hotels. This place is for people who appreciate good design. It is residential in feeling, and unbelievably comfortable in that dark-wood, cocoon way. I felt very hip staying here! The front desk staff and bellmen were friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the Fifth Floor restaurant was quite good, if a bit expensive. Can't beat the location, either. For dinner, try Annabelle's a couple of doors down. It is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: MJPBAF
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested we stay at the Palomar because of its location and restaurant. This has put a strain on our friendship. The Kimpton Group, which manages the Palomar, must believe that style is the only thing needed to satisfy its customers. The front desk staff was less than helpful on virtual every request. Don’t bother with the concierge they never return your calls. The coffee being served in Styrofoam cups in the lobby was a nice touch. I can accept a high price for a very small room if it is accompanied by good customer service. That was not the case at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but give me in-room coffee and reasonable wine prices”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar Nov. 18th-19th. Booked their "great rate" of $129. The hotel is very beautiful, and the rooms very nicely appointed. My husband enjoyed the "tall room" with the extra long king bed and high showerhead. Our only gripes were that there are no in-room coffee makers (probably too "tacky" for their decor), and the wines-by-the-glass were extremely expensive. We don't want to have to get dressed and traipse down to the lobby for morning coffee, or deal with pricey room service in the morning just for a cuppa joe. Sorry. (The Relais-Chateaux hotels have the common sense to put coffee/tea service in the hallways, at least.) And while I appreciate their "hand-picked" wine list, they could offer more reasonably-priced selections. It's California after all, land of countless great wineries and of course 2-buck Chuck! Pretentious wine lists don't impress me. I'd consider going back if those two issues were addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Hotel was Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved the hotel. The location is perfect. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the Ferry Building etc... The Bart Station is right under the hotel too. Very convenient to take the Bart to Oakland Airport and a lot less expensive than a town car. (60.00 vs. 5.15). Rooms are ultra-hip and spotless. We had an Executive King on the 5th floor, and the street noise was barely audible. Great view of the Flood Building, and Stockton St. Very comfortable bed, pillows, chair etc.. bathroom has ample counter space and great Aveda products. Their gym is small but adequate. We really enjoyed the Serenity Channel and the Yoga Channel. Great coffee in the lobby every morning too. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff treated us royally and couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the city.....”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Palomar is a small hip hotel. Make sure that if you bring a car that you get the parking package or else it is 36 bucks a day. Location is ok, a short walk to Union Square. A little nicer than the W hotel. Fifth Floor restaurant was very good but not mind blowing, bring a load of money to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: chip_2
Reviews.Content: Picked up the Hotel Palomar thru Priceline and what a surprise. Very pleasant greeting at the door and the front desk and the lobby was small but nicely decorated. Our room, on the sith floor, was very well furnished with a nice mix of textures and colors and a very comfortable bed. I would definitely go back to this boutique hotel and pay the standard rate. It's also located about 1 block from the cable car turnaroud (and BART station) on Market Street. This also puts it about 3 blocks south of Union Square and one block north of the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, Zen place.”
Reviews.Author: talldude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palomar for three nights. It was very nice - loved the leopard skin carpet, as well as the rest of the modern-yet-warm furnishings. Very complete room except for the noticeable absence of a coffee maker. There was, however, free coffee in the lobby until 10:30am. Good location for shopping or tourists. Free wireless internet was great, but the TV did not offer many channels. The "serenity" channel was kind of a kick, and my girlfriend liked the yoga channel. This is kind of a Zen place. (there was even a copy of "The Teachings of Buddha" next to the Bible!) The clock radio could not seem to get decent reception of any channels. The honor bar was well stocked, but pricey (no surprise there). Once again we were happy to find Aveda toiletries, and we took as many home as we could! We found the staff rather helpful, and they were super friendly. Every staff member that passed us would offer a greeting. (certainly mandated by the management) One word of caution: parking was $36 per night! Have dinner at LuLu's if you can - they have a well-stocked bar, and our bartender was great (a blonde, bespectacled woman). Avoid Annabelle's Bistro - we had a bad experience there.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JimB58
Reviews.Content: Palomar review We were put in a very small room (Cruise ship cabin size) rm 519. Cheerful staff, but not really helpful. We asked for additional towels, but they never arrived. The front desk did not have any change for tips (no change for a $20). The Fifth Floor lounge is supposed to close at 12:00 on Friday, but was not serving any more after 11:00pm. The in room safe is located in the small closet, need to remove bag stand and any luggage in closet to access room safe. Could be considered an extra level of security. $36-per day parking charge is the highest I have ever paid. take BART then cab it. There are the usual assortment of bums and winos on Market Street, but not in front of the hotel. This place is not worth the money-definitely not a 4 star property in my opinion. The view of Old Navy from our cabin was a new take on window shopping , some interior rooms had a view of a garden with fountain. comfy bed, very sm bath, pocket door, nice furnishings in room. Other rooms seemed a little bigger than ours. We did not have time when we checked in to request another room. I don't know if it would have helped. Newspapers available only if you ask they are not offered or provided with room service breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, Immature employees”
Reviews.Author: Nshores33
Reviews.Content: The hotel, in itself, was awesome. The room was cute with a nice view and a great location. However, the front desk could care less about you. They made rude remarks about guests in front of me. Hung out talking to each other and ignoring guests. Also, DO NOT use the concierge. We tried 7 times to get alcatraz tickets through them and they never left us a message to confirm whether they succeeded in arranging the tickets. Finally, they told us we were booked and could go anytime. But when we arrived to the pier, we were told that we had a specific time and that we missed our boat. Consequently we had to wait standby for two hours. Terrible service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend found the Palomar while we were serching for a hotel in Frisco without any plans and I can guarrantee that we were surprised by this hotel. The rooms are beautiful, beds are confortable, there lots of space, the bath is great, there is a CD player and the rates are great. I travel all over the world for business and I assure you that the Palomar is one of the best hotel I ever met

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MaddieBBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled to Sonoma to attend a wedding. We stayed one night at the Palomar. The rooms are beautifully decorated. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The bathrooms are gorgeous. However, what most impressed us was the level of customer service the staff provided. Although we only stayed a short time, the staff could not have been more gracious. They allowed us to check in early, booked us a tour of the city, acquired baseball tickets for us, made us dinner reservations, and rented us a car to drive to Sonoma County. I cannot compliment the hotel enough on the level of service and quality of the employees. I recommend the hotel to everyone I know who may travel to San Francisco. I would never stay anywhere else in that city. Bravo and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palomar, hated the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for two nights in August, 2004. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff is outstanding. They go out of their way to assist with directions or whatever you need. However, the area around the hotel is unappealing. Many homeless on the street were upsetting to my kids, who are 11 and 15. Really didn't feel very safe on the streets around there. Wouldn't recommend for families. Complimentary tea and coffee were wonderful in the morning, but it would be nice if they also offered hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: shedeez
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed in the hotel during valentine's day weekend this year. The staff was friendly and decor is very nice and modern. I was told when I booked my room, I'd be given an updated...well, it didn't happen. When we got to our room, it was small. The entrance to our door was right next to another room. We could here those people coming in and out of their room...and we could even hear them play there music loud. The bed was not comfy at all. The pictures of the rooms and bathrooms on the website looks better. I must say though, the hotel is conveniently located near Yerba Buena Gardens, Sony Meteron, Union Square (shopping) and the cable cars. If you don't care about room, but would like something close to everything, then come here. Otherwise, I don't think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, AWFUL service”
Reviews.Author: Colette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar after several days in wine country were we stayed at the Carneros Inn (see my review of that great place!). The hotel is beautiful. Our room (a luxury King) was very comfortable with a large jazuzzi tub for two, a view of Market Street and double insulated windows for quiet. We ate at the Fifth Floor where the food is interesting and thoughtful, I would recommend eating here but staying elsewhere. The problem with the hotel is the service. We called for turn down service twice and only got it upon our third request when the housekeeper knocked on our door at 5pm in response to a 7:30 service request. Okay, fine. Later, when we ordered room service quite late at night, it took 50 minutes, arrived cold and the server did not a pen! Our tub would not drain and they never came to fix it so we would have to wedge a comb under the drain lid to keep it up to drain. When we checked out, we asked for a taxi and was directed to a Town Car that would have cost $20 more than a yellow cab. Some people like that but we found it a bit presumptous. Stay here if you like hip surroundings, just need a room and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that Wreaks Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Balconylove
Reviews.Content: Any traveler that appreciates boutique hotels MUST visit the Palomar when in San Francisco. I spent two nights there after researching boutique hotels on the internet and this one just kept coming back to me as the one to choose. What a great decision!!! For starters great door service, very friendly, informative and helpful front desk, georgous decorated rooms (we had a standard King), a tiny lobby but beautiful and classy, pet friendly (I brought my Yorkie and he received his own water & food bowls), the breakfast was a bit pricey but gourmet, the location is right in the heart of everything in San Francisco and yet you can't hear a sound from inside the rooms knowing that just outside is the hustle and bustle of the city!A simple yet lovely Zen Garden accentuates the inner courtyard of the hotel from window view. Great decor!!!! WE LOVED IT!!!!! Everything was fantastic! Next trip we plan on trying out one of their suites. This hotel is a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is amazing...”
Reviews.Author: JackieDC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was everything I had hoped for- so much that I’m not sure to begin! I found the Palomar through an air/hotel package for a great price, and we visited from July 15th to the 18th. Our flight arrived earlier then the official check in time, but the staff allowed us to check in, which was nice. Located right off of 4th street in downtown SF, the Palomar proved to have an amazing location right off of Union Square. The lobby was sophisticated and a bit on the small side, but that is not a complaint! The employees were gracious and professional every time we passed them on our way out or in, no matter the time. The room was on the trendy side of gorgeous: spacious with comfortable beds, a great size bathroom, and several amenities (cd player, fax machine, and cordless phone, added to the money safe and locked bar). Our view was toward Union Square, but the lights weren’t a problem when the curtain was closed, and we couldn’t hear any noise from outside. The bar/restaurant was a great addition as well (martinis were wonderful). The day we checked out the hotel kept our bags until out flight left to allow us to sightsee with ease, and reclaim out baggage quickly. Simply put, our stay was perfect. The Hotel Palomar was one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at, and I will be staying there again when I return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Feb of 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved it. Simply put it was a great hotel in the heart of SF. You are by the Bart Station and the Trolley cars. You are near a Walgreen’s so if you are missing any of your toiletries or looking for that small snack you can go there in a heart beat. The Lobby is small but it makes it up for its decor and service. The rooms were great. I had plenty of room with a nice view of the city. The noise level was that of a city so I was fine. They had ample closet space and within the closet was a user friendly room safe. The bed linins were soft and the pillows not rock hard or super soft. I had a wonderful good night sleep with their comfy bed. It was very nice to have a mini stereo system that allowed me to play my CDs and they offered Yoga straps, blocks and mats if one wanted to practice yoga along with the program they play on the Hotel TV channel. The bath products were Avada so very user friendly and not to mention great product line. The mini bar was well stocked with great products if one chooses to indulge. The maid service was prompt and changed my linins and towels each day. I ate the 5th restaurant which is rated one of the best in the city. Great food with lots of creativity. They had an extensive wine list which one should not miss. The food was not only presented well but taste was absolutely to die for. The fusion of east and west was well established and melded well. Believe me I have ate my fair share of bad fusion food. Overall this is a great hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: joanas
Reviews.Content: Have stayed 8 days at the Palomar, and overall, it was a wonderful experience. We had a suite, and my son loved that, because he had his own TV!!! There is a fabulous bathroom with a jacuzzi, and the bedroom furnishing is lush with faux animal skin carpet and emerald green velvet... There were double paned windows, so sound was never a problem. Staff was friendly and helpful. Area was close to many things, though I personally did not feel the safest walking around at night(then again, in which city does one these days?) Would absolutely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Made my 30th Birthday Special”
Reviews.Author: Beardsh
Reviews.Content: The Palomar was my first destination when visiting the West Coast in February 2004. We stayed for 5 nights and I celebrated my 30th birthday there. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food but found it be ideal for our needs, perfectly situated, modern and clean and the staff were excellent. We turned up out of the blue one day with a couple of bicycles we had hired and they kindly helped us to store these for a couple of nights. Staff recommended places to go and eat and were pleasant and helpful at all times particularly when it came for us to hire a car, they provided a map and directions to our next destination - Lake Tahoe. Our last night we booked to stay at the far more expensive Parc 55 hotel and it was appalling. Situated right on the edge of the rough part of town, Tenderloin. If you want a large grand fancy lobby with crap service, small dirty rooms and staff who are uninterested and barely speak English then I strongly recommend Parc 55. If however, you want a clean, stylish and tranquil place to relax then the Palomar will be right up your street. I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. I wish so much we had booked in here for the last night of our holiday and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Four star location, one star service”
Reviews.Author: RStokes
Reviews.Content: The palomar is an elegant hotel with a good central downtown location. The restaurant is rated highly by a number of gourment magazines and rooms are pleasant if on the small side. However the front desk staff have no interest in helping customers outside of routine check in and check out. Service is more akin to a 1 star hotel. I would rate the hotel 4 stars for location and 1 star for service

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Zero Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: browngt5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar for three nights (06/02-06/05) and had a wonderful experience. The location is perfect: close to Union Square, Market Street, and Transit. Very stylish hotel with modern decor and comfortable beds. We had a eighth-floor room facing Fourth Street, but noise was never a factor! The service from check-in to check-out was flawless and pleasant. Mel's Diner, one-half block away, is a reasonably priced and good option for breakfast. If you bring a car, the Fifth & Mission Garage is a half-block away and is only $20 a night. Well worth the extra $$$, since there are definitely some crummy hotels in this city!

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best place we've stayed in SF and we go up there frequently! The biggest problem I find in SF hotels is the street noise, especially in the older boutique hotels. This place is whisper quiet (we had a courtyard facing room). The room itself was very nice. Dinner at the Fifth Floor was as good as I had hoped for! Another bonus is ease of both getting there and getting back out to the freeway. This can be a huge pain in many locations. The Palomar is now at the top of my list for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanapepe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The rooms are avg. size, very clean, stocked with all the ammenities you need. Staff is very helpful. Location is near shopping, cable car turn around and convenient to public transportation which is so reasonable. If you get a room away from the street it's very quiet. Their top rated restaurant has fabulous food with astronomical prices. Wait staff is enthusiastic tho a tad young. Omly drawback that being on Market St. you see a lot of pan handlers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite!”
Reviews.Author: SuzInAZ1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Palomar the weekend of 3/14/04 - it was a belated Valentine's Day gift from my husband. In that I love boutique hotels, this was another pleasant surprise in the heart of downtown San Francisco (my fav being the Pan Pacific). These rooms were much larger, and although the bathroom was not as elegant as the Pan, the Fuji bathtub was wonderful - so good for soaking the feet after hitting the streets all day. I filled it to the brim knowing that I was depleting the world of water!! It was very very relaxing. The room was a bit too contemporary for me, but did not detract from my stay. I have two complaints about the room. The way our suite was set up, you couldn't sit on the sofa and look directly at the t.v. You had to lay on the sofa to be head-on with the t.v. Also, there are no coffee making faciliites. In a room that is over $400/night, you would expect to find such a convenience - after all...you get that in the $59/night Best Western! My big gripe with the area, not the hotel, is that you are in downtown San Francisco, and there are few good restaurants around, so it's either order from room service or go to the bistro down the street (and by the way, room service gets its food from the bistro down the street). So if you are going to stay at the Palomar, keep that in mind. You will either have to go to the financial or theater district or go elsewhere. If you DO get to Fisherman's Wharf, eat at Scoma's - they have the best (albeit expensive) seasfood going! I'd stay at the Paloma again, but before I'd go back, I'd stay at the Hotel Monaco - it's sister hotel (both are pet-friendly by the way). BY THE WAY - SKIP THE COURTYARD ROOMS. All you see is 3 other interior walls and you look down through a glass roof into "Old Navy." This is a gripe I almost forgot. We got to the hotel early and stowed our luggage and went to get lunch (see note above about eateries in the area) and do some shopping. We hiked all the way to Chinatown before finding any place for lunch - the hotels in the area do not have coffee shops! Anyway, the front desk told us to be back at 2 pm, and we were, and our room still wasn't ready. The staff said that the people were still checking out. They had us wait in the 5th floor loung, very very dark- no coffee pot, no water, no nothing but couches & lounge chairs. 45 minutes later, I sent my husband to complain. The front desk said the couple had spilled something on the carpet & they were cleaning it up, and did we want an "interior" room instead. DO NOT GET AN INTERIOR ROOM (see note above). If we had been given our exterior room, we would have been able to sit there and watch the St. Patrick's Day parade on Sunday. The view stunk. All in all, maybe I won't go back there again. I think I'll stay down by the Wharf where there's tons of restaurants & things to do (but I STILL loved that bathtub)!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor service, and fraudulent advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 6 nights in March. I found a deal for 137/night on Orbitz and I saw on Palomar's website that they offer to match any internet rate and to include with that a free upgrade to the "best available room" (offer has since changed to "best room in next 'tier.'" While they honored the rate, the refused to honor the upgrade, even though a quick check on the web showed that better rooms were available. (I read about this exact problem right here on trip-advisor reviews, so I wasn't surprised). They basically said that the room I got WAS an upgrade, because it was an exterior room, instead of an interior room. This is just ridiculous, because their website, on which they promise the upgrade, makes no mention of this distinction. And besides, the deal we were offered said "best available room," not "slightly better room." When I discussed this problem with Brian Fenwick, the general manager, he was rude and unhelpful (another review on this website makes this same point; take note, Kimpton Group!!). He claimed that the website booking system was incorrect about better rooms being available and that I WAS, in fact, in the best available room. Before speaking with Brian, I had a friend call the front desk and try to book a suite; she was informed that they had several suites available. When I told this to Brian, he said that while the rooms may be available to others for booking, but that they were "allotted," so he was unable to upgrade me. This is nonsense. I'm not sure what is more disturbing: that they wouldn't honor the upgrade, or that Brian would tell a bold-faced lie and say the rooms were unavailable. Besides this unpleasantness, the hotel was fine: a nice big room, service once a day (although they say you should get it twice), and a big clean bathroom. Just don't expect the web upgrade deal to be honored.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure to stay at the Palomar on numerous occasions. While my husband was working in San Francisco it became our second home. The rooms are large by city standards, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, and they have one of the best restaurants in the city. I always recommend this hotel to friends if they are going to stay in the San Francisco.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palomar San Francisco - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12 Fourth St, San Francisco, CA 94103
